name: Cindy Brown

These people took the worst and somehow turned it into the best. From the bottom of my heart, thank you.

It was a privilege to be there for you throughout the services for your beloved mother and grandmother and I am touched by your trust in us.  Know that you are in our thoughts and I hope you will reach out if there is anything more we can do for you.  -Jon Smith, General Manager

text: We want to express our experience with Brady and Nathaniel at Magnolia Cremation.  Two of the finest most compassionate men at a very difficult time for our family. name: Vincent Seabrook
text: Brady was phenomenal. He made a very difficult time for us a little bit easier to deal with. He was the right person to assist at the right time! He was an answer to our prayers. He made an indelible impression on our family. If there were 6 stars, he’d get it. How we long for the day when death will be no more-Revelation 21:3,4, but in the meantime there are those like Brady who handle matters related to death,  with the sympathy and professionalism needed. Thank you Brady for all you did for our family!  Keep up the good work.

name: Elizabeth Childress
text: If you looking to be rush or things not done professionally this is the place for you. My mother passed Nov. 21, 2019 hospice recommended Brady and his team. Although some of his things were ok. Its January 23, 2020 and we still haven't received my mother headstone. He also messed up her birth date and messed up the death certificate as well. He has had plenty time to fix the issue and still has not.

name: Del Chick
text: I am absolutely disgusted on how the owner, Brady, treated me regarding my mother‘s ashes! We had a good initial meeting, but after that he would never give me the update, never did her memorial cards for her services, and never put her in an urn for me! I had to call him on 4 occasions and ask for the update! Finally I told him I don’t want his urn ( it was a special order, his recommendation too), just give me my mothers ashes!   I was promised ALL of it within 10 days, but CERTAINLY not 1 month and 4 days later !!!.  My God,  what would I have done if her memorial service was within 3 weeks of her demise?!   This is very sad.  Having to file a complaint now. Owner will lie to you about when you can expect to receive your loved one. My advice to anyone reading this ... PUT this purchase on a credit card and have the charge investigated and DISPUTED  if you DON’T get the services you are promised!    My husband had to go pick up my mothers ashes, that Brady had in a cardboard box, and we took them to another very sophisticated funeral home. I got an acceptable urn, and memorial cards that I had wanted.  All in time for her memorial services.  Brady has unscrupulous business practices and should not be in business!  The ONLY REASON  I went to Brady is because he came highly recommended from the hospice organization my poor mother was with! I called them immediately, on the 34 days later,  and told them “don’t you dare recommend him to anybody in the future!”  They agreed with me, as does an Attorney, the Credit Card company, ALL of my family, and every single person I’ve told!   When  you lose a very dear family member, especially if it’s your Mother, you better become extremely TOUGH  because a funeral director like Brady is going to prey on your weaknesses!

text: Funerals are a touchy subject. Morrison's has always taken good care of our family when we have had a loved one pass on. Very professional and highly skilled.

name: Cheryl Matthews
text: Morrisons Funeral Home has always been great with my family members and friends. Very helpful during your time of need.

name: Morgan Pfaelzer
text: I do not live in Alabama, so when my father passed while at a nursing home in Northport, I had to quickly look for a place for cremation. Joe was quick to answer the phone and gave clear pricing, which ended up being much more affordable than other places in the area. They notified me when my father’s body arrived at Wills Funeral Service. Then Val quickly followed up with a phone call and an email with all the relevant forms I needed to fill out. Once that was completed later that week, they overnighted my father’s cremains. Unfortunately, the Post Office lost the package, at no fault of Wills. I was so very grateful for the hard work Joe, Val and everyone at Wills did to constantly contact the USPS and find my father’s cremains and have them safely delivered to me. It was a relief for me to not have to attempt dealing with the Post Office customer service while grieving and stressed. Wills packaging kept everything safe and secure. At all times, everyone at Wills was courteous, polite, and professional. I highly recommend Wills Funeral Services.

name: Vernon Boone
text: They did a great job with the services for my Father.. Great people , would recommend them .

I would HIGHLY recommend using Sunset Memorial when you have to lay a loved one to rest. You will not be disappointed.

text: I have been meaning to write a review for a very long time but, one gets caught up in every day life. My wife had her mother buried about over a year or two ago at Sunset Memorial. Mr. Byrd made sure to take the time and address all of our concerns. He is a truly sincere caring person who will treat your love one with the dignity and respect they so deserve. The Sunset Memorial grounds are uplifting and gives you a sense of inner peace.  Sunset Memorial greatly reflects the dedication and pride of the Byrd family and Staff.

resp.text: Thank you! What beautiful words! We are honored to have served your family.

name: Lynn Cleghorn
text: I work for a funeral home in Birmingham,  AL and attended a service at Sunset yesterday for my Godmother Rose Shirley.   I have to say that this facility is absolutely beautiful.  The service was beautiful and the staff considerate.  When we were going to the honor salute outside,  one of the directors saw my 82 year old grandmother and I coming to the pavilion and he left the pavillion to come show us a bench for her to sit on.  That is total service and care. Even though I work for a different company I have to say you guys are awesome!

resp.text: Wow! Coming from another funeral professional, your words mean a lot. Thank you so much.

name: Tami Darley
text: We have had several family members pass away over the last few years and Mr. Robert and his team are not only professional, but genuine and caring. It means a lot when you have complete faith in those to whom you entrust your most prized treasure; those you love.

resp.text: Thank you Tami! We understand how important it is to have someone you can trust during such a difficult time. We are glad you felt it.

name: Erica Ransom
text: I lost my mother in July 2015 while she was out visiting in Texas, and I called Sunset Memorial since they'd handled the arrangements for my grandmother and a cousin of mine years in the past. I believed their reputation of being professional and accommodating being that my mom was so far away from home. My mother's transport and burial service went fine. But now, 6 months later, there is still no  headstone on my mother's grave. I've called several times in the last 5 months to ask when they would set the headstone.  Each time I'm either blown off, or made a very convincing promise that it will be taken care of right away. Nothing ever gets done. My family has gone through our first Holidays without my mom, and I'm sure Sunset Memorial has no concern about the numerous calls I get from upset family members that can't find her grave site when they go to visit her. Her birthday is coming up in 2 days, undoubtedly with the same result. No headstone in her memory. The last time I called a few days ago, I spoke to Ben (again) who made it a point to mention to me that "they'd been busy" (for 6 months, apparently), "it's been raining" (for 6 months, apparently), and he reminded me that they do the headstone "free of charge" (which I'm sure isn't accounted for anywhere in my $13,000 payment to them, made immediately and in full 6 months ago).  I deeply regret using Sunset Memorial for my mother's arrangements. She's laying in an unmarked grave, for 6 months now, and Sunset Memorial could care less. If you want people that truly care beyond when the check clears, take your loved ones elsewhere. I wish that I did.

name: jerome hightower
text: Thank you and the staff for such ❤️ counseling with my planning inquiry.

resp.text: You are so welcome Jerome. Thank you for contacting us. It is our honor to help people when they are making such important, personal decisions. Have a great day!

name: Jabe Fincher
text: Very gracious and caring staff. Nice facilities

name: Jackie Sievers
text:
We laid mom to rest this afternoon in a short but beautiful service. Quite a few of mom’s friends attended and gave much needed comfort to my stepdad and myself. I would like to thank Fuqua/Bankston funeral home for the outstanding service they provided us from start to finish. They were extremely compassionate and made sure our every need was taken care of. They had a table with my mom’s urn on it but what they did to that table brought tears to my eyes. Mom was an avid gardener, seamstress and quilter. They had placed a handmade quilt, a sewing basket on the table and garden rakes on the side in her honor. My stepdad and I placed a cross, Star of David, the family photo and the photo of her two birds in the burial vault. Rae placed a red rose, I placed a pink rose and Joshua honored his grandma with a beautiful carnation in her urn.

We most definitely recommend them.

name: LeighAnn Gunter
text: Wonderful ppl wonderful services!

name: John Burns
text: Compassionate staff

name: Ronald Powell
text: Extraordinary support in planning the service from Minnesota to Alabama,  and thereafter in executing the memorial event, was outstanding. The accessibility and communications with the funeral Director, Michael Stewart, was both compassionate and continuous.  Support from staff, including Ken Spencer and Emily Sonneland, was equally helpful.

resp.text: Ronald, we understand that people come to us during the most emotional and challenging times, so it is incredible to know that my team and I constantly demonstrated our dedication to going above and beyond in our support during your loved one's service.  Please know we are here for you if you need anything else, and thank you very much for your kind message.  -Michael Stewart, General Manager

name: T Ewing
text:
If I could give zero stars I would. Not only has Michael Stewart been the epitome of unprofessional while speaking to my mother and I. This company contracted with an individual who had zero legal authority to sign any contracts or issue payments on behalf of my father. They were put on notice that my father does have children and by law are the NOK. This facility has refused to release the records on my father. They entered an illegal contract and are hiding behind a privacy law that does not exist in the case of my father. He was a veteran and so am I. Never in my life did I ever think I would serve a country in which the citizens act in such a manner. Instead of making a wrong situation right this company would rather stand on the side of wrong. Do not conduct any business with this company as they have a history now of processing illegal documents and when asked to relinquish the records they want a civil lawsuit before doing so. What a great country I have served and live in!

2006 Alabama Code - Section 26-2A-79 — Termination of appointment of guardian; general.
A guardian's authority and responsibility terminate upon the death, resignation, or removal of the guardian or upon the minor's death, adoption, marriage, or attainment of majority, but termination does not affect the guardian's liability for prior acts or the obligation to account for funds and assets of the ward. Resignation of a guardian does not terminate the guardianship until it has been approved by the court.

2006 Alabama Code - Section 43-8-40 — Intestate estate generally.
Any part of the estate of a decedent not effectively disposed of by his will passes to his heirs as prescribed in the following sections of this chapter.
2006 Alabama Code - Section 43-8-48 — Parent and child relationship.
If, for purposes of intestate succession, a relationship of parent and child must be established to determine succession by, through, or from a person:

(1) An adopted person is the child of an adopting parent and not of the natural parents except that adoption of a child by the spouse of a natural parent has no effect on the right of the child to inherit from or through either natural parent;

(2) In cases not covered by subdivision (1) of this section, a person born out of wedlock is a child of the mother. That person is also a child of the father, if:

a. The natural parents participated in a marriage ceremony before or after the birth of the child, even though the attempted marriage is void; or

b. The paternity is established by an adjudication before the death of the father or is established thereafter by clear and convincing proof, but the paternity established under this paragraph is ineffective to qualify the father or his kindred to inherit from or through the child unless the father has openly treated the child as his, and has not refused to support the child.

(Acts 1982, No

resp.text: Thank you for making me aware of your concerns.  As previously discussed, Heritage Chapel Funeral Home followed Alabama law regarding control of disposition at the time your loved one came into our care. Please contact me at Douglas.Foshee@Dignitymemorial.com if you wish to discuss this matter further. – Keith Foshee, Market Director

name: ja pa
text: A beautiful setting and kindness and gentleness from all staff at a difficult time. resp.text: Ja Pa, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional service. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. -Michael Stewart, General Manager

name: Nikki Price
text: Seven months ago (April 8th 2019) my brother and I walked into Heritage Chapel Funeral Home heartbroken and lost. We didn’t know what we were doing or where to even start. Michael Stewart, Sherri and the rest of the staff welcomed us and walked us through step by step. They were kind, patient and very helpful. Not one time did we feel like we were being pressured into buying anything. They took the time to learn about our Dad so that his service would be personalized to him perfectly and it was. Yes, I realize that this is their job but I feel like they went above and beyond. Their attention to detail and how they were able to pull it all together in a short amount of time was impressive. We can’t thank them enough for helping us honor our Dad. I highly recommend Michael Stewart, Sherri and staff at Heritage Chapel Funeral Home. They exceeded our expectations. #5stars⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️-Nikki P.

resp.text:
Nikki, we are proud to know we have gone above and beyond your family's expectations, as we want every experience to be easy and seamless. Thank you for recognizing our professional and compassionate care and please do not hesitate to let us know whenever you require our assistance.
-Michael Stewart, General Manager

text: Wonderful staff. They made a difficult time more bearable and assisted with everything we needed. Mike and Sherry and Lee were all amazing, professional, and comforting.

text: Caring and compassionate.  Wonderful staff.

resp.text: Terri, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering caring and compassionate service. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. - Michael Stewart, General Manager

name: Bill Motes
text: Mr. Michael Stewart, the manager/funeral director of Heritage Chapel Funeral Home in Tuscaloosa, AL, is, in my opinion and the opinion of my family, outstanding.  He is the kind of manager/director that a family hopes for in their time of sadness and great need.  For my wife's funeral, Michael and his staff made sure that every wish of the family was addressed.  They were there for me and each member of my family at every turn, always asking what more they could do to make the process easier for us.  Michael on numerous occasions went out of his way to make sure that my wife's Celebration of Life Service met the family's every wish.  Every detail was carried out almost to perfection.  And, most importantly, these details were addressed in a genuinely caring and compassionate manner.  Of this I was not surprised because I came to know that Mr. Stewart and those under his direction are truly caring and compassionate individuals.  I feel so very grateful to have had Michael and his staff on my side during this most difficult time.  He is, in my opinion, one of the very best mangers/directors that the funeral industry could hope to have.  I got the impression from our very first meeting that being a manager/funeral director was not just a job, but rather a 'true calling'.  Mr. Stewart is truly special, as is every member of his staff.  I will be forever grateful to Michael and his staff for their attention to detail and their unwavering support through this most challenging time.

text: Mike Stewart and his team went above and beyond to not only make this process easier during a difficult time, but also as personal as possible for our family.

text: Mike Stewart and his team provided excellent service for us. Sincere, sensitive, caring. When it’s your mom, you want someone special to assist with the arrangements and their execution. Mike is a seasoned professional. Highly recommend. Thank you, Mike.

name: Joe Sullivan
text: Heritage chapel handled the services for my mother and father in the 1990s. They were super in every respect and they have my total confidence. Turns out my mother had a burial life insurance policy I didn't know about. The insurance company wanted verification, such as from the funeral home director. Heritage Chapel was very kind to look back into their archives and find the record of the service and complete the form for me. One example of "above & beyond the call" service. Thanks so very much!

name: S Bunker
text: Mike Stewart and team helped me out immensely with a somewhat tricky case.  I was not family with but had POA and medical POA with the deceased and was to be her executor as she had no family.  My friend passed while I was out of country and I called Heritage.  Had never known it existed but a friend recommended it.  Wow.  They took care of the body from the hospital and let me know that when I returned the rest could be taken care of.  They even helped with the obit and processing it with the Tuscaloosa News.  I cannot stress enough how professional, caring, and beyond competent these people were.  You will be in good hands.

name: Melinda Gates
text: They provided a great service for one of my dearest friends funerals.

resp.text: Thank you for your gracious comment, Melinda. I offer my condolences, and I hope you will let us know if there is anything we may do for you in the future. -Michael Stewart, General Manager

name: Scarlett Gaddy
text: We utilized the services of Heritage Chapel Funeral Home when my Dad passed and were very pleased. Mike Stewart and his staff treated us with consideration and were very helpful in our time of sorrow.

name: Kermit Foster
text: I have attended services all over the country, but Mike, Lee, Sherri and the other directors at Heritage Chapel provide a level of service that cannot be matched anywhere else.

name: Zigi Onye
text: This funeral home was very clean and cozy. This is a great place for a dearly departed loved one to meet Christ.

name: Diana Jones
text: Kind and friendly people. They did such a wonderful job with my mother's funeral. We couldn't have asked for anything more..

name: Coy Bailey
text: Great friendly service. They are there for you during the hard times.

name: Amanda Kay Whiddon
text: My brother was laid to rest next to our maternal grandparents, paternal grandfather, paternal great and great great grandparents, several cousins and aunts and uncles.  I enjoy going to this cemetery and have never felt a negative presence there.  It is clean and the lawn is manicured by the facilities staff.

name: Melissa Clark
text: I will start off by saying that the crew that works the funerals are all great and they go above and beyond to make sure everything goes smoothly. Now as far as the employees that are inside the funeral home are very nice and respectful for most part. My problem is that one of the female employees and I do not remember her name but from what my husband says is that she is the office administrator. She is perhaps a little to friendly but only with men. My husband and myself attended a relatives funeral service on Friday January 8, 2021 and as everyone was standing around talking my husband went to ask a question for some help because we were going to purchase some spaces here. So he came back after a few minutes and said he would not be buying spaces from their until they got rid of the women at the front who told him that she would be more than happy to help him with anything he needs especially if it does not have anything to do with funeral business. He then told her he was married and just wanted to know about the plots and she said well marriage doesn't matter to me I promise I will not tell your wife anything.  I did not want to cause any big drama while at my families funeral as I was already grieving.  I really hope that the manager does something about this woman because it is very unprofessional not to mention the way that she was dressed it should never be alright to wear skirts that short unless you work somewhere less professional. I hope this post helps any other married woman who does not want her husband to be hit on at a funeral then do not go here.

name: Matt Dugas
text: I visited Ward Wilson Funeral Home a few weeks ago and it was a wonderful experience from beginning to end.  First, the funeral home is beautiful, well maintained and very modern.  Second, the staff is caring, kind and considerate and very happy to explain and answer your questions.  Third, they provide funeral services that fit your needs and personality.  They are the best around!

name: Leila Chanid
text: First of all the man and woman they had to get my grandfathers dead body couldn’t handle the weight and my Uncle had to step in and help carry his own father to the gurney. Secondly, The hearse driver was too fast.. maybe he was trying to keep up with the state trooper but they should be in sync with one another for a funeral..  Also, the casket was so heavy and they told us 4 men would be enough without bothering to tell us how much the casket weighed. The facility is nice and the people were kind. The preacher had a nice story but we expected a lot more consideration and organization from a funeral home as Ward Wilson.

name: Louette Saylor
text: For years Gober Funeral Chapel was the only funeral home in town.  They have been a trusted business for years and have maintained their excellence throughout.  They have always treated my family with care and respect.  They were wonderful through the whole process, while dealing with the recent loss of our beloved Mom.  Gober Funeral Chapel's level of professionalism and kindness helped take the hard, commercial edge off things.  They made us feel comforted and cared for, just like we were family!  They were accommodating to our needs and there is nothing that could have been done any better, than the services we received.  Our whole family was very pleased!  From Ricky to Greg to Harold and everyone else, they were all wonderful!!  Highly recommend!

name: Amy Allen
text: They were caring, kind, open to ideas, and every part of my Daddy’s service went smoothly and beautifully. It’s already a rough experience with a passing of a loved one but I cannot express how amazing the staff was for me. After it was over I discussed the cost with another person and they couldn’t believe that I had that many cost options. I highly recommend. It’s not about new and shiny buildings and flashing lights,, it’s about comfort and care. Trust me, they deliver. My Daddy would’ve been very impressed. He looked amazing! My family has used them for years.

name: Mark Green
text: Services are good but the building needs to be remodeled. It has the "discount"'funeral vibe to it.

name: Cindy Walker
text: In the last 3 yrs.My Family has had the pleasure of Heritage Memorial Funeral Home.. For 19 of my Family members and friends.The Staff has been very good and very helpfull showing my family The Up most Compassion and love.kindness heartfelt condolences to me and everyone in our family. I will always use this Funeral Home.Thank you so much for everything you have done for me and my family.Randy and Staff we love you, Cindy Walker.

name: Missy Sammons
text: They did a wonderful job with the arrangements but made a very mean comment about my mother after she passed from Ovarian Cancer. Don't tell the family that she was not a small women when she had over 50 pounds of cancer fluid on her. You need to think before you speak to a grieving family.  We were very well aware of her size due to her cancer.

name: The Lucy Family
text:
We paid $10k. Changed obituary to untrue facts and posted in places we did not authorize. This was seen by others and was greatly frustrating. I told the director and he had an attitude that was rude and unprofessional and did not change it. Then later stated I was going to love how young my dad looked. My dad looked horrible he is a white man and they made him look very dark. It didn't even look like him. Very disappointing!
Many people commented on how horrible he looked. He didn't look that way when left our home to go there. I will never recommend them or use them.

name: Rita Chambers
text: Well,as far as ratings mine has been removed, ,but for anyone interested pm me and I will be happy to give you details ...we picked out the best and paid cash and was treated worse than animals....you can easily find me on fb...since what I put on here gets erased.

name: Mark Green
text: The nicest funeral home in town! Friendly and knowledgeable staff.

name: Josh Jennings
text: Our family has dealt with loosing loved ones and this funeral home is very kind and has accommodating facilities for large groups.

name: Nerjo Dela Cruz Jr
text:
(Translated by Google) i home aklan

(Original)
i bahay aklan

name: terrunder lipscomb
text: I love this place. Tony & his entire family did a wonderful job with my Mother Daisy Lipscomb  & a month later Roy Lee White. Taylor Funeral Home has always been wonderful.  My mom love them so much. My entire family love them also. Keep doing the faithful  & wonderful things you all do to make families happy.

name: Evelyn Pearce
text: If I could give Taylor Funeral Funeral Home of Phenix City, AL -5 stars, I would. They were absolutely terrible. The staff, or at least the women that work in the front, showed no sympathy or compassion for my family. I was there to bury my father-in-law and ran into some of the rudest women I have every met, especially in that type of industry. I think the Taylor family has gotten too comfortable in the city because they have been around for so long, and they take for granted that people will continue to use them. They need to do better, or get out of the business. Learn some compassion.

name: Laterra Lane
text: I have NEVER experienced the amount of disrespect for a mourning family that Taylor funeral home has shown. The amount of attitude that the staff showed was extremely rude. I couldn’t even sit and pay my respects to my grandmother because I had to actually RUN her funeral because Taylor funeral home was “short-staffed”. Yet, during my grandmother’s funeral there were 2 wakes going on at the exact same time. The staff didn’t even have enough decency to close off our side to separate a funeral from the wake. Imagine hearing other families scream and crying out loud while you are trying to actively lay a family member to rest. I was told 2 days prior to the funeral that music would not be provided and I would have to find a live band??? WHERE THE HELL WAS I GOING TO FIND A LIVE BAND IN TWO DAYS!!!!! Then the next day I was told i could provide music by a cd but because they were short staffed I would have to get up and turn the music on and off myself during the funeral. Evone the funeral director had no compassion or empathy. The look of “I could care less if your grandmother died” on her face was sickening. When I asked the front staff for the rest of my grandmother obituaries. After sucking their teeth and rolling their eyes because I actually asked them to get out their seat, they finally pulled her obituaries out of a bag in which they were stuffed in and some were crumbled up. I will NEVER use this funeral home ever again

name: Jackia
text: At the time of me writing this review I am going through the process of burying my dad. Although I don't like the idea of leaving a review for a funeral home I must say that this experience although it is a very hard and sad occasion, has been a very smooth transition. Taylor was very professional. The facility was very crisp and clean. The staff was thorough, patient, kind and understanding. We did not feel rushed, overwhelmed nor did we feel pressured. Everything was our choice and they went through every detail every step of the way. The pricing was to be expected but the breakdown was very clear. They were so patient, answering questions and going over things more than once. I am so glad we were recommended to them. They are taking great care of my mother and her wishes for my dad. And to top it off he looks great. I can honestly say he does look like he is sleeping. They left no stone unturned, every detail was precise and I know my dad would be pleased. Hopefully I will not need their services anytime soon but I am glad to know they are there. Thank You!

name: Towanna Thornton
text: Thank you so much for your professional and generous service. The staff is amazing. I will highly recommend anyone to your business. God Bless you all and keep up the good work. Job well done.

name: Trisha Barrett
text: Thank you for taking care of so many of our relatives; Aunt's,  Uncles,  nephews, Father's and even our brothers. We have never been disappointed with your work,  we love you as the family that you all are. May God continue to be a blessing to each of you. Just wanted to add a note that we were well please with the handling of our Dear Mother. God Bless...

name: Jo Cook
text: Thanks to everyone that provided an excellent quality of service for my sister Patricia Ann key Morgan. God bless you all.

name: PacMan’sMom Jené
text:
These are the absolute worst people I have ever dealt with, they are sneaky...backstabbing, cannot be trusted & will stoop to the lowest to be heard. If they were empathetic people who are to help grievers...they would have social skills of a noble person. They do not. They are cut throat and not worthy of your loved ones to be remembered in such a cheaply decorated place. Colonial is the most authentic, honorable place in Russell County.
Also they up charge on floral arrangements about 180%.
They will also call police if you do not immediately leave the facility when they say your money is out.

name: Gail Pollard
text:
SUCH LOVE AND CARE FROM THEIR FAMILY TO YOURS. THERE IS NO LITTLE YOU OR BIG YOU IN THERE EYE SIGHT EVERYONE GETZ THE SAME LOVE AND ATTENTION AS THE NEXT.TAYLOR FUNERAL HOME IS A BLESSING TO THE PHENIX CITY AND COLUMBUS GA AREA. GOD'S BLESSINGS TO THEM AND YOU
😇

name: Jim Walker
text: Taylor Funeral Home did a great job with my mother and father.

name: johnny hicks
text: I would like to thank taylor  funeral home for caring of my brother rozell hicks they did a great job  they really care about their custom  thank you again from the hicks family god bless you

name: CA Wright
text:
My Alabama family has been using them for a very long time and they are always very courteous.
Thank you for your service and support!

name: Alexandria Lawrence
text: The best funeral home in Phenix City and the Columbus area

name: Wandakay Phillips
text: A very beautiful facility, the staff was very kind and respectful.

name: Julie Smith
text: Very friendly staff. They make planning decisions ahead so the surviving spouse or children do not have to make important choices during a time of grief.

resp.text: Thank you Julie.

name: Jinda
text: I would like to thank Serenity for handling several of my family member funeral services in the past. My family buried my grandpa Khamphou in May 2019, my brother William February 2021, and great grandma Ngone March 2021 at Serenity Garden. They were helpful, polite, and respectful. Thank you again to Mr. Bill, Carole, Cecilia and other staff for taking care of us. I highly recommend this funeral home.

name: Apryl Thomas
text: The Serenity team handled my mothers funeral services with great care. My father and I were very pleased.

name: Jamie Monachino
text:
Serenity handled my dad's services wonderfully. I cannot say enough good things about Bill Clark and how he handled my family and our wishes. Jacquelyn and Cecilia were amazing as well and none lost patience with our many calls and questions.

We did have one guy try to upsell my mom on her own burial arrangements while planning my dad's, which I didn't appreciate. Other than that, we had a good experience with Serenity.

name: Joey Monachino
text:
My father passed away early this month, and we initially were planning on having services at Mobile Memorial Gardens. They were not accommodating so we went with Serenity instead, and I was blown away at their service.

Bill Clark has to be one of the best funeral directors there is. He was extremely helpful, kind, and went above and beyond my expectations. He was a bright spot in a period of time of sadness for my family.

In the unfortunate event of a loved one passing, I strongly and highly recommend Serenity. Bill Clark is wonderful.

name: Mona AJP
text: The services provided by Serenity Funeral Home for my husband's funeral were beyond compare. The expertise, professionalism and compassion demonstrated by Mr. Bill Clark was greatly appreciated during a very difficult time. I highly recommend Serenity Funeral Home.

name: Janna Brown
text: All I can say is with every passing loved one was handled with grace and dignity. Mrs Robin is the most precious soul, she went above and beyond to help me after losing stepfather and one year later my mother. I had no clue what to do and she took every measure to make sure I was taken care of. The gentleman that sold my parents their vaults and plots 30 years ago remembered exactly who they were and so sweet to offer his condolences. They may not be the fanciest off the interstate eye catching building but they genuinely care and see very compassionate to your every need as you are going through that difficult time.

name: Brunese Perryman
text: I recommend this funeral home.. they was very polite and did excellent work on my father.. they have always helped us when we called...my father had cancer when he passed so he lost alot of weight when I saw him for the first time after he passed he looked like he was 40 years old and very handsome I also like the way they remember who you are even from 15 years ago they remember my father,  my grandparents and my best Friend....

name: Michelli Scales Mobile
text:
My Mama was treated with dignity and honor, everything was handled to our wishes.  We are so proud
that we have such a top notch funeral home that is still down home good folks and treated us like family.

name: BillyBravesBama Fan
text: Some of the rudest and unprofessIonal people I have ever met! When my nephew brought coffee out of the break room, instead of being cordial they asked him, "Can't you read that sign?" Save yourself a lot of aggravation and go somewhere else.

name: Venus Stork
text: Some of the rudest people I have ever met. Save yourself more grief than you are already experiencing and find another funeral home.

name: Becky Inglis
text:
I WOULDN'T BURY MY CAT POOP IN THIS PLACE. THE MOST INCONCIDERIAT BUNCH OF A HOLES IN THE STATE!
BURIED OUR MILITARY VETERAN WHILE WE WERE WAITING FOR THE VA TO GET A APPROVAL!
DIDN'T EVEN CALL ANYONE TO LET ANY OF US KNOW!

name: Linda Williams
text: This funeral home has no empathy for you at all after to pay them.  They made two mistakes on my mothers deadth certficate and blamed it on me.  I gave them the paperwork with all of the correct info on it.  They still made two mistake.  When I picked up the deadth certificate they said everyone has people who die.  In other words suck it up and deal with it.  They also got her birthday wrong in the funeral.  OK they  say it is my fault because  I signed off on it.  Excuse me?  I was crying and greiving for my mother.  After paying over $20,000 for my mother and my father just for the funeral alone, you would think they could have a little more empathy.  So, at this point I call the health dept and then the coroner.  The coroner told me the funeral home puts in the info about birth and social security number.  Now I call them up and ask them to change it.  Same thing.  Thanks Serenity.  I will remember how you talked to me and never ever use you again.  I hope you know I plan to spread the word around on the intenet and to my family and friends.  Maybe then you will understand the grief I am feeling.  Thanks for all the empathy you have shown.  (sarcasm)

name: Ralph Creasman
text: I was very pleased with displays and pleasantly surprised by the golf ball mementos provided. Floral centerpieces for tables were unexpected. Overall, the setup, including food, was exceptional. My stepson and I were very proud to be able to provide this for family and friends. I have no regrets at all about choosing Rideouts. Thank you to Jerry Beam and all staff who assisted. Special thanks to Gail who took such good care of us and ran things so smoothly.

resp.text: Martha, thank you for highlighting the golf mementos and floral table pieces that our staff provided and I am glad to know that you and your family were pleased with Gail and our staff's service.  It was an honor to offer the support necessary during this time and I hope you will reach out whenever you need anything.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Stephen Holcomb
text: Obviously when someone passes it is an emotional time. Ridout in Trussville was very helpful and kind. They did everything they could to be considerate of my family's feelings when we made arrangements and with every subsequent step after our mother's passing.

resp.text: Going above and beyond is our privilege and pleasure, Stephen, and it's wonderful to receive your positive sentiments for our team. Thank you so much for your support and for allowing us to help your family honor your beloved mother. If we can ever be of further assistance, please let us know. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Melissa Hyche
text: They gave my husband the most personal celebration of life ceremony I could ask for.

resp.text: Melissa, thank you for trusting us to help you honor your beloved husband. It is uplifting to know that the celebration of his life was everything you could have asked for, and we will continue to be here for you if you need anything at all. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Corla Whitfield
text: In trauma of losing my Daddy and working with my mother who's mind is not what it used to be, and Ridout's being compassionate and busy, my Daddy's funeral had not been scheduled like we had all thought. No worries though, Ridout's worked behind the scenes and made it all come together on the day that all other venues were booked to handle the funeral(church, pastor, cemetery, florist, out of town guest). They were amazing, pulled their resources and made it happen. That's a company that stands by it's customers. I appreciate Jerry and all his hard work and that he went as far as being present on the day of the funeral and handled the smooth movement of the event.

resp.text: Corla, we are beyond grateful that you allowed us to assist you during such a sensitive time of need and I deeply appreciate your lovely words. I will be sure to bring your thoughtful message to the rest of the team and should you need anything else, I hope you will feel free to reach out to us.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Heidi Langston
text: The staff was very professional, very caring and able to guide through the process.

resp.text: Heidi, our utmost goal is to guide those we serve through this journey with professional and caring service, so we are sincerely heartened by your recognition for our staff.  Thank you for sharing and please know that we are always here for you.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Dawn Grubbs
text: I have worked with this location on multiple occasions and have always found them to be thoughtful during a terrible time. They have gone above and beyond to make sure my family was thought of.

resp.text: Dawn, our team strives to provide every family with attentive care so we appreciate you highlighting our efforts in your review.  We are grateful for your recognition and please know that we are always here to go above and beyond for you.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: monty willett
text: Ridout's Trussville acted in an extremely kind,  compassionate manner when assisting our family in making arrangements for our beloved mom. Jerry Beam patiently assisted us in selecting everything that was needed, answered every question and phone call promptly, and displayed selected family pictures beautifully.  The most difficult, painful time in our lives was made a bit more bearable by this expert help coupled with kindness and compassion.  Sincerely,  Gloria Willett

resp.text: Monty, I am touched to hear of your happiness with our services.  Thank you for allowing us to take care of the arrangements for your beautiful mom and please know that your recognition means a great deal to our team. If you ever need us in the future, we will be here for you.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: David Jones
text: The people were excellent and did a great job however I was totally blindsided by the cost. I checked with another funeral director afterwards and Ridouts was higher. The ‘base professional service fee’ was $5695 for a graveside only service.

resp.text: David, thank you for your recognition of our service during this time.  It was certainly not our intention to blindside you and if you would like to discuss this further you can contact me at Jerry.Beam@dignitymemorial.com.  Thank you for reaching out and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Jen Smith
text: Awesome job! Thanks for helping us honor our father!

resp.text: Jen, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional and honorable care. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: TOMMY CRAWFORD
text: My experience with Ridout's Trussville was extremely good.  Vince was very helpful in meeting our special needs and the cost was very fair.  He made our time of loss as easy as it could be.

resp.text: Tommy, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Vince's helpful and easy service is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Rosanne Coleman
text: A great experience.  Dana was very compassionate and caring. I felt comfortable discussing my needs with her.

resp.text: Rosanne, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Dana's compassionate service is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Jean Kirbow
text: Throughout these past two weeks Dana and everyone at Ridout’s have been wonderful and caring. They have helped me through this time of grief.

resp.text: Jean, I am touched to receive your heartfelt recognition and I want you to know that Dana and our team were honored to serve and be there for you during this time.  If there is ever anything more that you need, please do not hesitate to reach out.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Peggy Handy
text:
I had a good response for my Mom's service through Dignity.
Everyone was extremely helpful.  The service was beautiful.  Thank you All.

resp.text: Peggy, we are honored to guide those we serve through this journey.  Our team appreciates your kind acknowledgement and recognition for our team's dedication to helpful service. Thank you for sharing.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Deane Salyers
text: First let me just say that our funeral Director Mr. Bernard was exceptional and was very caring about our needs.   Ridout's Trussville Chapel is a very Beautiful Chapel and the very essence of calmness surrounding our time there, we couldn't have ask for a better experience.  Thank you Mr Bernard for being there.

resp.text: Deane, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Mr. Bernard.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Cynthia Kellum
text: My husband suddenly and unexpectedly and even more shockingly died. He asked that should he die before me to let Rideout Trussville Chapel preside over his Celebration of Life Service.since I love him with all my heart and he loves me, I Honored my husband’s request. I did not know what insurance my husband had nor the cost of the Ridout Trussville Chapel services, but after our planning meeting, and more importantly after I walked into the chapel to see my husband and how beautiful the ambiance in the chapel was with the decor of all my husbands habits that we had discussed, and when I heard the music and the pictures that I personally selected and the decorated tables and centerpieces along with the repass ceremonial snacks and coffee, tea, fruit and cakes, IT FELT LIKE A WEDDING with my husband instead of his funeral. Everything I asked for, I got it. Every staff member was polite and professional as well as compassionate to me, my family and friends. We received top notched service from the planning to the National Military Cemetery which was out of town. I am eternally in love with and married to my husband Reginald Kellum. I am eternally grateful to my representative Jerry Beam, and all the staff at  Ridout Trussville Chapel.

name: Joyce Mcbrayer
text: I've just made my arrangements for the care givers at Ridout's to take my plans in action when Im deceased. I could not have ask for a better staff to help me in my funeral arrangements. They were compassion to my needs an now I'm sure there will be no worries  for my family.

resp.text: Joyce, it is our honor and privilege to ensure everything is prepared for in advance. We appreciate you trusting us to assist you with these preparations, and we are here to attend to anything else you may need in the future. Thank you for your kind message and support. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Jeannie Stacer
text:
We are from out of state so unsure on where to have my dads funeral. After looking at reviews online about Ridout's it was an easy choice. Vince was so helpful with setting up arrangements for us and helping in areas that wasn't even his responsibility.

This was a great experience and would highly recommend to anyone in the future to use this funeral home. If my family could give 10 stars we would!🤲

resp.text: Jeannie, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Vince. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Cindy Attaway
text: I attended the memorial service for all those who were having a difficult time during the holidays after having lost a loved one. The service was very nice and gave all of us a way to celebrate our loved ones as well as helpful information to deal with that loss. The staff showed great respect for our loss and gave us an outlet to express our love. Thank you Ridout’s for being so sensitive to our needs at such a difficult time  of year.

resp.text: Cindy,  thank you for honoring our team with such a thoughtful message. We aim to show respect and sensitivity every step of the way, and it truly fulfills us to be able to make this difficult time easier in any way possible for people during the holidays.  I want you to know that we are here for you and you may reach out at any time.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Steve Adams
text: Jerry and his staff were very helpful after my wife's passing.  They handled the return of her body to Birmingham and assisted me in arranging the funeral, which included coordinating with the Alabama National Cemetery for her burial.  They treated me as though my wife had been part of their family.  The funeral itself was perfectly set up  and was a beautiful celebration of her life.

resp.text: Steve, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was perfect. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your wife, and if there is anything else we may do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Jerry Smith
text:
Dignity/John Ridout’s has taken care of all our family needs, and they have always been wonderful. Trussville has taken of us, recently on more than one occasion and they were simply amazing..
Very caring, and helpful during the most difficult time in a family’s  life.

resp.text: Jerry, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional care. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Brandy Moore
text: They went above & beyond to provide the needs of our family during such an unexpected & difficult time. We appreciate everything they did for us. God bless each & everyone of them.

resp.text: Going above and beyond for those we serve is our mission. Thank you for letting us know you appreciated the service you received, Brandy. It was an honor to be here for you. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Retired
text:
Jerry Beam was awesome handling my Dad’s funeral. He went above and beyond his duties and did everything he could to make this sad and painful process easier for us. I have attended many funerals there and have always been impressed, but this time it was just me and my brother and we could not have gotten through this without his support.
Susan Sims
David Nichols

resp.text: Susan, thank you for honoring our team with such a thoughtful message. We aim to show respect and sensitivity every step of the way, and it truly fulfills us to be able to make this difficult time easier in any way possible.  I want you to know that you and your family are in our thoughts and may reach out at any time. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: DJ Wood
text: Having had a stressful and emotional experience at another funeral home when my mother died, I was expecting the same with the final arrangements when my father died a few weeks ago. The death of a family member should not be made more painful by the business you are relying on to help you through.  Read this carefully and remember these names: Ridouts Trussville Chapel and Tan Alexander.  It takes a special person to do the work needed to help us make decisions when we are in shock and grieving.  Tan is that person. She is comforting, she is experienced, and she is knowledgeable. It is the last two characteristics  that I value most.  Ridouts can handle all the arrangements and funeral service, and Tan has the resources and current information that can help guide you through all the paperwork and phone calls needed after the service and burial. The personal grief is difficult, but everything that comes after can be overwhelming.  If the need arises, you will be well served to contact Ridouts Trussville and Tan Alexander.  Knowledge is everything.

resp.text: DJ, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Tan. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: sherry mcgee
text: Everyone there at Ridouts Funeral Home was very Welcoming, very Friendly,and very Sympathetic and they really helped us out with the price by bringing it over halfway down and working with us knowing that our loved one didn't have life insurance and we were tight on money and couldn't really pay for all the cost of the arrangements and the cremated...I would highly recommend to anyone to let Ridouts Funeral Home in Trussville take care of any and all of your Funeral,and or Cremation needs and any Arrangements you need for your loved ones that has passed because both my Grandma and my Mom passed away within 3-4 weeks apart and we had Ridouts in Trussville set up the Arrangements for both...my Grandma was Buried and the service was Beautiful,and my Mom was Cremated and they showed the same Respect,courtesy,and Friendly service as they did with my Grandma.

resp.text: Sherry, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: eric tipton
text: We had a death in the family and Jerry Beams and the ridout trussville funeral home was wonderful. They took care of everything from start to finish. Definitely recommend them.

resp.text: Eric, from start to finish, we strive to provide support that is compassionate and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal, and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Pamela H. Gamel
text: The experience we had was much easier  and pleasant than we expected. There was an easiness in the whole process that made the whole family comfortable.

resp.text: Pamela, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Linda Anderson
text: The personalization for our daughter was perfect. We loved that we didn’t have to think or plan out anything, it was all taken care of for us.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to be here for you and your family, Linda. It was our pleasure to take care of things for you, and please know that you're in our thoughts. If you should need anything else, we'll be here for you. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Tammy Adams
text: I had a wonderful experience!  Everyone was so loving and helpful. The director Misty made me feel so loved and cared for.  She made the entire stressful process less stressful.  Misty lovingly guided me through something that was very heart wrenching and new to me.  She was so understanding and caring......she always made me feel embraced by the entire staff and she went out of her way to help me with taking care of my loved one in a special remembrance.  I can’t say enough about Misty and the entire staff at Ridout’s Trussville.  I will be forever grateful for all they did before, during and after my loved ones exceptional and unique service❣️

name: DKT Queen
text: The staff was very sympathetic, courteous, and professional.  A special thank you to Vince Shannon who made the very difficult time easier for us to deal with.

resp.text: Debra, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Tara Galbreath
text: I just wanted to take a moment to thank Misty Busic for everything she did for my father's funeral. She went above and beyond and out of her way to make an absolutely beautiful slide show last minute. She was a shoulder to cry on, she comforted our family, and did all she could and more. Your kindness means more than you know to our family. Thank you so much.

resp.text:
Tara, we understand that people come to us during the most emotional and challenging times, so it's incredible to know that Misty and our team have always demonstrated our dedication to going above and beyond. Please know we are here for you if you need anything else.
-Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Brasher Kidz Brasher
text: They are awesome here. I have had three deaths in my family I have had to conduct in three years and they have been so good to me at such a traumatizing time in my life.  I am so blessed to have had the staff here to be so good to me and guide me through this understanding the budget I had. Jerry and Robin, Bernie and all the other staff were so companionate and understanding and patient with me and my family. I trust them 💯 %. Thanks again so much for all the great work you all have done. I can’t thank you all enough !!!!

resp.text: Being here to help you and your family through the difficult times means a great deal to us. It's wonderful that our team has earned your trust, and that you've received understanding, patient, and compassionate care. We're so grateful for your kind words and heartfelt feedback. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Jamie Armstrong
text: I recently decided I needed to make arrangement for when my time come, so I don't have to leave any burdens on my family. Ridout's helped me with making a decision that fits my needs and budget and explained everything in detail. This funeral home is very cleaned and welcoming the staff is very knowable and eager to help and answer any questions. They go above and beyond as you are part of their family. I highly recommend this funeral home to you and your loved ones.

name: Justin Mccarty
text: Misty was beyond kind to me and my mother. I’m so glad we had her to help us at such a difficult time. She made the whole process easy. She kept us up to date and made sure our service for my father was just how we wanted it.

name: Heather Thomas
text: Ridouts Trussville were amazing. They made this process so smooth and easier than expected during such a difficult time. Everyone there was so helpful and extremely nice. Misty made sure that everything I needed was taken care of and all of my questions were answered. Everyone went above and beyond to make sure that my grandmother's funeral was perfect.

name: Claudia Dahlke

Ms. Misty, Mr. Jerry,Mr. John and everyone involved in Barabra Sprays funeral went beyond the call of duty.  I appreciate all that you all did you made everything easy for me.

Claudia

text: I have had to be involved in organizing several funerals over the last couple of years. I would definitely recommend their services to anyone in need.

text: Do it. Go meet with the staff at Ridouts. During this difficult time you don’t want to have to worry if your loved one will look just like they did before or if the service will go as the family would want it. You should have nothing else to worry about but be with family and friends. That is EXACTLY how the staff at Ridouts wants you to feel. Sadly, we’ve had too many loved ones pass in our family. Thank goodness after choosing other funeral homes we found the BEST one in Trussville. The times we have used them everything has went perfectly and took such a burden off of my family that we needed at that time. I’m so thankful for them especially Jerry, the manager, and Tammy, the director. They serve whole heartedly and so compassionate and caring with how they work. Trust them, they will handle everything just the way you want it. Go see them!

resp.text: Brooke, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was perfect. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your loved one, and if there is anything else we may do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.  -Jerry Beam, General Manager

text: My mother passed unexpectedly. Misty worked with our family and walked us through the entire process and on what to expect. She made us feel like family and was open and honest with us. I highly recommend Ridouts.

name: Ericka Smith
text: My family and I had the terribly sad task of planing my father's funeral.  The moment we met Misty (Busic), she made us feel at ease - from the selection of caskets, down to the scripture to be read.   Never once did she make us feel like we were being "sold" and took great efforts to explain every last minute detail.   When we were finished and back in the car, I felt as if I could rest reassured that everything was taken care of and my father would have been very pleased.   I have heard horror stories from family friends in different states when it came to burying their loved ones; thank goodness it was not the case for us.  We are very grateful for Misty and her kind, caring help.

In short, she helped make a very difficult time a lot easier on our family and we really appreciate it.

name: Phillip Hornsby
text: My family has always used the funeral home with the large cemetery. when my grandmother passed and they came to our home to pick her up they were so very rude and it took them 2 hours to get there (we are 5 miles down the street). We stopped them in their tracks and had them leave. we reached out to Rideout's and we were surprised at the service and attention we were given. the staff is compassionate and very friendly and we couldn't have asked for better service. Rideout's will always get the call from our family. Thank you again to your staff for just being kind!

name: Annette Lutz
text: We had the great misfortune to lose our son a few months ago. Since he lived in Alabama and we lived in Georgia, making all the arrangements for his cremation and memorial service could have been very difficult. However,  Jaynee Hall took great care of us and guided us gently through all the details. Because Andrew was a great Alabama fan, we used that as a theme for his memorial service. Jaynee went out of her way to see that everything was perfect, even to having her mom help out with the houndstooth table cloths! She helped make the service a celebration of his life and an occasion that although very sad and emotional, we will always remember fondly.

name: Gina Huie
text: I would like to thank Ridout's Trussville Chapel for the excellent treatment given to me and my family during our time of sorrow. We will always be grateful for the kindness and professionalism from Ridout's entire staff. Sincerely, Gina and Chris Huie and family

name: Mike Sumner
text: Jaynee was so great.  Handled everything.  Everyone was so kind.

name: john doriety
text: Recently my brother (a Marine combat wounded Veteran) passed ,Ms. Misty Busic was designated as the Funeral Director.  Because of my current health status and location in Florida I was unable to attend to any internment details at the National Cemetery.  Ms. Busic  went way beyond her assigned duties to insure my brother received the upmost respect in his internment.  No detail was overlooked.  She took extra initiative in taking appropriate pictures and forwarding them to me which meant a lot to me.  I thank her for her personal attention to details and the sincere respect she showed this Veteran and the "above and beyond" extras she performed.  Thank You

name: mary ROSS
text:
I start with saying "Hat's Off, Kudos, Gracias and strong Thank You to Rideout's in Trussville...

I cannot even begin to express the gratitude and the spirit of excellence that the Management and Staff demonstrated while working side by side and hand in hand with each and everyone of the team members!!!

I had the pleasure of working with them and carrying out one of the largest and most high profile funeral services that the City of Birmingham has seen in quite sometime.  Their attention, compassion and genuine desire to make this precious Homegoing Celebration for the family of Office Wytasha Carter second to none.  I mean from start to finish, they pulled out all the stops.  One can not image the attention to detail, the unknown task, and the sheer undertaking of the entire City, the strategy and planning to expedite a service of that magnitude in one week.  It could not have happened without Rideout's full commitment.

Staff Member Misty worked around the clock tirelessly and left no stone unturned.  Her commitment was 24/7 and I mean literally 24/7 for a solid week.  Carla's attention to meeting EVERY need, her eye for being the visionary and go too was A-1 Tto100%.  If it wasn't in place, Misty and Carla made it happen anyway.  Jerry, Misty, Carla, Steve...etc., truly worked together as a team and ensured that every need was met both in and outside of the box.  Each need was meet in a timely manner with sincere, courteous and professional service.  The "Rideout's Experience" was awesome and is to be commended!!!!  Thanks for EVERYTHING guys...just can't say it enough!!!

resp.text: Mary, our team is touched by your message of gratitude. As we realize that each step of this journey holds great importance, it was a privilege to pull out all the stops. Please know that we are proud to be at your service, and we encourage you to give us a call if there is anything else we may attend to. -Jerry Beam, General Manager

name: Debbie Fortenberry
text: Rideout’s in Trussville, has arranged quite a few funerals for me starting 5 years ago.  With each funeral and the last being in June, 2018, their service has just gotten better and better.  Mr. Jerry Beam has directed 5 services for me or our family in the past 5 years, all I can say is he is GREAT,  he makes it so easy on you to plan for this very sad time you are going through!  Anyone finding themselves having to plan a funeral, please see Mr. Beam, you will have a very good experience and he will walk you through everything you need to do.  I am happy to give Mr. Jerry Beam 5 ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ and John Ridouts in Trussville ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️. Thanks you your service, Debbie Fortenberry

name: Denita Graves
text: Jaynee Fontanez was absolutely amazing and wonderful lady that helped me through a difficult time.

name: johnny Armstrong
text:
As I prepare for retirement in a few months I have been reflecting on things that I needed to take care of before then. One thing was making my final wishes with a Pre Arranged Funeral Plan not only as a peace of mind but also to relieve the burden for my family and loved ones. I will always remember when my Grandmother and Aunt were killed in a train accident back in the early 60's and how devastating it was on my mom and her sister to have to make the Funeral Arrangements for them.
With the guidance and assistance from  David Truss, Family Service Counselor alone with  compassionate and professional staff of
Ridout's Trussville Chapel  I was able to outline and customize my
Pre Planed Funeral Arrangements  - " Celebration of Life " that will express my passions and personality.
I quote  "If you can imagine it we will make it happen."
Pre planning is a sense of peace knowing that every thing will already be taken care of.

name: Gilbert Nicholson
text:
Ridout's Trussville does it right. And it's because of the people. Manager Jerry Beam runs a cracker-jack staff. The tender compassion and sincere interest Jaynee Hall Fontanez took in our family was evident in the way she personally engaged them at my mother's graveside service. What more can you ask for at a time like that?

Perhaps the greatest illustration of ingenuity was Jaynee making lemonade out of lemons. She was told the dove release my mother really wanted at her graveside service was unavailable because it was too far out in the country for the doves to fly back to their owner. Jaynee put her thinking cap on and substituted doves in helium balloons my kids released at the conclusion of the service. It was the great ending my mother wanted to her funeral and meaningful to all who attended.

Meanwhile, the post-funeral meeting a week later with David Truss was extremely helpful tying up loose ends on administrative, and even emotional issues, and addressing details in the aftermath of a death.

I'm so glad we chose Ridout's Trussville Chapel.

name: Kathy
text:
Ridouts has done several of my family's funerals.   My mother's here recently.   That was one of the hardest funerals I've ever had to go through but Jaynee made everything so easy if I didn't know better I would have thought she had known my mother for years.
Jaynee was so compassionate and very understanding with me and all my upsets, questions and changes.  All of the employees that I interacted with were all so very understanding and compassionate.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart for making one of the worst times in my life bearable.
Jaynee Hall thank you for all your hard work and for your compassion,  it has meant a lot to me and my family in the past few months, again thank you all.

name: Roger Hill
text: Beautiful location. Jerry as outstanding. Thank you.

name: Rex Nelson
text: When my dad died in 2009, and my mom in October, 2018, both their funerals were handled by Ridout’s Trussville Chapel. We could not have been more pleased. First, both my parents had burial policies from the 1920s which had cost two hundred dollars. These covered nothing but the very basics, but they had sworn me to honor the policies. I was worried that this would cause us to somehow be treated as “less” by Ridout’s, or at least be subjected to intense pressure to upgrade. Neither was true. Jaynee Fontanez and her staff were understanding, polite, competent, and went above and beyond to make us happy in every way possible. Jaynee even answered my emails on her days off. There was not an ounce of pressure to upgrade, and they treated us as if we had purchased the top of the line. After the visitation, we had a food reception hosted by Ridout’s, and it was both tasteful and tasty. They even encouraged us to take home what was left over. We brought our own table decorations, and they supported that, as well. We brought our own slide show, and they worked with us in every way possible to make sure it came off without a hitch. In short, I could not have been more pleased with the entire experience. The death of a loved one is a very sensitive time, but Jaynee and her entire staff made it the most pleasant experience possible. I thank them for their generosity, kindness and competence.

name: James Bunn
text: My mother recently passed away and we were only interested in cremation services.  A neighbor suggested with contact Ridout's Trussville. There we met Jaynee Hall.  As you might imagine, this is a difficult time, but Jaynee was the absolute best. She handled all the arrangements and guided us through the process.  Her follow up was off the charts.  Everything was done perfectly and I have Jaynee to thank.  She was caring, compasionate and a just a gem to work with.  When the day comes (and it will come) please call Jaynee Hall.  You will not regret it.

name: Anita Knighton
text: I want to make everyone aware of something that happened to me but, I only found out about late last week. When I made the arrangements for my husband's funeral, I was charged for something that I should have received for free due to my husband being a veteran. The only reason why I thought about it was because I received some information in the mail about picking out a marker and one of the other staff members called to check on me and I said something to him about receiving the information in the mail. I am happy to say that he was very thorough and is getting my money back for me.

resp.text: Anita, thank you for allowing us to be of service to you during this time, if you ever need anything more, please reach out to me at Paul.Booker@dignitymemorial.com.  Thank you.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

text: After the funeral Mr. Hollis contacted me and afforded grief counseling should I require it. This was a very personal touch which I greatly appreciated. text: I delivered 2 miscarried babies at home. Robert and his staff were very friendly and empathetic when we brought my sweet angels in to be cremated. He let me pick out a beautiful little urn. text: I work for one of the competitive funeral homes in Mobile, I've never been involved in funeral home politics, So with that said...Everyone at Ascension is beyond professional and really care for the families they are called upon to serve.  Thank You for your elite professional service.         John D. Volkmann

name: Regina
text: I used Ascensions for my mother about 4yrs ago and again with my husband in march 2020  both times was a great experience. I had them cremated. the only thing I could say negative is they didn't suggest I get more death certificates. In a normal time I would have needed more then 2 for my husband & I would have had a hard time getting them with this covid-19 going around. Thanks Ascensions I would  Recommend you anytime  Regina Haley

resp.text: Regina, thank you so much for your kind words! We really appreciate your trust and the feedback!

name: Rita Mckee
text: My Mother died 6/28/2015. I was so upset, and still am, because of the way she was presented at the wake! Her beautiful snow-white hair had been smeared with BLACK COLOR. They did not wait after setting up the casket for viewing and her body ROLLED to the front of the casket! It was adjusted by the time of the Funeral--Mass. VERY disappointed with Richard because my Mother and rest of family had always regarded him as a very trustworthy person. He knows how I feel.

name: Vicki Gray
text:
The worse day of my life as I drove into town and my mom had passed, we drove to Asseccions and waited so I could see her. I was a complete mess, at a loss of how to feel or what comes next. Thank you for the time to say goodbye 😢
My father is close to passing as well now, we'll be calling and trust the same respect will be waiting.
Thank you

resp.text: Vicki, although we don't like the circumstances under which we met, it was a pleasure to be of service. If you happen to need us for anything, please don't hesitate to contact us. Thank you for the kind words.

name: James Smadmoch
text: Once my mother in law passed a little over a month ago it was 3 hours before she was picked up from our home.  The next day my wife and I met with Robert Obermier and he made a number of inappropriate passes at my wife including rubbing her leg.  He then made fun of our religion as we are Southern Baptist.  Horrible overpriced and even the casket was dented.  They were almost late getting her to the church for her funeral.  BEYOND AWFUL SERVICE!!!!!!!!

resp.text: We truly apologize and would love to offer a more sincere apology in person. We cannot find any families we have helped with the name Smadmoch in our system. We understand wanting to use a false name when writing a review, but we treat each and every family we help as we would our own. We would never want a family to not feel like they were treated with the utmost respect and kindness. Please allow us to speak to you personally by emailing us at AFGmarketing@aol.com. I, the owner, will see that email and respond personally.  Thank you and we look forward to hearing from you.

name: John McDavid

text: Curtis and Son is truly amazing. They helped us when our Gran Gran passed. They were at the house in no time all dressed up nicely & with comforting attitudes. She looked absolutely Amazing. She looked as if she was just sleeping so peacefully. The service was great & they helped to guide us when we lost our thoughts. They are so thoughtful & genuinely seemed to care. I can't thank you all enough for making such a very difficult time so easy. In my final wishes I put them down as the funeral home I want My family to use for me.
