name: Ronnie Holmes
text:
Experienced, Dedicated, and Trustworthy

I have known of this funeral home for years having served in Honor Guards at funerals in the Knights of Columbus.  Whether it was a Bishop, Priest, or other members of the Clergy around Birmingham and surrounding area, families have always been treated much like royalty.

A person who really stands out in my mind is Mr Keith McKinney.  Keith is the most caring and sincere person I believe I’ve ever met.  Bet I’ve seen Keith at more than a dozen funerals around Birmingham and he is always the same dedicated and respectful person each time.  No one can hold a candle to his experience and guidance as a funeral director.

Most recently I had the opportunity to attend the funeral of Wayne Coleman back in March of 2018.  The care and planning that went into Wayne’s service was second to none.   I’d like to thank the Manager Heath, and Keith the Director, along with Jennifer and the staff who made this funeral in your chapel a loving memory of my friend Wayne Coleman.

Ronald Holmes – Alabaster AL

name: Lebanese American
text: I have used this funeral parlor for my relatives since 2012, & have been so pleased with the services they provided from beginning to end. Last month, my uncle passed & they blew me away with service. I have even prearranged my own services with Johns-Ridout’s Southside chapel, which was such a simple process. They truly made me feel valued, & my loved ones were treated with the utmost respect & dignity. Renea, Xavier, Keith, Heath & Tina should all be commended for their kindness & professionalism.

resp.text: Our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and professional care that is absolutely essential throughout this process and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight our staff's service to you and your family in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Marcus Crawford
text:
I want to thank Keith for taking the time to talk to me today and walking me through a very difficult process which I have never experienced before. Not knowing where to begin you lead me in a direction in which I feel comfortable with for me and my family without feeling any pressure. You have eased my mind by putting many decisions to rest and I can now just spend the time needed with my mother without so much hanging over my head. I had called around to several places and no one else took as much time with me as you did. There is definitely a piece of mind by choosing someone to care for your loved that definitely understands what you are going through and sincerely loves what they do. I appreciate you inviting me to tour your facility and introduce me to all of the personal touches you can offer us. I just feel it’s important to let people know when they are truly appreciated.
Thanks again for your time and professional advice.

resp.text: Thank you for describing in detail how Keith was able to assist you and your family, Marcus. This good news will be passed down to him and it's reassuring that you felt at ease. I'm encouraged that our sincerity as well as professionalism was reflected in your experience and if you have any additional questions or requests, please feel free to give us a call. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Judy Curry
text: Excellent team that helped us with unexpected plans for my mom. They were able to adapt very quickly and did a fantastic job of getting everything set up down to the way my mom looked and even the food they provided. Going through this process with 2 parents in 4 months is difficult at best but in both situations they did a very good job.

resp.text: Judy,  I am so sorry for your loss. Knowing that we were able to make this difficult time a bit easier gives us confirmation that we are delivering the level of service we strive toward.  I am grateful for your touching message and please know we are always here to provide support.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Debi Coyle
text: Through this most difficult time, we had the best experience with Johns-Ridout's Funeral Parlor. Not knowing what to expect, never having gone through this before, Keith, our funeral director was so very wonderful, sweet, and professional. We told him what our situation was, he listened to us the first time, and we didn't have to repeat ourselves.  He explained the options to us without pushing us in any direction. He helped us to honor our beloved husband, and father as he should have been. Thank you Keith!

resp.text: Debi, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Keith is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Michael Humber
text: Absolutely wonderful experience during a time of extreme sadness.  Everything was completed electronically.  Keith was great!

resp.text: It pleases us to know that you had a wonderful experience, Michael. Our team was grateful to provide you with support and assistance during this difficult time, and please know our thoughts are with you. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Maria Coyle
text: After the passing of my father, my mother and I were treated with the utmost respect and dignity by the staff of Johns-Ridout’s as we made arrangements. We worked with Keith, who was a diligent, wonderful and considerate facilitator of my dad’s last wishes within my mom’s financial constraints. We were on a tight budget, and Keith worked with us to pick an affordable package that met our needs. In just a few days, Keith became a trusted advisor who helped us coordinate every major and minor detail, communicating with us frequently throughout the process, and always treating us both with care and respect. He repeatedly went above and beyond to ensure that my dad’s service was carried out in a timely and personal yet professional manner. Keith and Johns-Ridout’s helped make a very difficult time bearable and even pleasant, and we highly recommend them to other families in need of this service.

resp.text: Maria, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Keith. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Anna Taylor
text: While I can't say I love funerals, I can say that I have had to plan 3 over the last 17 years and would not use any other funeral home. Location Manager, Heath Bowen, and Funeral Director, Keith McKinney, make sure that even the tiniest details are handled with extreme care and sensitivity. They have managed a simple cremation, a lovely funeral followed by wine and hors d'oeuvres, and a very traditional funeral. Each one was perfect. I highly recommend Johns-Ridout's Southside Chapel, 2116 University Blvd, Birmingham, AL 35233.

resp.text: Anna, from start to finish, we strive to provide support that is compassionate and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal, and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Linda Wynn
text: Recently attended a beautifully personalized Alabama themed reception. I’m in awe of the extra attention Renee and staff showed. My friend’s visitation suited him perfectly. I highly recommend Johns-Ridout’s to anyone wanting a unique way to send off their loved ones.

resp.text: Linda, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was perfect. Thank you very much for helping us to honor your friend, and if there is anything else we may do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Kay Abrams
text: We so appreciate the excellent care shown to our family.  I cannot thank you enough. I literally did not know what to do next when my husband passed away but you made this part of the process easier especially with us not being from Alabama. During this journey we have continuously prayed that God put the right people in our path; people that would help us and not harm us. We are thankful that Johns-Ridout's Funeral Parlor was put in our path.

resp.text: We appreciate you expressing your positive sentiments, Kay, and we are all very sorry about the loss of your husband. It was a privilege for our team to assist you and I'm comforted knowing that we made this very unfortunate time easier on you. Please know that you and your family are always welcome to contact us if our guidance is needed going forward. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Ellen Mayer
text: Johns Ridout’s was attentive to details from our first contact at the time of death through the days after that funeral when they helped us secure the death certificates. They provided gratis food and drinks during the visitation time and made sure we had everything we needed. They transformed our digital pictures into a beautiful power point presentation that was played on large screens during the visitation. We are very pleased with the service they provided our family.

resp.text: Ellen, as we realize that this process is extremely difficult, we consider it a privilege to direct you through every detail with sensitivity and compassion. Thank you very much for taking a moment to recognize our team, and please know that I will be passing your kind words along to them, accompanied by my gratitude. If there is anything else that you need, know that we are here for you.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Kaeli Ferguson Hansen
text: The staff here were so helpful, compassionate, and professional when my husband passed away. They helped me to arrange to have his body brought from LA and took a lot of the stress out of the planning of his funeral. Everyone went above and beyond the call of duty in making sure that he had a dignified funeral and were so comforting to me in my greatest time of need. I’d highly recommend them. It’s always best to plan ahead but if circumstances prohibit it, this team will find a way to help you through it with grace and compassion.

name: Tom Perkins
text: We all know that death is a part of life but when it occurs suddenly and without warning there is a shock and grief which can be paralyzing.  What do you do?  Who do you contact?  What is the next step?   Our family recently suffered the sudden and tragic loss of a beloved family member. Renae helped us to navigate through the shock and grief to provide a beautiful memorial for someone who was deeply loved.  Renae and her staff bent over backwards to help with all the little details.  All of our questions were answered and all of our concerns were addressed. From making the arrangements for the memorial to the acquisition of the death certificates, I cannot imagine having managed this traumatic event without help.   All I can say is thank you.

resp.text: Tom, I am so sorry for your loss, it was an honor and a privilege to ensure your needs were met. I will bring your thoughtful compliments to the attention of Renae the rest of the team, and should you need anything else, I hope you will feel free to give us a call.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Andi Smith
text: My grandmother passed recently and the staff at Johns-Ridout's were so empathetic and kind. They handled our every need with care and respect. Heath Bowen helped us make all of the necessary arrangements swiftly and made this hard time pass so much easier. We met with Jennifer Coleman and Keith McKinney as well who were so gracious and thoughtful with their time and energy. My grandmother looked beautiful and I will always remember how peaceful she looked, surrounded by her favorite flowers and loving family, for the last time.

resp.text: Your review lets us know that we are delivering the level of service we strive toward, Andi, and I cannot thank you enough for sharing it. - Heath O. Bowen, Location Manager

name: Tanya Brasher
text: No one is prepared to lose a loved one, and my family and I were emotionally exhausted. Jennifer and her staff were so helpful and kind through it all. They guided us through this difficult time and helped us make the best decisions. We couldn’t have handled all of this without their support. We are all greatly appreciative and highly recommend Johns-Ridouts!

name: Debbie Norrell
text: We recently had a memorial service for my father in law.   After sending Renea several photos that weren't quality enough to get a portrait made, we were disappointed.  Renea didn't give up, she found a way to get not only a portrait made but our first choice.  She proved to us that your customers do matter and are important.  We are grateful for her persistence to see it through.  It meant a great deal to us

resp.text: Debbie, as we realize that every step of this process holds great importance, we consider it a privilege to go above and beyond for those we serve. Thank you very much for your recognition of Renea's care, and please know that we are only a phone call away if you should need anything else.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Anne May
text: I would love to personally thank Jennifer and Keith for their sincere compassion with the services for my brother. They truly made one of the worst times of my life brighter. The personalization that they offered will be never for gotten. It is a true calling for them both. Thanks again

resp.text: Anne, it is important to us that each service is personalized and meaningful, and it is truly heartwarming to read your kind words.  Jennifer and Keith will be very uplifted to know they were able to do so much for you.  Please do not hesitate to call if there is anything else we may attend to.    -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Wesley Anderson
text: I began my career working at Johns-Ridout's Funeral Parlors over 25 years ago.  The funeral home is a beautiful facility with architectural characteristics and details that cannot be found in any other funeral home in the city. The convenience of this location and the knowledge of its staff are unsurpassed within the city of Birmingham.  I have known Heath Bowen,  Keith McKinney, and most of the staff for the length of my career. They are all dedicated and caring professionals who treat each family with dignity, compassion, and respect.

name: Macy Simon
text: Thank you to Keith, Heath, and Jennifer for an amazing job today we could not have asked for anything more perfect. I know she would have been so pleased with everything being carried out as she wished. Thanks again!  ❤️

resp.text: We were privileged to serve you, Macy. It's wonderful to hear that you could not have asked for anything more, and your recognition is appreciated by everyone here. -Heath Bowen, Manager

name: Michele White
text: It’s so nice to have such caring people to help you when your going through such loss . They just took care of all the things that you can hardly think about. Thank you for being there and helping us with what’s our final thing we get to do for our loved ones! Your staff was amazing and caring with all of our family.

name: Sherri Hood
text: The staff at John’s Rideout are caring and compassionate people. It’s always difficult to lose a loved one. It’s especially important during these times to have caring and compassionate people around to guide you and hold your hand through the plans/arrangements. I cannot say enough about Heath Bowen and Pam Black - They are simply the best.

name: Jean Sandefur
text:
I want to send my sincere thanks to each and everyone for their care and concern for me in the death of my husband, James E. Sandefur. They were so kind and helpful during this process.
Thank you,
Jean S. Sandefur

resp.text: Jean, we treasure the compliments you have shared. Thank you very much for allowing us to help honor your husband, and please do not hesitate to let us know if there is anything else we may take care of for you. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: N a
text: Excellent service. They handled my father's arrangements with respect and professionalism while giving him the dignity he deserved. Thankyou.

resp.text: Pete, as we endeavor to take care of every detail for those we serve, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was done respectfully and professionally.  Thank you for allowing us to honor your Father, and please know that you may call at any time.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Constance Miller
text: Special thanks to Jennifer for being so patient with my family and I during a difficult time. No one realizes that there are so many decisions to be made at such a emotional draining time. I will cherish my necklace forever thank you So much. I will definitely pass along my positive experience.

resp.text: Constance, I deeply appreciate you taking the time to pass along your positive experience. Your thoughtful review will be shared with Jennifer, and if there is anything else we may do to help you through this, please know that we are at your service. -Heath Bowen, Manager

name: L. Warren Munroe
text:
Christy, of the pre-planning team, was so very kind and cooperative.  If Christy is helping you with your planning, you are assured of a no-pressure, explanatory and compassionate partner to work out details, costs, payment.

I must also say the entire staff was kind and caring with me as I planned for my daughter's final care.  They exceeded normal expectations and accommodated my timeline to make this sorrowful experience as gentle on me as possible.

I will always be grateful!

resp.text: Nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Christy. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Jack Middleston
text: I can't say enough good things about this funeral home.  Heath was kind from the beginning when he greeted my family at the door. Keith, Beth and Jennifer took care of all our needs and left no stone unturned.  Tina made sure our Death Certificates where handled in a timely manner.  I could not have gotten through this time without their guidance.

resp.text: Jack, thank you for your kind words. We are happy to know you appreciated the service our staff provided you and your family during this difficult time.  -Heath O. Bowen, Location Manager

name: Kathy geesey
text: The staff at Johns-Ridout’s all treated the family with the upmost care and consideration.  Everything was fully and carefully explained.  We never felt that the money for services was their main focus.  We have used them in years past and will continue to do so.

resp.text: Your continued support means so much to us and I truly value your gracious words, Kathy. It's comforting to know that our care towards those we serve was reflected in your experience. If you should ever need our assistance in the future, please know that we are just a phone call away. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Yu-Hsing Kao
text: Exceptional service from the staff at John's Rideout's.  Jennifer, Kevin, and Beth were professional and compassionate, exceeding our expectations.  They did everything they could to make the process as smooth as possible during this difficult time.  We highly recommend their services.

resp.text: Yu- Hsing, thank you for your kind words. It was a privilege as well as an honor to serve you and your family through these difficult times. I will be sure to share y our kinds words with the staff, if we can be of any further assistance, please don't hesitate to  call. - Heath O. Bowen, Location Manager

name: george gentle
text:
I have used Johns Ridout's Funeral Parlor for many years. We have had 5 funerals over the last several years.  Keith and Heath make a unpleasant time more comfortable. The service at this location , on University Blvd., was very professional, considerate and caring. They made us feel like they were part of the family. Your staff is rated tops in the Gentle Family.
In fact, I have this location on speed dial on my phone.

name: Kim Redding
text: Losing a loved one is one of the hardest things we ever go through in life.  The staff at John’s-Ridouts, especially manager Heath Bowen, are caring, compassionate and have a can-do attitude.  They treat the entire family with dignity, respect and do their utmost to meet all requests, including a bagpipe player.  I highly recommend this funeral home.

name: stacy miller
text: My husband and I used Ridout's for my dad and his mom and had very positive experiences both time. So when my husband passed suddenly of a heart attack I naturally wanted someone I trust to handle his arrangements. Renea and everyone else at the downtown location were so sweet and caring and helped me so much to get things handled as easily as possible. I thank them for it.

resp.text: Stacy, it was an honor for us to be of use to you, in what I know was a tremendously difficult time. Please know that you are in the thoughts of all of us here, and I hope you feel welcome to reach out if you need anything at all in the future.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Evan M RAYMOND
text: Keith was wonderful. Made a difficult process as comfortable as possible.

resp.text: Evan, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Keith is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Carol Shunnarah
text: We have been using Johns-Ridout’s Funeral Parlors for over 30 years and they have continued to impress us.  Beth Calloway and team were tremendous help with last minute changes. Beth went our of her way to make sure we had everything we needed.  We are very greatful for your services.

resp.text: Carol, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Beth.  Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Casie Carson
text: Very helpful staff. Beth and Jennifer made this process very easy to understand and were very patient with me and my family. We’ve used them in the past and will be using them in the future.

name: Denise Harris
text: They were most accommodating in making this difficult time easy for me and all involved. I could not have been more pleased with the outcome.

resp.text:
Denise, we are honored to know that we could provide you with peace during this difficult time. Thank you for sharing your appreciation for our team, as we are always proud to be of service.
-Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Andrew Barton
text: Thank you to Southside Chapel for your consistency on excellent service. Your employees definitely have a passion for what they do. As a business owner myself I know how important it is to have quality employees that enjoy what they do and do it well. Thanks again.

resp.text: Andrew, it is our great honor to provide peace of mind to those we serve in what we know is such a challenging time. Thank you for sharing that you were able to get exactly what you wanted, and please know that we are readily available to assist if you have additional questions or requests. -Heath Bowen, Manager

name: Robert Russell
text:
Our Mom recently passed away. Though not unexpected, the sadness of our loss was deep; and we were not really prepared to handle the details of the funeral, the burial , and the many other administrative tasks involved.

Renae, primarily, as well as Keith, Jennifer, and everyone at Johns Ridouts were exceptional in their coordination of these things.

But more importantly, they truly cared. Their sympathy, and empathy, were real, and it showed.

My advice to anyone reading this is to contact Johns Ridouts prior to the death of your loved one. They are great to work with, and can assist you now, before there is grief from your loss.

resp.text: The fact that our support and empathy was reflected in your experience means the world to us, Robert. We are all so fortunate for the ability to help you and your family throughout this very difficult process. Your recommendation is greatly appreciated and I hope that you will give us a call, when we can be of any help to you in the future. -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Ma Bell
text: Compassionate, full service for our  loved one exceeding our family's expectations and worth every penny.  A caring team, lead by funeral director Keith McKinney, provided us with everything we had hoped for including food for our guests and family so we could have a wonderful reunion celebrating our loved one's life without having to leave to eat.  Friends and family have been equally pleased with their experience and services here, too.

name: Andy Hernandez
text: Thanks to the staff at Johns-Ridout’s for helping my family last year at a difficult time. We were very impressed with all of the great options that was given to us to make a personalized memorial service. You will be our choice in the future.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing your thoughtful review with us, Andy. I am pleased to know that you were impressed with the options we provided, and that you will keep us in mind for anything you may need in the future. -Heath Bowen, Manager

name: Justin Farmer (Sketch2Live)
text: The staff here are very professional and care deeply for each family that comes through their doors. Mr.Bowen is one of the nicest guys you’ll have the pleasure of speaking with.  Bethany has such a kind soul and works very well with everyone she comes in contact with. She explains everything in detail and doesnt hesitate to help with any questions or concerns. I’d highly recommend anyone to use Johns-Ridout’s services to help aid those going through the grieving process.

name: Trisha Coleman
text: Staff was very experienced and honest with my family. Chapel is beautifully rustic and very clean . the reception was outstanding and very beautiful. Everyone braves on how beautiful every thing was handle.

name: Peter O'Hare
text:
The passing of my father was very difficult for all. The staff at John Rdout’s went over and beyond our expectations. They were kind, helpful, professional and most important compassionate towards me and my family. The dignity of your family is respected and cared for by this fine and wonderful funeral home.

Thank you!

name: Marc Perlman
text: Renea and Keith were incredibly patient and caring in the midst of our confusion and sadness. Their guidance and assistance was so important and my family is very appreciative.

resp.text: Marc, thank you for sharing your kind recognition, as we take comfort in knowing that we were able to provide you with helpful guidance in such an unfortunate circumstance. Please know that you and your family are in our thoughts and I hope you will reach out if there is anything more that we can do. - Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: mark cohen
text: When our son passed away unexpectedly, nothing was clear - what to do next? where to go? Keith McKinney was our answer. We turned to Keith for his expertise in guiding us through the arrangements. Keith was there for us in our deepest despair and his help was immeasurable

name: Sam Robison
text: Five stars isn't enough to rate this place. The staff members went above and beyond to help me personalize my loved ones funeral. Thank you to each and every one of you.

name: Anna Minick
text: Jennifer was very professional and made the process easier. She went above and beyond. I would recommend highly recommend them.

resp.text:
Shannon, your review truly reaffirms our commitment to offering helpful and compassionate assistance. Thank you very much for sharing, and please don't hesitate to call if there is anything else we may attend to.

-Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: Bryon McCool
text: It’s hard to find words to express one’s gratitude in tough times. Heath Bowen and his entire staff at John’s-Ridout’s Funeral Parlor on Southside Birmingham were a blessing. They treated our family and friends as if we were “their” family and friends. From the elegant building to the memorable service we felt comfort. Simply put, thank you.

name: Abby Rojas
text: Very friendly and helpful staff! These are the people you want to help you when you are going through the hardships of dealing with someone passing. I would 110% recommend this funeral home. Amazing service 🙂

name: Brenda Simmons
text: Thank you Keith, Heath, and Jennifer for an amazing job. The suggestion for bringing in here most precious belongings really added to the service.  Thanks a million!

resp.text: Brenda, I am truly thankful for your thoughtful recognition for Keith, Jennifer, and myself. We understand how difficult this has been and consider it a true honor to be by your side through this journey. Thank you very much for sharing, and please feel free to call on us if there is anything else we may do to assist you. - Heath Bowen, Manager

name: Dale Galbraith
text:
John Rideout's Funeral Parlor took great pride in helping our family during the most difficult times.  Word can't describe the comfort, professionalism and care provided by the manager (Mr. Bowen) and the entire staff.

Thank you.

name: Stacey Drake
text:
The funeral home is a beautiful facility and the staff is all very compassionate and understanding. Mr. Heath Bowen really took the time to be sure we understood everything about the details and laws surrounding cremation. He handled everything for us and we always recommend him when people mention funerals
or cremations.

name: Richard Trucks
text: As a Pastor I have had the privilege of working with Heath Bowen and his staff on many occasions. They have always been compassionate and caring in working with the families. They are always pleasant and a joy to work with in a time of sorrow.

name: Blake Cooper
text:
We could not have asked for a better experience than the one we were given by John Ridout's Renea McGhee . She was compassionate, patient & professional with our family during an extremely difficult time. Her followup was courteous and timely keeping us all on track of the unfortunate tasks at hand. Renea, we thank you from the bottom our of hearts and hope our paths cross again soon on a happier note!
All the best, Blake

resp.text: Blake, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and that Renea and our staff are here for you if there is anything else that you need.  -Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

name: G Grissom
text: A kind and compassionate professional service that left no detail unresolved. By far the most caring individuals during this time of loss for my family. No question that I will go to them in the future.

name: hunter baldwin
text: 5 stars isn't good enough for this place! Thank you to all the staff for making everything crystal clear and for Bethany Calloway for giving my nephew's crayons and coloring sheet during the service to keep them occupied! I would recommend this place to anyone!

name: Trey Dunnam
text: When we buried Tim, all the staff and Heath Bowen took care of our family, Bent over backwards to go above and beyond to take care of every need! This is the place I want to take care of me when it’s my time. Thank you Heath and Johns Ridout.

name: Downtown Birmingham Club Pilates
text: The best neighbors Downtown.  All of us at Club Pilates love this business.  Very friendly and helpful staff and always accommodating when we need a place to park in a pinch.

name: Cathy Juliano
text: I assisted my friend in planning her mom’s funeral. The staff was ver professional and sensitive to her needs. They were respectful and caring.

name: Landon Hunter (landondh)
text: My heartfelt gratitude is extended to Heath Bowen and the entire funeral home staff, they showed the most respect from the nursing home all the way to the graveside service. He helped guide my family through a horrible time. Heath made everything understanding and answered all our questions.

name: Toby Gardner
text: Beautiful funeral home and staff is amazing.  They took care of my families every need.  Thanks again!

name: Reginald James
text: The people here are truly wonderful. Tina is the sweetest person on the planet. Her boss was also very kind and helpful.

name: Karey Hass
text: Many thanks to Heath Bowen and his staff for their kindness and attention to all details during our family’s loss. I would not hesitate to recommend them at any time because of their compassion and professionalism.

name: Nancy S
text: There was no money for them to earn off of this, yet they treated us great.  Mom passed away in another state and we did not use Johns-Ridouts.  I contacted them because she had a pre-burial policy.  Heath was wonderful in helping me get money back from that policy.  He also helped me get money back from Liberty.  He got the information from me and went to these other companies on my behalf to help me get the payoffs.  Jennifer also helped to get the appropriate documents to have the check payable in the right name. They made extra efforts on my behalf even though they were not going to handle any arrangements and make any money.  That says it all about caring, ethics, doing the right thing, etc. Thank you for making it so easy in such a difficult time, especially when there was no gain for your company.

name: Natasha Baroody
text: We had a great experience with the professionalism and Jennifer was great! She helped our family prepare the programs for the funeral and did so much more without us even asking.

name: Charles Russell
text: The unexpected passing of my husband sadly coincided with the passing of my young nephew just days prior. This created a vacuum of family support which in my deep mourning left me feeling vulnerable and very uncertain to the planning of a large traditional church funeral. My fears were not realized because of the compassionate care and direction I was given. No person was treated with more courtesy, compassion and professionalism. Every detail was handled with gracious and knowledgeable dignity by Ms Beth Calloway. She assisted in every way and made certain my husband was given the funeral he desired. She worked at every point from the moment I met with her and Mr Edmundson to do the arrangements. Both along with Heath, Andrea, Renea and others made sure he was honored. The procession from the church was the hardest but Heath led the pallbearers snd Ms Calloway walked by my side. This extra presence just one day after my nephew’s funeral was extremely gracious and demonstrated to me that in my deep mourning John’s Ridouts truly values the best traits of compassion and generosity of spirit. To Beth, Heath, Johnathon and every member of your staff I felt supported and affirmed. I must say Beth exhibited firmness with difficult logistics to help in a traditional church service while Heath and the escort made certain that despite a detour we entered Elmwood Cemetery at 4:00 precisely. I owe them all so much thanks and thank Almighty God for His placing them there as a same gender widower without children I needed that extra assistance. I extend my gratitude and deepest thankfulness to them during my great sorrow.

resp.text:
Words cannot express how much this means to us.  Knowing we were able to help honor your husband, even in this small way, means so much.  Being here for you during this difficult time is our mission. If we can be of any further assistance, please don't hesitate to call. Thank you.

-Heath O. Bowen, General Manager

text: The passing of my aunt was very hard on us. The staff at John’s-Ridouts were so caring and respectful. Keith, Jennifer and Andrea answered all of our questions and was there for us. text: These folks are amazing. They are caring, compassionate, and really have a passion for serving others.

name: Collin Dorner
text: Brought my family Donuts and Coffee in our time of need, very thoughtful and gracious staff.

name: Jayden Clifton
text:
I recently attended a viewing here and was honestly blown away by the compassion and how much time and effort the staff put into their families. The viewing I attended was for a dear friend of mine. He was so compassionate about his dogs and loved them so much. As soon as I entered the funeral home I was greeted by a young girl that seemed to be her early 20's. She was so respectful and mature beyond her age. She walked me to the lobby and showed me where the register book was and led me into the door way to the chapel. As soon as I entered the chapel I was blown away by how much time was dedicated into displaying all of Terry's items. Pictures of his Juke room, dogs, baby pictures, sisters, cars he's owned, adventures him and Marco had been on, and it was everything that he would of loved. The slide show of pictures that were playing on the TV and also on a tv in the lobby brought back so many memories, smiles, laughs, and tears. There was a stained glass that was placed up front on display and lights were placed behind it to help make it stand out.  I was just in awe at how much time and compassion was spent on my dear friend.
The young funeral director that was assisting the family was there for them, as well as every one else for anything they needed. She was there for every tissue that was needed and even handed out bottles of water to the family and friends. His sisters, mother, father, and other family members were sitting on the front pew. I noticed his father dropped his mothers glasses and he did not notice it. Beth seen them as soon as they hit the ground and quickly picked them up before they were stepped on.
Thank you to Keith, Jennifer, Beth, and Steven for the funeral. People always say that as time goes on it gets easier. Walking back in the funeral home the second day seemed much harder. Keith, Steven, Jennifer, and Beth were there for me as well as the family every step of the way. They did an awesome job with the escorts, and also with the parking because there was so many people there.
Thank you to each and every one of you, and for carrying out Terrys wishes. I have never seen a funeral home go to the great lengths that they did and it truly shows how much they care about their families. Thank you John-Ridouts Funeral Parlors for having open arms, a shoulder to cry on, and making us feel as if we were apart of your family.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing that Jade. We are committed to paying tribute to those we serve in a way that is true to their character. Your kind words mean the world to us, and I will be sure that they are shared with the staff. Thank you again. - Heath O. Bowen, Location Manager

name: stevesain
text:
I’m a CEO of an engineering firm. My father-in-law recently passed. He had specified what he wanted in his trust. But I had never made funeral arrangements in the past. So I needed help quickly. I had received an emphatic suggestion from a friend who had used Johns-Rideout’s service and was elated with how they handled themselves. I inquired and within minutes on a Friday evening, I found myself on the phone with Keith McKinney who became my primary point of contact. Within 5 minutes we were good friends. Yes, I know he’s done this before. That’s exactly what I needed.

Keith wasted no time as we dug into a plan of what was requested, how we’re going to accomplish it, and milestone targets in order for us to meet the needs of a memorial service in a local church on Wednesday. I gathered the rest of my family and met with Keith in his office on Saturday. He was impressively diplomatic, empathetic and productive as he juggled differing opinions into selection decisions. Before we knew it, we were ready to move forward. Most everyone had their own assignments. Keith had a predetermined obligation on Monday & Tuesday, so he introduced my family & I to his colleagues, Jennifer Coleman & Beth Galloway. From the first “hello”, they were as pleasant and truly helpful as Keith. Over the next two days, Jennifer quarterbacked the process with efficiency & grace. Communication was virtually seamless.

When the big day came, we all met at the church early and it was crystal clear that they had not missed ANY detail. Arrangements were flawless. What an honor to our deceased family member to have such first-class arrangements made with such competence and professionalism. Everything from visitation to memorial service to reception featuring a finely catered lunch was perfect.

Once the crowd thinned, hugs were exchanged and things were cleaned up, my wife & I agreed that, based on this experience, we definitely want to pre-arrange and pre-pay our own memorials with this specific Johns-Rudeout’s team. Who wouldn’t? This occasion is supposed to be somber. And at times, it was. Yet, as much as literally possible, they made perfection look easy.

name: Troy Jones
text: The staff here were extremely kind, considerate and helpful. When in the middle of dealing with all the details of such a traumatizing, horrible event as the death of a loved one, having people to help you who are so exceptionally wonderful, makes this part of the process much much easier.

name: Jessica Roskin
text: For the 18 years I have been working with local, and some non-local, funeral homes in my capacity as clergy at a Birmingham synagogue, by far the very best I’ve worked with is Johns-Ridout’s Funeral Parlor Southside. The warmth, friendliness and professionalism of their staff, from the attendant who answers the phone to the managers, is unmatched. They know all that is required for a Jewish funeral and provide all necessities without my need to ask. They give to their clientele the comfort and kindness that is so needed during the most painful time in their lives. It is the only place where my congregants return when another of their loved ones die, specifically asking for the person who served them in the past. The people at Johns-Ridout’s Southside create relationships, and that is so important to my congregants, and therefore to me as their clergy. I am grateful for their presence in this city.

name: Bella Graphos
text: My family has always used the John Ridout’s Southside Funeral Parlor.  I cannot say enough how professional, as well as, compassionate and comforting the staff is and has been to my family at such a trying time.  A special thank you to Keith for being so helpful and making us feel comfortable when making our final plans for our loved ones.   Thank you, John Ridout’s Southside.

text: Jasmine was wonderful to work with. From out of town, she and staff made this as easy a possible. They were very professional, kind and helpful.

name: Susan Smith
text: Roselawn Funeral Home, especially Dennis Craig, went above and beyond what our family expected when our brother, Jimmy Dale Hayes, passed. Everyone was very kind, helpful, and showed tremendous compassion in our loss. I would highly recommend Roselawn Funeral Home and staff.

resp.text: Susan, going above and beyond for those in our care has always been our goal and I am so happy to know that Dennis and our staff was able to serve you and your family with such helpful and compassionate support during this difficult time of loss.  Thank you for your kind recommendation and know that you are always welcome to reach out to us.  -Barry Campbell, General Manager

name: Susannah St.Clair
text: I had never known that our family could meet at the crematorium to see my mom off on her final moments as a family. That really brought some needed closure to a family divided. What I learned during this horrible time was so very enlightening and memorable for me personally. I soon after changed my will to ensure to incorporate the idea for my own family upon my death. Jasmine was truly exceptional and caring with the arrangements for my mother and the chaos of a family divided.  I felt during this difficult time she was listening to my wishes as well as my siblings even if they were not the same. She showed a level of kindness and understanding that helped me stand strong during the most difficult time in my life of losing my last parent so suddenly. Thank you for that and more.

name: Gary Voketz
text:
Gary Voketz

Upon the passing of my wife Bette Voketz, Roselawn Funeral Home was very accommodating in all my needs. I had a pre-arrangement created 27 years ago which included all funeral and cemetery costs with a savings of over $6K, based on what the costs would have been at today's rates. The only additional out of pocket expenses were for death certificates and the obituary. Jasmine was more than helpful guiding us through the details needed to insure a lovely service at my church and burial. No pressure was ever made for additional expenses or purchases over and above our pre-arrangements. Jasmine was also most thoughtful in helping my daughter who came in to do her mother's hair before the funeral.

It was with a heavy heart that I attended two additional funerals at my church within one week of my wife's funeral. Roselawn managed both of those services and Jasmine, being present, made a point of speaking and comforting me at each of those services.

I want to thank Jasmine and the staff at Roselawn for guiding and supporting me and my family through this most difficult time. I never had to concern myself with any technical aspects of the service or burial. Roselawn walked us through all the steps with grace and dignity.

When you are faced with laying a loved one to rest, I strongly recommend Roselawn Funeral Home. You can spend your time reflecting on your life with your loved one while Roselawn attends to all the arrangements.

resp.text: Gary, as we realize that this process is extremely difficult, we considered it an honor to direct you through every detail with sensitivity and compassion. Thank you very much for taking a moment to recognize Jasmine and our team members, and please know that if there is anything else that you need, know that we are here for you.  -Barry Campbell, General Manager

name: Linda Helgeson
text: wonderful service thank you so much

resp.text: Linda, your kind message is appreciated by everyone here. Thank you for allowing us to be of service to your family, and please know that we are available to assist with anything else you may need.  -Barry Campbell, General Manager

name: Kelly Schultz
text: They done both my grandpa and grandma's funeral. My grandpa passed 9 months ago and my grandma a week and a half ago. My grandpa's funeral was better than my grandmas. The director of my grandma's funeral was misleading and rude. Not very supportive and her communication was awful

name: Heavenly mari
text: the director  was misleading

name: David L Casteel (MonkC)
text: Funeral director misleading

name: Joe Tipple
text: I Just had my best friend's service & his family used Armour's & what a fantastic job on Everything. My besrt friend looked like himself as he did when he was asleep. The staff is Very friendly & courteous to the family & friends. They really know what their doing. I've been to several funerals where the person doesn't look good,  but they Really did an Outstanding job on my best friend. I am going to get them to handle my funeral when it's my time to go.

name: lynda johnson
text:
This is the most caring, compassionate group of professionals I've ever come into contact with while making arrangements for my dad.
Completely explained every detail of his prepaid policy, what to expect at the service.
One thing stood out the most and my family will never forget this.
We were telling a story about how my dad loved, I mean love pringles snack pack chips, he would hide them under his hat and in his pants pockets and go to his room with them at night.
Well, unbeknownst to me and my family,  the day of his service they had brought out a beautifully framed photo of pringles chips inscribed with in loving memory.  This touched our hearts in more ways than you could imagine.  Not only did they show us compassion during our time of need, they actually listened to our stories and made our day more bearable.
Kudos to Mobile Memorial Gardens

name: Chad Buckhalter
text: I can’t say enough good things about Mobile Memorial Gardens, they were very caring and compassionate during our time of grief. The people especially were so understanding, patient and very attentive to our needs. The facilities and the service was very nice, I would highly recommend them.

name: Donna laws
text: Clay Thomaston made my experience dealing with my sweet mother’s passing one that i will  always remember. The one thing I dreaded most was sitting at the funeral home discussing her arrangements. Clay has a calmness he brings to the table, he’s  patient and was very supportive of my thoughts and wishes. I would highly recommend Mobile Memorial Gardens for their loved ones arrangements.

name: Denise Stringer
text: Staff are caring, considerate and attention to detail was impressive. I could not have asked for better for my loved one.  Martin and Doris were extremely kind and helpful in every aspect. Elizabeth has reached out to us as well to offer her support and give words of encouragement. Loss is never easy but it was calming to know my mother was in such wonderful hands.

name: Steve wilstrup
text: Mobile Memorial Gardens provided caring and compassionate assistance at a very difficult time. Everyone I encountered was very professional and extremely kind and  I would highly recommend them when you have to deal with the passing of a loved one.

name: Nancy Self
text: Very professional, compassionate and accommodating staff. Exactly what my family needed at the time of our sister’s death.

name: Sharon Knowles
text: Memorial Gardens have been in my family since 1956. We feel love and support from the staff. We feel like they are our family. Thank you for helping us during difficult times. Sharon Knowles.

name: Dale Faulkenberry
text:
The services provided by the Director and Staff were exceptional. Sy Runnels assisted me and my Family in each and every way. His kindness and constant attention was amazing. He attended our Family as if it were his own. With little doubt, Sy helped make a very sad and difficult time easier with his guiding and gentle ways. We are forever grateful for his help.
Dale Faulkenberry

name: Crystal Naylor
text: Mobile Memorial Gardens did a wonderful job with my Dad's services. Although the Corona Virus was in full effect they found a way for us to have services anyway. They were all very respectful and super nice. Martin has the calmest most reassuring voice. It kinda puts you as ease amongst all the chaos ypur going through. I highly recommend them!

name: Terri Leach
text: Would highly recommend Mobile Memorial Gardens. Sy and the rest of the staff were very compassionate and very helpful working out plans for our mother’s service, which was an unexpected event we weren’t prepared for. They helped us with all the details we might otherwise overlook.

name: Lisa Callahan
text: I was completely satisfied with Mobile Memorial Gardens! They did a fantastic job with my mom's funeral. They even sent me a text 3 weeks after we layed my mom to rest just to check on me to see how I was doing! I was so happy with them, my husband and I just put money down on our burial plots!

name: Julie Hatcher
text: This is the second time I have had a loved ones funeral at Memorial Gardens. Couldn’t ask for a better group of people. Everyone was friendly and helpful. The day of the service I was greeted immediately and every need was taken care of with a smile. The beautiful portrait of my Mom will be treasured forever. After the grave side service I went back to get flowers and personal items. They were all neatly loaded on a rolling cart which they rolled out for me and helped me load my car. I’ve had several very sweet follow up calls and text.

name: Dwain Barnes
text: My family and I recently suffered the loss of our infant granddaughter. We were so devastated. Mr. Sanders and his staff at Mobile Memorial Gardens were so compassionate and helpful in helping us with all the arrangements. Their professionalism was amazing but their caring and kindness went beyond even that. We highly recommend them and their services.

name: Daniel Collier
text: Knowledgeable staff, caring, walked us through the process

name: Will Thompson
text: The entire staff at Mobile Memorial Gardens Funeral Home and Gardens are awesome ! They were courteous and attentive and handled everything with dignity and care ....Thank You !

name: Gina Pollock
text: Seamless. Everything was taken care of in such a caring manner.

name: Kay Ortiz
text: The folks at MMG made a difficult time easier to go through. They were genuinely kind and accommodating. The extra touches as thank you cards and beautiful portrait of my brother we’re unexpected. They had social distancing practices in place so we were not fearful of catching the virus. I highly recommend this place for a resting place for your loved ones. Thanks Elizabeth, Eddie and all other employees.

name: Wesley Pamplin
text: Sy Runnels, with the help of the crew at Mobile Memorial Gardens, handled my wife’s memorial beautifully! I wasn’t sure if I wanted to stay with them until Sy stepped in, and I’m so glad I did. Everything was taken care of, and I have some wonderful mementos that I was pleasantly surprised to receive. They have even checked on me afterwards just to see how I’m doing. I wasn’t sure customer service like that still existed!

name: Sheila Midgette
text: Our family received the utmost respect & care on the day of my father’s funeral.  Martin Powers assisted us in the planning process prior to the funeral & he made several good suggestions.  He also set up military honors for my father. Our experience with Mobile Memorial Funeral Home will make them our choice next time our need arises

name: Tara Trammell
text: Everyone who works here showed compassion when my husband passed away! They were caring and sensitive about my needs and those of the family, too!
