text: Leak Memory is a wonderful facility and I have been especially pleased with the care and consideration of Tiffany Button. Thank you for all you've done for us.

name: Donna Miller
text: Professional and Caring!  Great staff.

name: Kassie Culpepper
text: Leak Memorial is a very kind and compassionate with all aspects of the process.

name: Kathi Rogers
text: Beth Johnson was an angel helping with my brother’s funeral.

name: Laura Massey
text: Thank you for everything Rhiannon! Couldn’t have done a better job! Roll Tide!

name: Sarah Murdock
text: Rhiannon really helped my family through such a difficult time, we could never thank her enough for the compassion she gave us!

name: Jonathan Gamel
text: They’re great!!!

name: Teresa Reaves
text: Funeral Home is nice and workers are frindly

name: Benny Adams
text: Great people to work with in time of need!

name: Jason Welsh
text: Not a place we want to go, but the service was good and the people were nice. Had a problem when they picked up my mom when she died, they only sent one person and he dropped here while putting her on the gurney. I know this sounds horrible but other than that they did a good job.

name: Brooke Franks
text: The Currie-Jefferson funeral home took such good care of my family. I had to fly in from out of town to take care of things but they made the entire process seamless for us. They were so genuine and caring. Lexi, Brooke, and Britney were accessible and on top of everything.

name: Lynn johnson
text: The entire staff is caring and compassionate and there to help in any way possible.  I can not say enough good about the entire staff and the services.  Never any pressure to purchase more or something you don’t want, but they provide guidance and compassion and caring  at a very difficult time.  Would HIGHLY recommend them!

name: Nancy Kennemer
text: They handled my mother’s arrangements for burial.  Everything went flawlessly.  Couldn’t have asked for more professional service.

name: E R
text: Service for my mother couldn't have been more perfect.  They took great care of our family, and we are beyond grateful.

name: Michael
text: I went to visit my sisters grave site to lace flowers on her grave! I went inside and a blonde girl took my information on who I was looking for! After coming wout with a cardboard plot map showed me where her grave was located she would come within 6 feet of me because of covid19! She was not wearing a mask and I should be more worried about catching it from her since I am 63 with heart conditions!!! I went upside searched for 45 minutes unable to find her grave site! I told her why didn’t she come out and show me the site! She got very defensive saying I don’t talk to her like that! I was shocked to find the lack of sympathy of my situation and threaten to call the police! Shortly 2 other girls came out of offices to protect her from what! Then they finally said a worker in maintenance would show me he looked for 45 minutes till he could find her grave! I have a lot more to say about this funeral home I will add more soon!

name: Christine Frankel
text: I don't live in Alabama but plenty of people stealing my ID do.  I feel bad if you lost someone but knew it was a matter of time before the Funeral Homes were hit with Fraud

name: Donna Ward
text:
Our grandson , Luke Ward Ogran died in May  2017 and and we were so fortunate to have Currie-Jefferson handle his cremation.
They were so compassionate and helpful .
They  allowed my daughter and son in law the extra time for closure with their baby after he was transferred from the hospital which helped tremendously with closure after their tragic loss.
We highly recommend their fine funeral home and services.
Donna Cooper Ward
Tuscaloosa, Alabama

resp.text: Thank you so much Donna, we were very happy to help your family and appreciate the trust you placed in us!

name: Nichole Bailey
text: Great and caring staff. Very accommodating to my family during emotional crisis. I know my auntie was pleased of how she was taking care of.

resp.text: Thank you Nichole! We are happy to have had the opportunity to serve your family.

name: Sandra Lyle
text: Great and caring staff. Very accommodating to family during emotional crisis.

resp.text: Thank you very much Sandra, we appreciate your comments and are happy you chose us!

name: Jamie Jones
text: We were blessed to have you guys help us in ever way during this extremely difficult time. Thank you for everything!

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to serve you and your family Jamie.  We sincerely appreciate your trust and business.  We're always here for you.

name: Lauren Benson
text: Family member accidently underpaid account .50, and the funeral home acted annoyed when asked to settle account via debit card. They begrudgingly ate the .50, but did so after multiple phone calls. It's not like they didn't just get paid several thousand dollars. By all means, be petty about two quarters though.

resp.text: Hello Lauren, we're very sorry for the misunderstanding around this small balance.  We take these reviews very seriously and would like to apologize for the way we mentioned the $ .50 balance. Our software program that houses our records and financials typically alerts us when an installment contract is paid in full so that we can send a notice to the family.  In this case this was causing it to not show as paid in full in our system.  Once we noticed the amount, we took care of the discrepancy on our end and were then able to create the documentation needed.  We hope that you understand and we apologize for how this may have come across.  We sincerely appreciate your business and hope that you will reach out to us directly if you would like to discuss this more.  Thank you for bringing this to our attention, we'll work hard to ensure we communicate better going forward.  Thank you!

name: Gregory Hall
text: Beautiful funeral home and a staff that is equal in their hospitality.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Gregory!

name: Susan Lange
text: They were professional!

name: Bert Brocato
text:
From moment I was introduced to Mr. Berryhill and his staff I knew I had made the right choice. The folks at Berryhill Funeral Home are compassionate, caring, professionals who know their business and understand the needs of the family. All facets of my mother’s funeral were expertly completed by Mr. Berryhill and his team. They had the additional challenge to transport my mother out of town and coordinate with another funeral home for the burial. Again, it was completed with care and attention to detail.
My sincere thanks to Mr. Berryhill and his dedicated staff.

name: Robert Turner
text: We recently lost our son unexpectedly. Berryhill Funeral home guided us through the process with sensitivity and thoughtfulness. Mr. Berryhill and Joel Hastings were so kind and gracious to our family. My wife and I struggled with having to bury our son but each of these men were able to comfort us and give us a peace we very much needed at that time. Our prayers of thankfulness go out to them and we will be forever grateful for their help in our greatest time of need. The service was perfect and very professional. Thank you Berryhill Funeral home.

name: Robert Turner
text: When our son passed Berryhill was there with us every step. These folks could not have been more kind and helpful in our time of loss.

name: Dan P
text: I had the pleasure of working with Bobby Berryhill when making funeral arrangements for my mom and stepdad.  He was kind, compassionate and patient as I had trouble maintaining my composure during the discussions. Their funds were limited so Bobby helped us arrive at a pre-paid plan that were economical.  My mom passed away recently and I have nothing but praise for Bobby, Russ and everyone at Berryhill for how they treated our family.  The last few months of my mom’s life were incredibly hard on her and I was concerned about having an open-casket but in the end, she was so beautiful.  She looked like the mom I remembered so well from a few years ago and I am forever grateful.  Everything went exactly as planned with little effort required on our part.  Beautiful chapel, music, memorial cards, register, thank you cards and a CD of photos.  There’s no way to express my sincere gratitude to Berryhill for helping our family make it through such difficult time.

name: Kevin Hunter
text: First of all walking around in parking lot, Grass has not been cut in who knows how long ,Weeds in all the cracks in pavement and beds,No attention to detail at all!The workers very nice but the aesthetics horrible,Walking in the carpet very dirty frayed in most the cracks and seams.The amount of money people pay for this service seems like all these little things would be taken care of!

name: Suzette Daniels
text: Mr. Berryhill and his team were compassionate, caring, and understanding with my family as we went through this heartbreaking process.

name: Debra Darkow
text: Absolutely the worst! We had to write our own obituary at home and send it in because the one they put up said said her name and she passed away with the date, no personal touch on their part. All they cared about was getting the money. After they asked for the money several times in the first meeting it was paid right then so we could have a normal discussion. We asked about urns and they said what for your just going to scatter her ashes. No personal touch was given and no sympathy. They didn’t even offer to fix her up so we could say goodbye. It was all about the money.

name: David P
text: Best experience one could have in this type of situation. Great staff and very accommodating and supportive.

name: C C
text: With their beautiful facilities, caring and compassionate staff, nothing was left wanting. This family owned place saw to my beloved Uncle Vincent Rutherford's final wishes with dignity and grace.   Mr. Berryhill himself assisted my grandmother and me as we navigated this difficult time.

name: Jolene Bethke
text: The entire Berryhill staff were wonderful to us.  They provided the cremation and memorial for my husband's dad.  They didn't just go through the business motions.  They provided caring, compassionate support to all the family and friends involved in this grieving process.  This is the second time we have used Berryhill and will continue to do so.  They treat you like family.

name: Shelly Murphy
text: I can't even express how grateful I am to this place. When I was unexpectedly put in charge of arranging a funeral for my 20-year-old niece, I was scared and clueless about the whole terrible process. Every single person at Berryhill Funeral Home showed us nothing but the utmost professionalism and compassion. I called numerous times with questions but was never made to feel rushed or ignored. Mr. Berryhill himself is an amazing person and put the whole family at ease. My niece passed away out of state, but they brought her home and were so kind to us, while being mindful of our financial situation. They gave us a beautiful service to our exact wishes. No one wants to have to use this kind of service, but if you do, I think there is no better choice in Huntsville than Berryhill!

name: Gayla Ray
text:
My family used Berryhill October, 2012.  We found Mr. Berryhill to be kind, considerate and were never pressured to buy anything other than what we chose.
God forbid, if we should need a funeral home, again in the near future, we will go back to Berryhill.  We were happy with everything from how my deceased looked for veiwing, the visitation and how the cemetery was handled.

name: Daniel Popham
text: Staff was very helpful and considerate of our needs. They did a great job with taking care of all of the arrangements, especially with having to deal with moving our family member from another state for the funeral.

name: Cool Mom
text: An ok place.  Most nicer people choose one of the other firms in the area.  This place is like an assembly line for getting rid of dead people without class or personal, caring touches and service.

name: S.F. Strigz
text:
I attended a few funeral services there & thought things went well so I contacted them when my Mother passed. We did not have any public service at Berryhill but in Florida. The Staff at Berryhill was absolutely wonderful in every detail that was needed. I was very grateful for their assistance with travel, cremation, death certificates & even with questions from a life insurance company.
Two close friends lost loved ones & I took them to see Joel Hastings. He handled everything with class & accuracy for them as well.
Additionally, my wife is an artist & someone asked her to paint some embellishments on a casket. (The band of logos of their son's favorite group.) They staff accommodated her every need & even offered to buy her lunch as she worked in the clean & organized work area behind the scenes.

name: Joyce Hicklen
text:
I CANNOT express to you how Berryhill Funeral Home embraced my family during the sudden loss of my husband. We weren't just another patron but like family. My husband's sister was in Africa at the time of his death so we had to wait 5 days before she could get to Huntsville.
Mr. Berryhill and his staff encouraged and supported me to visit my husband everyday until the service's. I was not rushed and when I cried they comforted me. I could and would NOT have had my precious husband at any other funeral home. I  THANK EACH PERSON FOR UOUR COMPASSION.  MRS. DANNY HICKLEN.

name: A. Damphouse
text: With one of the saddest days my family and I have faced, Mr. Berryhill and staff rendered impeccable service.  From the time our  loved one was picked up from home until we celebrated her life and said our final good bye, we were treated with much compassion.

name: Sheila Jones
text:
I ordered flowers from a local florist to be delivered to my Godmother's funeral. These were the family sprays and were the only flowers to be in the service. The florist delivered them to Berryhill but when we came for the service they said they had no flowers for us. It was embarrassing to say the least. So we had to have the service without any flowers. After talking with the funeral home and florist we found out that Berryhill mistakenly used our flowers in another funeral.
Although our memorial service went ok I didn't feel like we got the best treatment we could have. The meeting to set up the memorial was uncomfortable. It almost seemed like the gentleman was annoyed by questions about specifics of the service and what we were buying.
He didn't tell us until we arrived for the memorial that we were expected to conduct it ourselves. I have never had that happen with a funeral home before.
Yes I expect a little more hand holding in the funeral industry... many of the customers are coming to you in a state of grief and need extra help.

name: Brad W
text: I called 10 mins before they closed with questions about how to open their boxes that the remains come back in. The guy that answered was super professional and wasnt rushy at all and answered all my questions with great accuracy.

name: Brandon Widner
text: Great staff, very good at what they do! Fully recommend this place for your funeral or burial needs!

name: Etelka Lehoczky
text: Considerate, detail-oriented staff and reasonable prices. Glad we chose it.

name: Nydia Burgos-Ruwe
text: The staff could not have been nicer. Kristi and Madison were both very helpful and made what is by nature a difficult process, much easier for our family. They made great recommendations and facilitated every detail so it went very smoothly. They even had connections for a bagpiper for the grave side service. The bagpiper was fantastic and made the service very special for the family. Thank you so much for all your dedication.

name: song k
text:
FAKE PEOPLE. They treat your beloved deceased like a business transaction.

After the service, I asked for some bottled water, for the mother of the deceased (which first of all, is a tiny 8 oz, not even a full sized bottle, like it costs so much for them). The young petite lady (who actually showed genuine sympathy) was accommodating and as she went to go get some, the short heavier set lady (I guess the manager) gave a glare and a sort of eye roll and said we can only give you one.

What’s worse is after the private burial, that was reserved for family, as we were literally walking back to our cars one of the guys said, ”Can you hurry it up? We have another funeral behind you.”

The absolute audacity and disrespect shown for my family member. I was disgusted. DON’T TRUST THIS ESTABLISHMENT TO TAKE CARE OF YOUR LOVED ONES.

resp.text: Song, this is certainly not the impression we want to leave you with and I am grateful that you took a moment to reach out. Please allow me to connect with you and ensure your feedback regarding your interaction with our staff is addressed, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Kristi.Hall@dignitymemorial.com at your earliest convenience. I appreciate your communication and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Rose Wade
text: Everyone was very solicitous and helpful. Took care of all arrangements in a very methodical and caring manner. Would highly recommend!

resp.text: Rose, I am touched to hear of your happiness with our helpful and caring services.  Thank you for allowing us to take care of the arrangements and know that your kind recommendation means a great deal to our team. If you ever need us in the future, we will be here for you.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Donna Jordan
text: Russell did an outstanding job was very impressed with all of the knowledge he had

resp.text: Receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering outstanding and knowledgeable care, Donna.  I will be sure to share your kind message with Russell and I hope you will call us if there is anything more that we can do for you.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Debbie McAnnally
text: They went above and beyond for my brother who was a veteran. I couldn't believe how much they helped me through the benefits that the VA and Cemetery provided. I would highly recommend you give them a chance FIRST.

resp.text: Debbie, we are proud to know we have gone above and beyond your family's expectations as we want every experience to be easy and seamless. Thank you for recognizing our professional and compassionate care for your beloved brother and please do not hesitate to let us know whenever you require our assistance.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Robert Chambers
text: Rockco funeral home done a fantastic job with my wife’s arrangements. I was very satisfied with everything they done and the professionalism they showed as a whole. Everyone was very respectful and friendly.

resp.text: Robert, it was truly an honor to be trusted with your wife's arrangements and it was a privilege to provide the professional and respectful service you describe.  Please know we are here you and that you may reach out at any time.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Lori Hayes
text: The loss of my father was so tragic but the people at Rockco were compassionate and caring, taking care to make certain that our family was cared for during this time.

resp.text: Lori, I am pleased to read that you received the compassionate and caring service we strive toward. Thank you very much for sharing your experience and please know that we remain at your service if you should need anything else.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Ricketta Wilson
text: It would be hard to find someone better than Kristi to handle the details of a funeral in such a kind and memorable way. She was pleasant and helpful without being overbearing. I was completely impressed by the way our loved one’s arrangements were handled by Rockco Funeral Home. Thank you.

resp.text: Boi, thank you so much for highlighting the empathy and compassion displayed by Kristi and our team. Receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering attentive and helpful guidance and support. If there is anything else that you need, please know that we are here for you. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Laura Mizzell
text: Thank you to the entire staff at Rockco Funeral Home .  A special thank you to Lindsey and Russell.  Your kindness during this difficult time was greatly appreciated.  The facility is lovely, and every detail was attended to.  It is a difficult time to make decisions, and you made that process manageable.

resp.text: Laura, it was truly an honor to provide help and direction throughout this process. I am touched to hear you say that the services were beautifully done, and I will make sure to share your kind comments with the rest of the team. Thank you.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Hayley Kish
text:
My sweet little girl Alana Jane past at 7 years old. Two days after her birthday. She has a rare condition... Something tragic happen to me and I can honestly say I couldn’t have asked for a better person than Madison Brown to walk me through this. She put up with me worrying about Alana Janes curly hair, pretty pink nails and so much more. I hugged her and I felt she cared for me and how mysweet girlie looked.

Laying a loved one to rest is such a terrible thing but I promise request Madison if possible. They all are wonderful but Madison really touched me. When I got to see my sweet girl to approve the final touches I’ll never forget the hug Madison Brown and I shared... I felt compassion and warmth. And in the end everyone should have someone like her handling their loved one.

One thing I didn’t like was the lady (Not Madison) who continued to call and beg for reviews on social media or google reviews. It felt so out of touch. And when I told her how I didn’t like that but wanted to help Madison vets way possible I was told, “The best way to help Madison was to give 5 stars on reviews” The calls started maybe 2 weeks after the loss of my daughter... But please keep in mind I am very sensitive since the passing of my daughter.

resp.text: Hayley, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Madison. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Lisa Dougherty
text: Blessings and a huge THANK YOU to Kristi and her staff for providing such compassion and care in helping us plan the service for our sweet son.  Even though we were out of state Kristi's excellent communication made us feel that we were right there.  She even provided us with her personal cell phone number so that we could contact her after hours if needed.  You will forever be in our prayers.

resp.text: Lisa, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Melody Jackson
text: I really appreciate the time and care that Madison Brown gave to my family. She helped us with decision by giving detailed information and was very kind doing it. As hard as it was, Rockco's and Miss Brown made it easier.

resp.text: Melody, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Madison is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Robyn Bennitt
text: My mother died unexpectedly the first week of May.  Rocko called me and told me they had received her body.  I cannot begin to explain how compassionate the phone was.  Madison took care of  me and my family.  I never felt rushed or intimidated.  She allowed me to make decisions in my own time.  The most special kindness my family received was the ability to say goodbye to my mother.  Although she was to be cremated, Rocko prepared my mother for our viewing and our last goodbye.  My mother looked beautiful and so at peace.  We were given as much time by Madison as we wanted.  The amount of professionalism and compassion was unprecedented.  I will always be grateful for this experience.  Thank you.  Robyn Bennitt

resp.text: Robyn, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Madison. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Kathy Hall
text: I was going through a rough time with the death of my grandmother who died at 101 because I take care of my own parents as well. Kristi at Rockco made everything smooth and nothing was left out. She gave the most kind, loving and compassionate care we could have asked for. The reception couldn't have been better and the personalized guest book is something we will always treasure.

name: Deri Herring
text: I just experienced a loss of my dad. I had to best help with everything. I would recommend Kristi Hall to anyone. She was wonderful and very compassionate about everything. If it wasn't for her I would have been completely lost. Thank you again Kristi for everything!! God bless you

name: Tripp Adams
text: Rockcos Funeral Home was truly AMAZING! From the very 1st day of planning arrangements  for my beloved “paw paw” down the very last day it was just such a heartfelt service. All the staff were so compassionate.  A huge THANK YOU to Kristi Hall for how helpful she was to our family! Manuel McCartney will be forever missed and always in our Hearts! I know that he was looking down and overjoyed with excitement that the whole service was decked out in Alabama! Roll Tide Paw Paw!!!🐘❤️

name: Richard Gay
text: I recently purchased a prearranged funeral agreement from Russell Rasco at this location.  Russell was very informative and professional, he also went over all the details of the plan with me.  He also was a pleasure to talk to, has a great personality and fun person to be around.  Also like to mention that the upgrades of the facility look great, looks clean, soothing  and calm.  Just like the over look of the building.   Thanks Russell for being a pleasure to talk to.

name: Nicholas Sabins
text: I would like to give a large thank you to Madison at Rockco Funeral Home. She did an amazing job with the makeup on my grandfather, and the service was great. She was very understanding with my family, and was just amazing with everything. Once again, thank you.

resp.text: Nicholas, I cannot thank you enough for coming online to show your appreciation! Thank you so much for your positive feedback, and please be sure to let me know if we can ever assist you in the future. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Ann Smith
text: The people at Rockco are so amazing and compassionate. The sudden loss of my brother was devastating to our family and I felt Kristi and all the staff cared about our pain. They walked us through everything and worked with the Alabama National Cemetery to allow us to honor our brother. I cannot express how much we how much we appreciate everything they did to help us.

name: Dana Raye
text: Kristi Hall and Tom Hammett were an amazing help to my family when coordinating a recent committal service at the AL National Cemetery. We appreciate their professionalism and compassion. Every detail was perfect!

name: Lynn Terry
text: In the last year my husband has lost both parents.  Today we had a meeting, to finalize coordinating his mother's burial within The Alabama National Cemetery where his father is at peace.An outstanding patient professional staff!!!! We needed the compassion and guidance offered~~

name: Tammy Smith
text: My family has always used this funeral home . Everyone is very professional and sympathetic.  Lindsey Davis has been exceptionally kind and understanding.  The renovations are very nice and make the chapel feel warm, modern and inviting.

name: Mary Pax
text:
Rockco Funeral Home in Montevallo, Alabama offers people one of the absolute best alternatives for funeral arrangements in this area. We say that because Rockco provides local home town service combined with the benefits of SCI Shared Resources Funeral Homes, which are located in most areas in the USA. SCI is important if the pre-plan chooses cremation. The reason for this comes into play when a person dies outside of the local area. When that happens, the family of the deceased only needs to call Russell Rasco or one of the other Rockco personnel. Russell will then contact an SCI funeral home in the area where the individual died. That funeral home will do the cremation. The urn will then be sent where the family wishes. This avoids considerable expense.

In our efforts to reduce the future burden and cost of our funeral arrangements for our children, we decided to explore some of the options regarding funeral arrangements. We didn't know Russell Rasco before we visited the Rockco funeral home on 11/26/19. Russell provided us a lot of information and answered our questions for two hours at that time. We met with Russell again on 11/29/19 for another two hours. Russell patiently gave us all the information we asked for. We only plan to make funeral arrangements once. We believe in doing it right and not overpaying. Rockco Funeral Homes prices are fair. We have good reason to believe that the service we will receive at the time of our death will be as superior as the service Russell Rasco has given us.  J & M Pax

resp.text: Mary, it is our honor and privilege to ensure everything is prepared for in advance. We appreciate you trusting Russell to assist you during this time, and we are here to attend to anything else you may need in the future. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Michelle Raney
text: I would like to extend my appreciation to Rockco's Funeral Home and Lindsey for going above and beyond while caring our family.  You want to know your loved one is in the best hands as you prepare to say your goodbyes.  We lost my mom in March 2019.  Making funeral arrangements is alot of unimaginable choices you don't think about until it's time.  Blessed to have been able to face such a heartbreaking situation with such caring individuals.  They were truly there for all our needs and more.  ~The Reach Family

resp.text: Thank you for extending your appreciation, Michelle, as it's truly wonderful to read you were impressed by our above and beyond care. Being there for your family is absolutely paramount, so if you're ever in need of anything else, please don't hesitate to call on us. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Carolyn Woodie
text:
Kristi Hall helped with the planning and service for my parent's committal service at the Montevallo National Cemetery .Kristi was professional ,supportive and her personal assistance from the beginning of the process was appreciated. Tom Hammett provided s wonderful service as well.
Carolyn Woodie

name: Crystal Wiley
text: When my Nana passed away I talked to Brother Tom Hammett. He helped me and my dad do everything during this very difficult time in our life. I can't thank him enough for his kindness and how much he helped us. Everything was so nice thank you Brother Tom and everybody at Rocko Funeral Home...

name: Angel Dowdy
text: We pre-purchased a funeral package for my father-in-law when he was put on hospice. Russell Rasco assisted us and he was a pleasure to work with. We couldn't make it there before they closed for the day and he arranged to meet us after hours at a time that was convenient for us. This was our first time planning a funeral and he explained everything perfectly and had endless patience with our "first-timer" questions. He made everything seem so simple.  Shortly after we purchased the package, my father-in-law passed and Lindsey helped us finalize all the details for the viewing and the funeral. She was a pleasure to work with as well and would even text us while she was "off duty" to make sure we had everything covered and ready for the day of the service. Everything was beautiful and exactly like we wanted and I can't say enough about how kind and patient all of the staff are. Excellent customer service!!!

name: Scott Wood
text: Kristi Hall was great!  She is naturally a very compassionate person and was very attentive to our needs.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing me to make sure your needs were met in this emotional time, Scott. Your gracious feedback means so much and I hope you will always feel welcome to reach out if you need anything at all. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Tracy Scarbrough
text: Kristie was wonderful. She did absolutely more than I ever expected. She listened to me when I told her what kind of man my husband was and she turned his celebration of life into more than I could have dreamed. And I didnt have to do a thing in a time when I couldn't have done a thing. I truly appreciate how much thought and care went into all they did.

name: Renea Blackerby
text: When my dad passed I called and talked to Russell Rasco.  I didn't have to do anything else. Between Mr.Rasco and Kristi Hall they handled everything and in a very professional manner. I appreciated all they did for me and my family.

name: Laurie Middaugh
text: The entire staff is top notch. Every aspect of the funeral was taken care of in such a professional manner.

name: Tiffany Milstead
text: The last thing a child wants to do is bury their parent, all they really need to do is grieve after such a loss, but things have to be done and set into place. Rockos and their amazingly sweet, caring staff made things so easy for my Sister and my Dad. The facility is beautiful and they really seem to care about your loss. A lot of times you find funeral homes and staff not to concerned about you individually, but at Rockos I really felt like they were apart of the family and were hurting for our loss as much as we were. Lindsey was the best she was extremely helpful and sweet. They took care of everything. If you find yourself unfortunately looking for a funeral home Rockos is your best bet.

resp.text: Tiffany, I am touched to hear you say that it felt like our team was a part of the family. Thank you very much for allowing us to provide support and guidance during this time of sorrow, and please know that you are in our thoughts. If there is anything else we may take care of, I hope you won't hesitate to reach out. -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Jessica Jones
text: I recently attended a funeral here and the renovations have really made it feel warm and welcoming. Lindsey Davis was especially helpful and kind.

name: Tiffany Quinley
text: Very clean and professional environment. Lindsey has always been very helpful and kind.

name: Steve Gilbert
text: I work with the city of montevallo and have a close relationship with Lindsey Davis, Kristi hall, and the rest of the staff at rockco they are avery compassionate and hard working crew. we have thoroughly enjoyed their increased participation in community activities in the past year and look forward to future endeavors with the dignity family.

name: Jim Thompson
text: I appreciate Rocko's and their staff.  I am a pastor in the area and have conducted several funerals with the staff of Rocko's and I have always found them to be professional in every sense of the word.  I have worked with Tom Hammett and Kristi Hall especially and observed them with the grieving families and they are extremely sensitive and courteous to the needs of the family.  As a pastor, I am involved with a number of different funeral homes but the staff at Rocko's is by far my favorite team to work with.  Whatever the situation, I would recommend Rocko's to any family in my church, knowing full well that they will be well cared for in their time of need.

name: Regina Wideman
text:
I called in to make preeneed arrangements for my mother who is no longer able to leave her home. We spoke with Lindsey who was very sweet and set up an appointment for us the following Monday.
Mr Rascoe was nice enough to come to us all the way in Marvel. He walked us through the process step by step making it very simple to understand. We were able to get exactly what she needed on an affordable monthly plan. We will definitely use rockco funeral home in the future especially if all the staff is as kind and accomadating as Russel.

name: Tom Williamson
text: The staff here is absolutely wonderful. Particularly Lindsey Davis who helped our family in a very needy time

name: Chris Williams
text: We needed someone to care, and  they did! I can’t put in to words how much they meant to me on such a difficult day.

name: Lorrie Isbell
text: Amazing 🙌

resp.text: Lorrie, thank you for your feedback, as it is truly appreciated.  -Kristi Hall, General Manager

name: Something Less obvious
text: Service was cool, unfortunately so was the food.

name: Brittany Dill
text: There are not enough stars to fully express our gratitude. We are truly amazed with Southern Heritage Funeral Home and their generosity.  Misty went above and beyond to make this whole process as smooth as possible. The service was breathtakingly beautiful - the flowers, the decorations and especially all the little personal touches she added just for our son. We have no idea how she managed to put it all together on such short notice in the midst of all this corona hysteria, but she did, and it was more perfect than we ever could have imagined. I truly appreciate the comfort, kindness, and detail she has given us during the funeral service all the way to the cremation.

resp.text: Brittany, we are proud to know we have gone above and beyond your expectations as we want every experience to be filled with the comforting and kind service you describe. Thank you for recognizing our professional and compassionate care and please do not hesitate to let us know whenever you require our assistance. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Cindy D
text:
Not good experience -
1. First meeting to prearrange (3/26/21) with Jacob was charged $395 for Everlasting Memorial.  On final arrangements (4/8/21) with Misty we told her we did not want the Everlasting Memorial and she said “Oh we are doing that for free now for families anyway”. Families, be aware!!!!  We would have been charged.
2. Spent extensive time with Misty on requests for the service.  When I got there, it was not done and I redirected.  Pictures were up on the screen which we did not want and our music requests were not qued up.  Their staff communication is horrible.
3. A relative had to call the funeral home before the service and tell them to turn on the video.  The video camera was not set up.

resp.text: Cindy, thank you for providing your perspective.  I would be grateful for the opportunity to further discuss your communication with our staff and the issues with the camera and music. If you would be so kind as to send your phone number and availability in an email to Douglas.Glasscock@Dignitymemorial.com I will contact you directly to address your concerns.  Thank you again and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Carla Hardman
text: The Funeral home has many different types of final resting ideas and various prices. The cemetery is beautiful and the staff were extremely kind. Highly recommend

resp.text: Thank you, Carla, for your high recommendation and praise. We feel privileged to do the work that we do, and I hope you won't hesitate to give us a call if there is anything we may attend to for you. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Mike Bramblett
text: The best experience possible!  They were very professional, thoughtful, and caring throughout the entire experience.

resp.text: It was our team's honor to provide the professional and thoughtful care you describe, Mike, and I appreciate you sharing your experience with us.  If you need anything more, please feel free to call.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: George Gilmore
text: Followed through until the end on every detail.  Made the process bearable under difficult situation.  We are looking at plots for ourself.  Cemetery well kept and staff exceptional!!

Thank you for allowing us to take care of the arrangements and please know that your recognition for our well kept grounds and exceptional staff means a great deal to our team. If you ever need us in the future, we will be here for you.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Susan Maddox
text: Southern Heritage gave us excellent service from start to finish. They were very helpful with planning and explaining all of the details.   They were timely and everything went smoothly.  This was our second time to work with Southern Heritage and with both experiences we felt that the employees there were very professional and met all of our needs. It was a pleasure to work with the staff there as they were very caring.

resp.text: Susan, from start to finish we strive to provide support that is caring and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Mark Garnett
text: Honestly, I can’t more highly recommend Southern Heritage.  The staff is among the best I’ve encountered in any industry, much less one that deals with the unpredictable and difficult circumstances of a loved one’s passing.  They’re professional, empathetic, timely, responsive and extremely thorough.  Jacob, Byron, and Deauna, in particular, provided the kinds of hands on service I’d not experienced before.  A 5 Star experience through and through!

resp.text: Mark, from start to finish we strive to provide support that is caring and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Wendy Meadows
text: Misty Busic helped us through all the steps required to arrange my Father’s service.  She was very thorough and responsive to questions that came up even after his burial.  Thank you, Misty.  Our thanks also go out to Leonetta and Dee who were very helpful throughout the service & burial.  The chapel was set up with memorabilia far beyond our expectations - it looked terrific!  The round tables and brunch that was provided for guests during visitation was a totally new concept for us and most of our friends & family.  Not only did we like it, we received very positive feedback from many.  The only recommendation for change I would like to make is for the microphone volume to be louder at the podium.   For those who live-streamed the service, comments were about how at times it was difficult to hear.  I watched the recording and found it to be way too low.  Overall, my family joins me in thanking all involved for a job well done.

resp.text: Wendy, we take immense pride in ensuring that those we serve are fully supported in every way, and I am heartened by your kind words for our staff. I will be sure to share your words of appreciation with them and hope you will not hesitate to reach out if you should you need anything at all.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Kathryn Williamson
text:
Misty and Leanada (sp) were absolutely wonderful to work with. Both went above and well beyond our expectations. Misty was simply wonderful in arranging and directing the service. Church of the Highlands told my Son and I the service was the most beautiful ever held at their facility.
You certainly have two exceptional employees in Misty and Leanada (sp).

resp.text: Kathryn, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and professional care that is absolutely essential throughout this process and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight Misty and Leanada's service in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: kelly cole
text: Everyone at Southern Heritage was beyond thoughtful and gracious and kind.  It made it easier to handle a difficult time.  The only thing I didn’t understand is why it took so long for them to ask for a copy of my drivers license for the death certificates when they had already gotten one. I may be incorrect but it seems like it’s taking a long time to get them.

resp.text: Kelly, I am touched to hear of your happiness with our services. Thank you for allowing us to take care of the arrangements, and please know that your recognition means a great deal to our team. If you ever need us in the future, we will be here for you.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Lynn Terry
text: I can not describe the compassion and empathy these gals offered. Suddenly finding myself a widow after 33 years of marriage I was basically catatonic. Guiding me and my four children through the depths of paperwork decreased our anxiety. Most impressive was assisting with my husbands death certificate that had been misplaced. I had no funds except the generosity of my husbands friends creating a gofundme page. Without the certificate I couldn’t access anything! These beautiful souls physically went to the hospital finding the right people, finding the physician to sign the paperwork, and physically mailing it. I’m forever thankful for those who go beyond a standard ‘job description’! Also I got to pick my favorite flowers that were arranged fantastically!  #awesomepeople

name: Marsha Price
text: Amazing staff that made everything as painless as possible. It's a rare thing today to see the level of professionalism that was shown in everything they did.  Thankful for the service I received.

resp.text: Marsha, it is wonderful to read of your happiness with the help you received as we strive to exceed the expectations of those we serve.  You and your family are in our thoughts and please do not hesitate to call if there is anything else we may attend to. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Barry Alvis
text: My husband passed away and he had made no arrangements at all. He did not like to attend funerals or even talk about death. Southern Heritage, Pelham, Alabama was AMAZING!  The director, sales staff, and all other associates were kind, empathetic, compassionate and helped us navigate the process. I highly recommend using Southern Heritage. In conclusion, I went back and made my funeral arrangements so the process would be easier for our two children when I pass. Thank you to everyone that helped with the service.

resp.text: Barry, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

text: Just left the church for my grandmothers service. What a beautiful display and such a wonderful way to remember my grandmother. The young lady opening the doors for us was so sweet. text: Planning a funeral and dealing with the events required to lay a loved one to rest are seldom easy. There are several options available in the Birmingham Metro area when selecting a funeral home, but I feel like you would be hard pressed to find one that runs so smoothly and is as accommodating as Southern Heritage. My only regret is Google only has five stars to give, as this place probably deserves more for how they performed recently.

resp.text: Jeremy,  from start to finish, we strive to provide support that is compassionate and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal, and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. name: Elizabeth Crouch
text:
All information was presented in an organized manner with prices noted throughout the process. Amy was very helpful and respectful.

The above was given on the date we prearranged my husband, Michael Crouch, funeral. He passed on October 16. I could never express all the kindness and respect shown to myself and family during this sad time. Jennifer did an absolutely beautiful job setting up all the photos, the videos, and reception for the visitation. It was so extremely well done with the flowers, the University of Alabama decor, and all sports equipment that Mickey enjoyed and coached our children with during their youth! It was all so beautiful. I didn’t have to worry about anything, Southern Heritage handled it all. I cannot express enough how grateful I am to Southern Heritage for all their first class service they provide. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!!

text: Everything went perfect for our service.  I was so impressed with the staff Bob took care of our every need, and by the end of my time spent with you all I felt like I was family,  Where else can you go and their staff was so involved with making sure our needs were met.  I want to send out a big thank you to Jennifer, Misty, Deaunna, Bob and Sandy.  I am blessed to have had you all in my life during a difficult time.  Keep smiling and see you soon.

resp.text: Bill, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was perfect. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your loved one, and if there is anything else we may do for you, please do not hesitate to ask.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Mary Catherine Barnes Sutphin
text:
The team at Southern Heritage Funeral Home delivered outstanding customer service during a time of sorrow for the loss of my precious mother, Cathy J. Barnes.

The funeral director, Deauna Wright, went above and beyond taking care of all details for my mother’s service.  This included working on and off the clock, answering any and all questions, as well as, making sure my family and I were comfortable at all times. Deauna has a compassionate heart and kind spirit that will bring a smile to your face.

The family service counselor, Leonetta Brown Prevo, also delivered excellent customer service to my family and I. The funeral arrangements for my mother have concluded, and Leonetta is still taking care of our family, helping with details that are to be taken care of with the weeks to follow. Her kindness, compassion, and sensitivity to the matters of grieving a lost loved one are immensely helpful, and much appreciated!

The ladies, at Southern Heritage, I had the pleasure of working with included: Deauna, Leonetta, Jessica, and Katie. Each one made this difficult time, more bearable by their positive attitude, respectful nature, and sympathetic hearts. They all exceeded my family’s expectations, and my mother’s services were Beautiful, and complimented by all who attended.

Thank you to the team at Southern Heritage for everything you have done and are continuing to do for me and my family. I will forever be grateful!

-Mary Sutphin

resp.text: Mary, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that our team was able to provide you with such compassionate and excellent service. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything more we can do. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

text: I attended a service last week for one of my fellow police brothers. We worked together years ago at another police dept. I would highly recommend Southern Heritage to anyone. Thank you for taking care of our fallen brother.

text: Thank you Jennifer for taking the time at my friends visitation to sit and chat with me. I never thought I would have lost my friend but you some how made it more comforting being there. Life is short so thanks again and my God bless your staff.

name: Steve Henderson
text:
This place no longer maintains grave sites.
We purchased 50-60 squares of Emerald Zoysia grass for our parents’ grave sites.
Southern Heritage refused to water or maintain the grass on the sites.
Therefore I strongly urge you to NOT use their facility.

resp.text: Steve, this is certainly not the impression we want to leave you with, and I am grateful that you took a moment to reach out. Please allow me to connect with you and ensure your concerns are addressed, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Douglas.Glasscock@Dignitymemorial.com at your earliest convenience. I appreciate your communication, and I look forward to speaking with you. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

text: Thank you Sandy Herron for the beautiful memorial bookmarks you created for my dad. They are treasured among the family even amongst the young grandkids. If you're looking for a place that will go above and beyond to ensure you have the small details done right this is the place to call.

name: Lettie Crowson
text: I attended a funeral here recently. The location, the service and burial were absolutely beautiful! The staff was so kind and accommodating. I hope my funeral aid as beautifully handled as my friends.

resp.text: Lettie, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional care. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing and do not hesitate to reach out should you ever need us.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Jeff Collins
text: Our best friends recently lost their brother, who was still a relatively young man, and it was very difficult on the family. Our friends are from out of town and really had to rely on you guys to step up. The lady helping them was Misty Busic and evening in a tough situation remained professional, helpful and most of all compassionate. I wanted to thank you on my friends behalf and especially to Misty for fully. being there for them.

resp.text:
Being here for you during this difficult time is our mission, Jeff. If we can be of any further assistance, please don't hesitate to call. Thank you.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Harold Wheatley
text: Thank you Jennifer for taking care of all our families needs. The compassion shown to us was greatly appreciated. We could not have asked for a more beautiful service. You and the staff there are truly first class.

resp.text: Harold, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Jennifer. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Leigh Ann Evans
text: Anytime I've ever attended a funeral at SH it has always been professionally and compassionately handled. At the funeral last week of a dear friend I met Misty & another lady (I'm having trouble remembering her name) who were so understanding & knowledgeable of the police & military aspects as well.

resp.text: Leigh, from start to finish, we strive to provide support that is compassionate and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal, and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Tom Cusker
text: Great people, did a great job.  Deauna Wright was a wonderful person to work with.  She handled everything perfectly.   I did not have to worry about anything during this trying time.  My wife's death happened suddenly and before I could call them Deauna called me since we had prearranged my wife's service.  I was blessed to have Southern Heritage.

resp.text: Tom, I am so sorry for your loss. Knowing that we were able to make this difficult time a bit easier gives us confirmation that we are delivering the level of service we strive toward, and I'm grateful for your heartfelt comments. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: mike williams
text: A friend and co-worker recently passed. It never gets easier. Misty went out of her way to comfort everyone involved. Truly a blessing. Thank you for all you did.

resp.text: Mike, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Misty is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Mark Bean
text: In 2007, Southern Heritage assisted our family with the passing of my dad. We were taken care of by Bob and the staff, helping us through all phases of decision making. It made our time of mourning so much more bearable. On December 20th of this year our mom passed, and again, just as we were so wonderfully taken care of with my dad, so it was with our mom. We requested Bob and was fully taken care of through all the decisions we had to make. From our experience your family will be taken care in every facet with no pressure. Thank you Bob and Southern Heritage!

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Bob is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: J Ni
text: Our experience was very good. All matters were handled very professionally and courteously. The details concerning the many decisions to be made were laid out and made simple. Our confidence in Southern Heritage was well rewarded.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing such a thoughtful message.  We consider it a privilege to offer the professional and detailed care you describe, and we would be honored to attend to anything else that you may need. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Donnie Burke
text: Deauna and Jennifer were so thoughtful and compassionate through the whole process.  We could have chosen any funeral establishment ,but now  I can't imagine having to go  through this any other way.  You are both great and what you do, and have the perfect personality for the job.  It is nice to walk into a place of business, and be blessed to see wonderful smiles.  thanks again.

resp.text:
Thank you for your kind words, Donnie. It was a privilege as well as an honor to serve you and your family through these difficult times. If we can be of any further assistance, please don't hesitate to call.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Becca Lawson
text: Thank you Jennifer for making a very hard time much more bearable. There is no doubt my mother was in great hands. The first time we spoke I felt comfortable and did not dread coming in I like I thought I would. You not only did an amazing job but I’m glad I have a new friend. Much gratitude!!

resp.text:
Becca, our team was grateful for the opportunity to provide kind, empathetic, and efficient service. Thank you for taking the time to show your appreciation, and we hope you will feel free to reach out if there is anything we may do for you in the future.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Elizabeth Biel
text: My cousin passed away very unexpectedly in September.  Knowing the level of service we have always received at this location, I encouraged my aunt and uncle to reach out to them and they were very pleased.  From their facilities to their staff, they go above and beyond with their customer service.  We have been doing business with Stephen U for many years.  He is very personal, professional, and sincere. You will not be disappointed.

name: Ashley King
text: Jaynee is an amazing director. She is attentive, professional, and cares deeply about providing the best experience possible for families during one of life's greatest transitions. She goes above and beyond to ensure she meets the needs of families who are navigating grief and loss while being respectful of their wishes. Her attention to detail and commitment to excellence shows through in the way she speaks to and interacts with families and co-workers.

resp.text: Reading about how Jaynee was able to exceed your expectations is truly uplifting, Ashley. She will be made aware about your positive feedback. If there is anything we can attend to for you, please reach to us. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Amanda Martin
text: Everyone here was very kind and professional and helpful and went out of the way to do everything they could for us.

Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager -

name: TyAri Salas
text: Misty is by far the absolute best! She knows her stuff and cares for the family like it’s her own! If you ever need a funeral home to service you ! Ask for Misty and she will take great care of you.

resp.text: TyAri, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us.  Your praise of Misty is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this difficult time.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Connie Wallace
text: Kind, professional and provided excellent assistance in navigating through all that is involved in our recent loss. Costs are high (thus only four stars) but probably are the going rate of the industry. Would recommend

resp.text: Connie, thank you for sharing such a thoughtful review. We consider it a privilege to offer the professional and detailed care you describe, and we would be honored to attend to anything else that you may need.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Eric Holt
text: What an amazing group of people. The compassion and attentiveness was beyond my expectations. I have been to many funeral homes and I must say the level of service I encountered says a lot about your location. You all are not only a group of individuals that know how to do your job well but also very kind and I will be by to take you up on that cup of coffee and sit and chat. You have made a tough thing easier my friends. See you soon. Eric

resp.text:
I am touched to hear you say that our team was welcoming and compassionate throughout the entire process, Eric, as this is always our goal.  Please know that we are only a phone call away, should you need anything at all.

name: Ronald Kirby
text: Your professionalism was outstanding.  I could not have asked for anything more!  I know my love one was treated with the up most respect.

name: Daniel Endress
text: I am totally satisfied with the professionals that I have come to know first as the Fire Chief and then as a family member of those that have passed.  These people have been the best at providing the very BEST to insure that myself and ALL Family members are taken care of to the BEST.   You know the individuals that have HELPED ME and MY Family.   They have done the VERY BEST Possible............

name: Freida Melton
text: I would like to thank Bob, Jennifer, Carla, and Deauna for the assistance with my mom's service.  They all were so attentive to our needs, and made the process much more pleasant.  I could not believe my eyes when I saw the church decorated with all of moms favorite things, Carla did an excellent job capturing what she truly loved in life.  The personality of these incredible people proves they are doing what they are called to do.

resp.text:
Freida, our team was proud to offer the compassionate care necessary to carry out a service for your beloved Mom that honored her memory.  I am grateful for your heartfelt message, and you and your family are in our thoughts.

text: Misty Busic and staff provided excellent service and communication through the entire process. text: Made an appointment at Southern Heritage funeral home to complete my burial /  funeral pre- arrangements. Been dreading this task for along time. Met with Jacob Myers and Jennifer Coleman. name: Richard McLemore
text: I am so grateful to the staff at Southern Heritage.  With the recent passing of a close family member, we were privileged to be served by Deauna, during our initial and follow-up contacts.  On the day of the visitation, service and burial, we were cared for by Jennifer, as the funeral director, who was supported by Rob & Kate.  The care, compassion and gratitude displayed by all of these individuals, made the process so much easier, all things considered.  Funerals are always difficult, due to loss.  Southern Heritage works diligently to make the process as smooth as possible.

resp.text: We were privileged to be of service to your family, Richard. Your review lets us know that we are providing the level of care we strive toward, and I am grateful that you came online to share. Should you need anything at all in the future, please don't hesitate to reach out. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Amy Wright
text: I attend my uncles service at Southern Heritage last week. Beautiful place and they did such a wonderful job. I was amazed that the funeral home was able to hold a lunch after the service in a room that was decorated with my uncles military uniform, auburn memorabilia and his fishing rods and tackle. I live in Georgia and they did't do any of this for my father in law's service.  My aunt loved it. Thank you to the staff here for making such a hard time easier. Great Job!

name: Sue Watkins
text: When my father died a few weeks ago I was at a loss of where to turn. Southern Heritage was recommended to me by a dear friend. I am glad I entrusted Southern Heritage and all of the wonderful staff with the care of my wonderful father. Stephen was so helpful in planning all the details and getting the obituary placed in all of the newspapers. The visitation and catered reception the night before the funeral was so lovely. The staff that was with us that night was so kind and caring. Then at the church the next morning everything was in place and the directors were there waiting on us and helped us through the remainder of the day. My family is pleased with the way everything was handled by Southern Heritage.

name: Susie Hammers
text: Our family member recently passed away.  All the arrangements were handled with great compassion at Southern Heritage.  Jaynee, our funeral director, arranged a memorial service at the chapel and also coordinated a military burial service in Montgomery.  She reviewed, typed, and submitted the obituary that we provided.  We appreciate the kind attention that she provided during our time of loss.

resp.text: I'm delighted to know that Jaynee was very helpful to you and your family during this unfortunate situation, Susie. Your praises will be brought to her attention. If there is anything we can attend to for you going forward, please give us a call. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Randal Ferguson
text: Thank you to the entire staff for an amazing personable service for my father. It’s was nice to come in contact with individuals that truly care about what they do and go above and beyond. I highly recommend this location!

resp.text: Randal, we consider it a privilege to go above and beyond for those we serve. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your father, and please know that your recommendation means a great deal to our team. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: D. R.
text: I have been working with Southern Heritage for over 6 years and they have always been very helpful and informative in all my transactions.  I appreciate the concern and patience they have shown in dealing with sensitive situations.  My latest transactions have dealt with advance planning and Amy has been super helpful in providing various options without any pressure.  I would highly recommend Southern Heritage for immediate as well as future needs.

name: Sarah Kathryn M.
text: If you're looking for a funeral home, you could go to several different places. However, if you're looking for a staff that will treat you like their own family, look no further. Southern Heritage approaches every service with specific and intentional care. The staff works overtime to make sure you're taken care of and satisfied. When you choose Southern Heritage, you're choosing family, you're choosing comfort, you're choosing excellency. I would recommend Southern Heritage to anyone and everyone in need of their services.

name: Terry Williams
text: Jennifer it was very nice meeting you and thank you for taking the time to sit with me and explain the importance of preplanning. I plan on taking the steps to protect my loved ones and make life a little easier on them. Thanks again hope your vacation was wonderful.

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us, Terry.  Your praise of Jennifer is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this difficult time.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Elizabeth Biel
text: We had the pleasure of working with Doug at Southern Heritage during the recent passing of our grandmother a few weeks ago. The other staff we encountered on our visit were amazing as always. This is why we use Southern Heritage and hope that you have the same experience as we did.

We work diligently to ensure those we serve are supported every step of the way, Elizabeth, and I treasure your kind remarks. It was an honor for us to be part of your Grandmother's service. Please let us know if we may ever be of further service to your family.

name: Steve Ducicツ
text: I met with Miriam today for lunch and she is an Account Manager at Southern Heritage to discuss plans for my wife and 3 kids and she was great! There are many choices for a funeral home and I've shopped them all and Southern Heritage will be the one!  And ask for Miriam if you stop in.

text: When my mother passed away in 2003 we used this facility. I just recently visited again when a coworker passed and WOW how amazing the location looks inside. Beautiful location and always great service.

name: Carol Johnson
text: Bob and the entire staff were excellent.  They took care of all the details to give my dad a beautiful service. They showed genuine compassion and concern for my family during a difficult time.

resp.text:
As we endeavor to take care of every detail for those we serve, Carol, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything went seamlessly. Thank you for allowing us to honor your father, and please know that your family is in our thoughts.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Jennifer Saliba
text: The team at Southern Heritage was simply outstanding in handling even the smallest of details for my father-in-law’s funeral.  Alisa and Bob were spectacular in all aspects of planning, execution, and comfort provided to our family during one of the most difficult periods in our lives.

resp.text: Jennifer, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that members of our team were able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Alisa and Bob. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Terry Ingram
text: You were very helpful in my time of need.  Thank you very much.

resp.text: Terry, thank you for expressing your thoughts, as we take comfort in providing the helpful and compassionate care that is absolutely essential in one's time of need. Please know that we are here for you if you need anything else at all. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Beth Edwards
text: Wonderful working with Deona and Leonetta.

resp.text: Beth, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Melanie Flynn
text: Everything went great for my grandmothers funeral. They really listened to all our request and made it easy to plan in such a time of sadness. It was all easy to understand as far as the services rendered for the cost. The staff was amazing as well.

text: I wasn't aware you all could have the gathering with food and drinks. That was a wonderful touch to the amazing service for my best friend. Great Job by everyone at Southern Heritage.

resp.text: Mona, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering professional and friendly service. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

Receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional care, Diana. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing.
