text: Tracey Warren help my wife and I both be very comfortable with the entire process of picking our locations out at Southern Heritage.  Tracey carefully walked us through everything to think about so we could make the best decision for us.  We are very pleased with the entire process.

name: Peggy Nethery
text: Deauna and her staff were awesome! They took very good care of our family and made sure that we had everything we needed and more, she listen to my needs and concerns.

resp.text: Peggy, our team strives to provide every family with the utmost attentive care, so we appreciate you highlighting our efforts in your review. We are honored to be here for you, and please know that we are always here to go above and beyond for you.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Frank Walters
text: I was very pleased with the high level of service and integrity showed to me and my family by Mr. Stephen Ulmer. He took care of us like we needed to be taken care of, and everything was great. Loved the food as well. We enjoyed our reception so much. Thanks again.

name: Debbie Wilon
text: We were warmly greeted upon arrival to make the arrangements of my dads funeral. Our experience was very hard, but the staff at Southern Heritage seemed to make it a little more pleasant.....  Overall it was as good as it could have been under the circumstances.

name: Sue Nichols
text: Today we went to visit our son"s grave site for Easter. We cant say enough on how we appreciate your work crew of how much they must have worked in the Cementery to get it especially ready for Easter. It was beautiful and such a blessing to all of us. God bless All of your staff. Thank you.  Sue & Bill Nichols family of Matthew Stone Nichols.

resp.text: Sue and Bill, thank you for your thoughtful feedback regarding your Easter visit. Providing a beautiful resting place for your son is a responsibility that we take very seriously, and I hope you will feel free to contact us any time we may be of service. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Lacie Jones
text: Every family that enters Doug’s office is always pleased. I use to work for a company in which I would work with Doug occasionally and he would always be very kind and helpful. The staff at Southern Heritage are wonderful!! I would recommend 100%.

name: Tara Wilson
text: Thank you Jennifer for your kind words and professionalism on my friends mother's service. The funeral home did an amazing job! Good to see you.

resp.text: Tara, I appreciate your kind message regarding your friend's mother's service, and will make sure to share it with Jennifer. If there is anything else we may do for you in the future, please don't hesitate to give me a call. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Stacy McCombs
text: Wonderful experience under the circumstances. Very professional staff. Thank you for all you do.

resp.text: Stacy, thank you for sharing such a thoughtful review. We consider it a privilege to offer the professional and detailed care you describe, and we would be honored to attend to anything else that you may need.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Christine Huizinga
text: The Southern Heritage team (Stephen, Rob and Leonetta) made a difficult process seem quick and effortless. They were so courteous and sympathetic to me and my family, allowing us time to decide, change our minds. The funeral service was simple and exactly what we wanted. I couldn’t imagine going through this process without Southern Heritage - we were very well taken care of. Thank you!

name: Janice Bickerstaff
text: The staff at Southern went the extra mile to truly celebrate my sister's life. Carla Lane made beautiful display tables using my sister's quilts thatthat  it feel like our home. Thank you so much for giving us the opportunity to truly celebrate her life and the things she loved.

name: Angie Sullivan
text: My grandmother passed the Friday before Memorial Day. She was 93 and I helped my parents make arrangements. We were so weary after 2 weeks in hospital and 2 weeks home with hospice. We had to have service on Memorial Day because out of town family could come and get back to work on Tues. Jessica and Steven helped every step of the way and was available for all my questions throughout the holiday weekend. Thank you all for helping us. My Mom is mostly blind and you were both so kind to guide me through this difficult time.

name: Amy Dunigan
text: My son was buried on May the 12th 2017. He was only 8 years old. As sad as this is Southern Heritage was the most gracious Funeral Home. They provided not only their services but extreme sympathy and kindness. I feel a bond has been created with them which helps me feel closer to my son. I cannot express enough how wonderful they are! Thank you Tracey!!!

name: Sarah Thompson
text: I want to take the time and thank Doug for helping my family and I. He walked us through every step of the way. We felt comfort and at ease from the time we meet him. This was a hard time for us all, but he helped us through it all. Thank you so much for helping.

name: Bernadette Gawne
text: We contacted the funeral home for assistance.  Misty was most helpful in answering all our questions.  Thank you!!

resp.text:
Bernadette, it is wonderful to hear that Misty knew just what you needed. Thank you very much for sharing your experience, and please do not hesitate to contact us any time we may be of assistance.
-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Eddie Riley
text: Wonderful job by the staff.  I came to a service here on Saturday afternoon and the staff was so nice a kind from the minute I entered the door. Beautiful facility. A1 Service.

name: Larry Shores
text: I attended a service here on Monday. Very kind staff that did a great job and the building is beautiful and large to handle the crowds. Highly recommend!

name: Bob F.
text: We had a very good experience from start to finish while at Southern Heritage. Our thanks and appreciation to Stephen and the rest of the staff. You made the service personal with all of the decorations and memorabilia and we couldn't have been more pleased.

name: Miriam Phillips
text: When my Mother passed away, I came to Southern Heritage to make arrangements. I met with Funeral Director, Bob Murdaugh, who was so helpful and kind. I couldn’t have been more pleased with the way the service was handled. And seeing my Mom for the last time looking so peaceful and beautiful means so much.

name: Diane Mccrary
text:
The anniversary of my mother-in-law’s death is approaching and I have been thinking of her. I helped to care for her and since I was nearby I helped with the arrangements.
In thinking back all I can say is, “I don’t know what I’d have done without Bob Murdaugh and his wise, knowledgeable, caring help!!”  I was so anxious and nervous and he calmly guided me through choices even down to Mam-ma’s lipstick color and hair dressing.
I was quite comfortable with him and he was an IMMENSE help at the funeral with seating and keeping on schedule when I was tearful and upset. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

name: Taylor Coleman
text: My experience was very comforting they made me feel like I was getting the best care possible. Thanks for the professionalism and knowledge.

resp.text:
Taylor, it has been our privilege to be of service to you. Thank you for placing your trust in us, and for coming online to share such a kind review. We remain at your service, should you need anything at all.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Faith Stoneage
text: I attended a service for my neighbor there last week and it was wonderful. The food was delicious at the celebration after the service and the pictures and his personal items being displayed were a great touch. Thank you for taking care of my good friends.

text: My family was very happy with our grandmother’s funeral. Bob Murdaugh was such a huge help and took so much time to make sure every detail was to our liking! It was obvious that he really cared and made sure the process was as smooth as possible during such a difficult time in our lives.

text: Thank you to Jennifer and Byron for your compassion last week. What a beautiful service for an amazing  woman. Thanks again.

name: A Google User
text:
My experience with Southern Heritage Funeral was made easier with the help of Bob Murdaugh. My dad was a Veteran and our family wanted that represented in his service.
Bob was patient and insightful while we made decisions. Air Force servicemen were available for the folding and presenting of the flag to my mom. Also, the playing of Taps and three guns to honor him with a nine gun salute.
We opted for a reception after the service. I heard many comments about the food and venue. Our many guests were welcomed by the staff and didn’t feel rushed to leave.
Southern Heritage followed up with calls and texts days after the service. We were well pleased under the circumstances of our loss.

name: A Google User
text: Have used them twice and both times were very pleased. The whole staff was on top of their game and two months after the funeral they are still in touch with me! I was sad to hear of Lisa leaving but Jessica is the BEST!!!

text: Southern Heritage was very helpful and caring towards me and my family when my wife passed away last year. Bob Murdaugh was extremely kind and helped me with so many details during that difficult time. I would highly recommend Bob and Southern Heritage whenever their services may be needed.

name: A Google User
text: Huge thank you to Mr. Glasscock and Southern Heritage Cemetery for caring and helping re-rod my mothers gravesite. It’s been so difficult keeping grass around her resting place. I come in a couple months ago, upset with my concern, and they were very pleasant and quick to help. Mr. Glasscock was so welcoming and friendly. He took me back out to the cemetery to see for himself and informed me it would be taken care of. I don’t live in the area so it’s hard for me to come by as often as I would like, so a week later, I receive a picture of the work that had been completed. Thank you for all you do and for easing my mind. You went above and beyond what I expected. I plan to visit soon!

text: Bob Murdaugh was the best! He made a difficult time  so much easier with all of his help. He answered phone calls and texts even after hours. The service was beautiful and everyone was so nice.

text: Excellent service I would rate my experience as a 10+!!! Everything was wonderful! Thank you all Jennifer Coleman.

resp.text: Receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional care. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Sandra Clemens
text: I would highly recommend this funeral home. Everyone was so nice and friendly, and our director was attentive to meet our needs. They went above and beyond to make this painful part of our lives go as smooth as possible. If you need a funeral home, Southern Heritage is the place to go.

name: Melissa Martin
text: My families first experience with Southern Heritage was 30 years ago when my grandfather passed away. I was still in high school at the time so my memories are very vague but I knew my parents had gone ahead and purchased their “property”as my mom refers to it (burial plots) during that time. In 2007, my father passed away very suddenly at the age of 56. My fathers funeral was one of Bob Murdaugh’s first to oversee. It was so nice to have a familiar face guiding us through the process of planning the details of the service. I had known Bob and his wife Audrey for many years (going to the same church) and they were both a tremendous blessing to my family during this time. Seven years later, my brother passed away...again a sudden event and Bob was there to hold us up and pray for and comfort us all. I am thankful that Bob was there during both of these times for my family!

name: Bob Lochamy
text: I was blessed with the opportunity to assist our dear friend Kathy Clarkson and her family after the untimely death of their husband, father, and grandfather and my long time personal and professional friend Art Clarkson. Words can’t express the appreciation as to how Robert Murdaugh and Carla Layne were absolutely incredible and their efforts were extraordinary and their level of concern and compassion were so instrumental in walking Kathy and her family and friends through this special time. Hats off to Robert & Carla and their Southern Heritage associates.

resp.text: Bob, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Jeff Thompson
text: Thanks so much Deauna,Rob,and Jennifer for your kindness. Everything was beautiful and Our family could not have asked for anything more. Thanks again.

resp.text: Thank you for coming online to convey your gratitude, Jeff. I am grateful for your recognition, and I hope you will let us know if there is anything else we may take care of. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Angie Martin
text: When my mother passed away, Bob Murdaugh was so kind and compassionate. He helped me through every step of the planning process and I didn’t have to worry about a thing. He saw to all the arrangements and even went out of his way to help us work out an issue with her insurance. I could not have asked for better service! Thanks, Bob, and all the fine staff at Southern Heritage.

name: Jon Stewart
text: Everyone here is so very helpful. Stephen Ulmer helped our family in such a caring way. He treated us like family and we would definitely recommend him to everyone.

name: Stephen Dooley
text:
When my mother passed away 1 month before Christmas we were lost. We contacted Southern Heritage and made a appointment. Lost and upset, we  didn't know what to expect. The staff went out of their way to honor our mother and make her service memorable.  Thank you all for your caring nature and your help when our mother passed. You will always have a special place in our hearts.

Dooley Family

name: Lauren Walton
text: I would recommend Southern Heritage. My mom, sisters, and I worked primarily with Bob Murdaugh to make arrangements for my father. Bob was kind, professional, and helpful during every step. All the staff treated my family with care.

name: Clarissa Williams
text: "VERY SATISFIED WITH ALL THAT WAS DONE BY SOUTHERN HERITAGE FUNERAL HOME. " GREAT STAFF

resp.text:
Clarissa, it has been our privilege to be of service to you. Thank you for placing your trust in us, and for coming online to share such a kind review. We remain at your service, should you need anything at all.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Melissa Poskarbiewicz
text: The facility was clean and welcoming. The personnel presented themselves with the utmost respect for the family and in a very professional manor from greeting us when we arrived, to us leaving. During the devastating time of the death of a treasured and beloved family member, you need the process to go as smooth as possible. We found just that with Doug Glasscock. He truly showed empathy and solicitude. Although the arrangements were predetermined, Doug assisted in giving the family guidance and a little comfort by taking some of the pressure off of them by going through all of the available options of packages and even suggesting alternative ones, all while showing sympathy and compassion. When the time comes to need funeral services again, Southern Heritage Funeral Home in Pelham, AL will be the place I contact.

name: Stuart Williams
text: Great staff! Thank you for helping my grandmother when my grandfather passed. The Military service was amazing and he would have been So proud.

name: Harry Caldwell
text: We were very pleased with the assistance we received from the full staff at Southern Heritage, coordinated by Funeral Director Bob Murdaugh. From the initial contact through planning the printed program, visitation, ceremony, reception and burial Bob and staff guided us through each step of the way and made sure everything went according to plan. Bob's background in journalism and graphic arts helped up develop a attractive program, slideshow and Memory book. Because they capably handled all of the details we were able to spend our time visiting with those who were there to offer their condolences.

name: Bev Peterson
text:
The staff is amazing. We had no clue what we were about to face when our mom died. We called the funeral home around 1am when mom passed. We were transfered through to  Doug. He spent the next 30min with us on the phone answering all of our questions and putting our mind at ease. The next day we met with Bob and he was wonderful. Our plan was to have mom cremated. Bob showed us that just since we were doing Cremation that didn’t mean we couldn’t do a service. With the help from Bob, Alisa and Carla we had a wonderful memorial service for our mother with her quilts, pictures and favorite thing decorating the chapel. We will never forget you all. Thank you SO much for helping us Celebrate our mothers life.

The Petersons

name: Lori Burns
text: Would definitely recommend this funeral home to anyone, beautiful plots, staff treats you like family, services are organized with love and care as if they were part if the family. Very loving staff!!

name: jaida parker
text: Deauna is such a sweet, compassionate individual & definitely a pleasure to work with. Great asset to the company!

resp.text: Thank you for complementing the efforts of Deauna. I will spread your thoughtful words to her. If we can do anything for you, we are only a phone call away. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Sharon Thomas
text: Excellence service was given to me and my family following my Fathers death.  Robert Murdaugh met with me on the first day, and went over the necessary steps and procedures.  I was very pleased with our meeting, and all the steps that followed.  My Fathers Visatation,  Chapel service, and the Graveside went on like planned and without a hitch.  I appreciate all the help and service that Bob and the staff provided for my family and our guests.

name: Bette Vos
text:
I want to say "thank you" to everyone at Southern Heritage and especially Bob
Murdaugh for all you did to help me and my family through the loss of my husband. Bob listened to what I had to say and I never felt pressured. Bob was always kind and understanding even when I changed my mind several times. Thank you again for all you did to help me during this very tough time.

name: Savannah Swindle
text: I am very impressed with Ms. Deauna's professionalism and dedication. Highly recommend.

resp.text: I'm pleased that Ms. Deauna left a positive impression on you, Savannah. Her efforts will be brought to her attention. Please know that you can always contact us if you have any questions or requests. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Warren Watkins
text: After our son-in-law died in December, we never expected to be back for our daughter's funeral six weeks later. Southern Heritage has been a blessing to our whole family. Their staff did everything and anything we asked to help us get through the most difficult time in our life. Nothing anyone could do could take away our grief, but everything the staff did helped make our experience much more bearable. It has been almost two months since our daughter's funeral and Southern Heritage is still helping us get through this difficult experience. We needed all the help we could get and Southern Heritage has been and is still a great blessing to our entire family. We are so grateful for the people at Southern Heritage.

name: Raymond McAdory
text: I was really pleased with the facility, directors, and the cemetery. The service was excellent. I am so thankful for Stephen and Machelle. They helped make such a difficult time a lot easier.

name: Lori Burns
text: Wonderful staff! They make you feel like family. Very nice spacious facility and well kept cemetery, would most definitely recommend Southern Hertage Funeral Home!

name: Joey Moore
text: My wife’s grandmother’s funeral was here.  They were so professional and helpful the day we came to market arrangements, they were polite and didn’t rush us and made the entire process much easier.

resp.text: We consider it an honor to provide support and guidance every step of the way, Joey. Thank you very much for sharing your kind words for our team, and please know that we are here for you and your family. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Donna Baird
text: When my husband passed away in December, 2016, I went to Southern Heritage to choose a burial site and plan his graveside service.  Alisa Sims met with me and instantly put me at ease.  She is warm and caring, taking as much time as I needed to talk about plans and to discuss and look at plots.  I never felt hurried or rushed.  Alisa listened to what I wanted and made sure everything ran smoothly.  A couple of months later, I returned to design his headstone.  I took my small dog with me and he was readily accepted.  Once again, Alisa and the staff took the time I needed.  It was a relaxed and unhurried atmosphere.  I know they were busy, but Alisa and staff treated me like I was the only one there.  We designed a beautiful monument.  My husband’s plot is beautiful and well kept.  Alisa frequently checks on it when she is on the grounds.  She always makes sure I am happy and satisfied with its appearance.  Whenever I go to his grave, I always stop in the office.  Alisa and the staff at Southern Heritage have become an extended family for my pup and me.  They greet him with a dish of water and an occasional dog treat.  They always ask about him if I visit without him.  I truly could not have asked for a better experience than what I have had with Alisa Sims and the staff at Southern Heritage.

name: Justin Hyde
text: Before my grandmother passed away she had already arranged everything years before. She searched for the best place to take care of her when would lay to rest. So she chose Southern Heritage. When the day finally come she was brought here. They took such great care of her and our family. Everything was perfect and taken care of down to the smallest detail. couldn't have asked for better group of people to handle it all. Thanks for making a tough situation alot easier on all of us. Godbless.

name: Heather Gambey
text: Southern Heritage could have not made this a better day. Although we were all for a loss of words, the service was beautiful and the staff was remarkable. It felt like a family the way we were treated. Thank you to everyone and especially the funeral director Doug.

name: Matthew Reynolds
text: I have actually dealt with Southern Heritage on multiple occasions, and have always been satisfied. Arrangements have always been handled well, and smooth. Wonderful Service

name: Violet Mardis
text: The staff at Southern Heritage is so professional and kind.   When my husband passed away Doug Glasscock took care of all of the arrangements.  We had pre-arranged with Alisa Sims many years back and it made everything much easier.  The arrangements, service, flowers and food were absolutely perfect and I couldn't have been more pleased.  Southern Heritage has a great staff and will make sure every detail is taken care of.

name: Victor Montgomery
text: I would highly recommend Southern Heritage Funeral Home to anyone. The staff is incredible and very thoughtful.

resp.text:
We are thankful for thoughtful reviews like yours, Victor, and it means a lot to us that you took a moment to share your experience. Should you ever need anything else, please know that we are here for you.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Susan Thomas Brandon
text: Everyone at Southern Heritage were so kind and understanding, from the pre arrangements to the final service.  The celebration of my mother's life went beautifully.  Bob Murdaugh handled all request with lots of patience.  I am so grateful that they were there to help my family through this difficult time.

name: Nancy Redd
text: During this extremely difficult time my family and I couldn’t have asked for a kinder more understanding person than Mr Murdaugh. He and the staff handled all the details with compassion, and while saying goodbye to a beloved husband after fifty years is hard, the beautiful service they helped provide  will always be remembered.

name: Roger Hill
text: Thank you for the care shown to my family. Our directors was Doug Glasscock. He and Amy did a great job. We are so very happy that we used Southern Heritage. Thank you.

name: Abbie Pike
text: We had a service for my Grandfather and it was beautiful. The staff was personable, efficient, and kind. Thank you for the hospitality!

name: Kendralyn Houser
text: Leonetta P. is very knowledgeable and compassionate with you when making these necessary arrangements. Somehow, she removes the fear and makes you happy you made things easier for your loved ones.

name: Randy Otwell
text:
Bob murdaugh has been a treasure to my family, helping us through death of loved one, even preaching the funeral for us.
Love him, he's the best

name: Shelby Jones
text: Beautiful facility. Everyone is so caring and comforting. Thanks to all that were there for us through the passing of my grandmother.

name: David Edmondson
text:
Very professional and caring place.
They took really good care of my family.
Highly recommended

name: Rachel J
text: Deauna is the most wonderful and polite person to work with. Wonderful service!

Jan, I am thankful for your kind acknowledgment. We appreciate the trust you have placed in us, and are readily available to assist with any additional requests you may have.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: juanita lawley
text: The manager, Doug Glasscock, puts his best interest in the families he meets, and will do the best he can to help people within his means. Great guy to know

name: Lynne Thomas
text: Doug was a courteous gentleman who provided comprehensive counseling. When the time comes for my loved one, I won’t be in a panic.

name: Ray Guthrie
text: I had a great experience completing my pre-arrangement with Miriam.  I am happy that this has been handled and will be no burden for my family and love ones in the future.

name: Lola McNutt
text: Jaynee Hall and staff provide excellent service and I would highly recommend .

resp.text: Lola, I truly appreciate your thoughtful feedback, as it means the world to know that Jaynee was there for you during this challenging time. If you ever need anything else, we are always here for you. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Wayne Goodwin
text: Sang at a funeral there yesterday. The absolute WORST SOUND SYSTEM this side of the universe. I was so embarrassed for the family and friends. My question is (1) what’s more important—cashing your check or providing a professional service for grieving families? Apparently, getting the money is most important to these people. Never again.

name: Machelle Steffen
text: Amy was wonderful!! She assisted me with finding  the perfect marker for my mothers gravesite.  She took the time to take me into the cemetery to me an idea what the finished product wod look like.

name: June Prevo
text:
I used Southern Heritage when my father died. Doug Glasscock and the entire staff were outstanding. My brothers and I had a specific casket that we wanted and we were able to have that casket because of their attention to detail. Dad's favorite color was purple and those who worked the service honore him by wearing purple.
Thank you all!

name: Jessica
text: Jaynee’s level of professionalism and genuine care is second to none. She is a joy to work with!

resp.text: Jessica, I appreciate you taking a moment to share your kind thoughts about Jaynee. I will let her know that she was tremendously helpful. If there is anything we can attend to, please contact us. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Sarah Moseley
text: Can I give Southern Heritage and Stephen, Doug, and Bob 10 stars?!  They are wonderful.  Stephen, thank you for being our "rock".  I thank God for you.

name: Hogan Perry
text: Wonderful caring people. Had services there last year. Staff was wonderful!

name: Greg Waldrop
text: Beautiful location. Thank you all for everything. The entire staff was so caring and easy to work with.

name: Miriam Bootier
text: Nice place. Nice people. I recommend their services to anyone in need

name: Raymon Glasscock
text: I’ve been to funerals here and they represent the families excellent. They follow up with the family’s and are there for anything you may need or any questions you’d like answered.

name: Lee Gable
text: Very friendly and compassionate staff, very helpful in your time of need. Highly recommend their services.

name: Chasity Philen
text: When my husband passed unexpectedly on Christmas Day at 28 years old, I was also 37 weeks pregnant with our 3rd child. The last thing I wanted to be doing was planning a funeral, but Doug and every employee at Southern Heritage went above and beyond to make the most horrific time of my life so much easier and they handled the situation with such grace and dignity. They were there very step of the way and have been even after. They have been prompt with making sure the right things were taken care of on the business side of things, but have also been making sure my family and I are doing ok even after everything has been done and over with. I can not say enough thank you’s to Southern Heritage and I would highly recommend them. They are all a huge blessing and will not be forgotten by my family and I.

name: sandra Williams
text: This very difficult task was made easier by the professionals at Southern Heritage.  I was very pleased with the arrangements for my husband.

name: Regina Michelle
text: We are very thankful to Southern Heritage for being so helpful to us. They made sure that everything was perfect.

name: Nan Galbreath
text: Bob Murdaugh was the most supportive informative patient person to work with.  He has handled several funerals for us in the past year and I have the utmost respect for him and his work.

name: Lauren Flack
text: Cannot say enough good things about Southern and Doug Glasscock. He helped us through the worst time in our lives. I am forever grateful.

name: Mike Sullivan
text: My son Jonathan Sullivan died in a rock climbing accident out of state. We contacted Bob Murdaugh about arranging his funeral and he went the extra mile in helping us, we were so thankful for Southern Heritage and Bob to get through this tragedy.

name: LuAnne Ross
text: Bob Mardaugh was extremely helpful with the arrangements for my younger sister’s service. My family’s desires ad well-being were of utmost importance to Bob and the others at Southern Heritage Funeral Home. They definitely made this difficult situation a little easier.

name: Bill Fox
text: Received excellent service from Amy Strayer, Advance Planning representative this week.  Amy was professional and personable; made me feel comfortable, answered all my questions and offered suggestions. I felt comfortable in purchasing the amendments to my pre-pay for my wife and for me. I was especially impressed by Amy's organization of the materials, organized and orderly presentation, and all done in quick time without hassle.  I recommend Southern Heritage and Amy Strayer.

name: Linda Haley
text: Jonathan Wheatley and Marc Wolfe could not have been more helpful at  our meeting 6-26-2019. They are a asset to Southern Heritage.        Thank you Linda Haley

resp.text:
Linda, I am pleased to know that you received the informative and respectful service we strive toward. Thank you very much for your praise, and please know that we are proud to be here for you.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Laura Massey
text: Great Job! Thank you for your help and support with dads services.

name: Herman Williams
text: Every member of the staff we had interactions with were marvelous. They helped guide us through one of the most challenging times with dignity and compassion.

name: Lindsay Brand
text: The staff is wonderful! They take care of everything from start to finish.

name: alex eastman
text: Very professional and efficient in every aspect. Very much appreciated that in our time of need.

name: James Tarrant
text: They truly try their best to make sure you and your family are comfortable and well-taken care of.

name: byron white
text: This company has a very nice management and staff. Very careing people. I would use the angan if needed.

name: Tonia Contorno
text:
Our recent loss of my mother in law  brought us to Southern Heritage. We wanted her 90 years of life to be celebrated. We sat around a table and talked specifics of the funeral. Amongst ourselves we talked about her love of Hershey kisses and Krispy Kreme donuts.

The night of the visitation imagine our surprise that Krispy Kreme donuts were served, Hershey kisses were on the table, as were playing cards which were also her favorite. The day of the funeral they served soft mints, which I had forgotten how much she loved.

All of this to say they listened. They made it a special day and brought smiles to sad faces. Great job guys!

name: angie ulmer
text: Southern Heritage is a beautiful facility and has an amazing staff. Stephen Ulmer is very caring and treats you like family.

name: Jane Hutcheson
text:
I was at my parents grave site this week end to put Christmas flowers on their graves . I really became upset when I noticed that some type of vehicle had been driving over their graves and everyone's from one side of the cemetery to the other, like it was a road. I' m very upset with this and will be in touch with these people that operate this facility. They have no respect at all for my love ones or the other peoples love ones that chose the cemetery thinking it was ran very well ( at the time )   We have to go over there every spring and put top soil, fertilizer and basically that care of the grave site ourselves. It has been going down for several years now.

POOR MANAGEMENT

name: B Simmons
text:
During the very worst moments of our lives after our son died, Leonetta Prevo held our hands and helped us to make all the final arrangements.  She was kind and compassionate and helped us find a beautiful place to bury our son.  Leonetta has become a friend to our family and we are so thankful for her.  Many other staff members were so helpful throughout the process.  If you are needing these services, I can’t think of a better place to take care of your family.

The Simmons Family

name: Annette Mcleod
text:
It was the most horrible thing I have ever witnessed!
Things have changed ! Now it is like negotiating for a car. Bob walks in and then excuses himself to speak with manager, This happened at least 4 times.
"All of this could have been avoided, he says , with a prepaid plan. Already owning the crypt the still wanted 20,000.00 was still needed"
I felt he was pressuring us to buy prepaid plans now.
A cremation urn 495..  104 on Amazon !
Truly heartless and horrible day.

name: Phillip Hornsby
text: I want to start off and say that I couldn't have had a better experience then I did the day my mother passed and I met the people at Southern Heritage, I would give 100 starts if it would let me. From the first time on the phone with them until as recent as yesterday, the friends have been there for me 100%. I am sometimes not the easiest person to work with and my mom was my everything. I wanted something special for my moms service and Southern Heritage delivered. I first met with Bob Murdaugh and he was wonderful and so was Leonetta Prevo. They both listened and I don't think 1 time told me no. When I told them how much my mother loved Alabama Football and also her flower garden they ran with it. I met also with Carla Layne about the rooms we would be using. To my surprise on the morning of the visitation and service we had Alabama Football decorating the rooms and also my moms favorite flowers and even some seeds for us to take home of my mothers favorite flowers. You all went so far and above to make my mothers service so special and I can never thank you enough. You are all truly special. May God bless you all.

name: Jack Gray
text: Thanks so much for your help Jennifer!  You got me through a difficult time.

resp.text: I'm so glad that Jennifer was there for you during this challenging situation, Jack. Her contributions will be sent her way. If you need any support going forward, please bring it to our attention. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Jennifer Lollar
text: Wonderful people that helped us, especially Leonetta. Would recommend.

name: Trissy Cat
text: Amy Strayer helped me with the pre arrangements for my mother's prepaid funeral. She was kind, considerate and helpful. But what I also appreciated was that she presented me with all they had to offer and helped me make some decisions, but was not pushy trying to upsell me on services. Let's face it, funerals are expensive enough without people trying to upsell you like I have experienced with other companies.

name: Kendall Howard
text: I highly recommend Southern Heritage Funeral Home. Jaynee is wonderful!

resp.text: We appreciate your recommendation, Kendall, and for recognizing Jaynee. I will let her know about your kind words and please contact us if you need anything. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Elisa Ledbetter
text: Words do not begin to express my heartfelt gratitude, and that of all my sisters and brothers, over the sincere compassion and excellent professionalism of the our wonderful funeral director, Stephen Ulmer, and the blessing of Alisa Sims' genuine commitment and caring heart over the passing of our beloved mother! To walk into this beautiful funeral home once again after eight years since our beloved father passed, literally took all of our breaths away as my siblings and I were grieving and crying, but there stood waiting with open arms was so very kind and professional, Leonetta Prevo, who then kindly directed us to our own private room and introduced us to Stephen. Our parents many years ago had purchased the complete funeral package so as to help ease our worries and hearts when this time came, and Stephen already had neatly laying out on the table the complete folder of our sweet mother's wishes that she and our father years ago itemized all the way to which color flowers with dear Alisa's wonderful help! Every single thing was so patiently explained to us by Stephen and Leonetta. Great respect was shown to us by them as we explained certain things we wanted to do for our mother's preparation in applying her makeup and fixing her hair. We were treated with compassion and professionalism as our requests were honored and arrangements were made where promises we had made to our beautiful mother were fulfilled! Our wonderful team of excellent professionals were not only with us at our Church the day of our mother's funeral, but were also with us the evening before for the visitation making sure that everything was as we wanted for our dear mother! Stephen kindly moved beautiful flower arrangements exactly where we requested and remained to make sure we were at peace! Alisa unbelievably had more beautiful, baby pink roses delivered by a florist to Southern Heritage the very day of our mother's funeral and lovingly added them in the blanket of roses that was to be placed on our mother's casket! My siblings and I just cried at the absolute beauty and fragrance of our beloved mother's blanket of roses that Alisa personally saw to being so perfectly gorgeous! A million "thank you(s)" does not suffice for the gift of Stephen, Alisa and Leonetta to our family and to all the families blessed to have their amazing help, compassionate hearts, and continued support on this very emotional journey!  Their attention to every detail without pressure has prompted me to do just as my beloved parents and purchase the complete package with Leonetta and Alisa! On behalf of my family and myself, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your kindness, compassion, professionalism and genuine care and concern for   your customers... you truly treat us as family! Sincerely, Elisa C.

name: kathy plemons
text: Bob Murdaugh directed my family through the worst time of our lives in the most professional and caring manner possible.  As time passes by we realize how lost we were and how Blessed we were to have had such kindness shown to us during this time of need. Southern Heritage in Pelham Al is very fortunate to have such a dedicated person to provide a family with guidance at this most difficult time. Thanking you always. The Family of Tyler Kell Plemons

name: Ricky Little
text: Their General Manager is great to work with.  Douglas Glasscock

name: Brian Lawley
text: Great peaple to deal with.doug will take care of you in the terrible time of burying your love ones.thanks for all you do..

name: epic gamer
text: My mother dying was the most painful thing I have ever experienced in my life and Doug Glasscock was amazing. I couldn't have gotten through that day without him and the wonderful staff at Southern Heritage. To ease the process he took me on a tour of the grounds to ease my mind and and it was beautiful. The entire process was easy and painless. My parents had prearrangments in place which I recomend for everyone. Southern Heritage's manager Doug Glasscock was amazing. I hope I don't see him again anytime some but when the time come I feel completely secure in Southern Heritage taking care of all of the arrangements.

name: Lisa
text: Beautiful location!  Friendly staff!  Outstanding service!

name: Timothy Morrison
text: I met some of the employees of Southern Heritage at a Chamber Event. Great People that care for their community and families they service.

name: Jean-Paul Bootier
text: Very friendly staff. Comforting in a trying time for the family.

text: They took care of my wife's funeral a year ago and now again for my son in law Sammy Green they are 100 percent professional and caring thru the whole process

name: Mike Wood

name: Mike Nicholas

text: Great, caring staff. I highly recommended.

name: Amy Loftin
text: Lisa McBrayer was so kind and great to work with.

name: Bettyplease

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing that you would recommend our team. Helping those we serve honor their loved ones is a great responsibility and your thoughtful message means so much to us. Please don't hesitate to reach out if there is anything else we can do for you. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Tiffany Pettis
text: Whenever I needed a person to talk to, Doug Glasscock was there to help me through it. I work there many years ago and everyone there was always very professional.

name: Dennis Hodge
text: The staff and facility were top notch.

name: Mary Glasscock
text: Great staff!Caring family atmosphere.

name: Lane Hopewell
text: Attended a service Saturday for our long time neighbor. Great Job by the staff and such a lovely facility.

name: Brandy hyde
text: The staff was very helpful and friendly.

name: Dee Night
text: The staff is very friendly and inviting.

name: Lynn Alexander
text: The staff was excellent and very caring.

name: Whit Allen
text: Knowing what I know about this company, I am dead set on using them for my services!

name: J. Wilson
text:
I am so repulsed and disgusted by the way this funeral home has disrespected my daughter's gravesite.  My 44 year old daughter was buried at Southern Heritage in Pelham, Alabama on May 18, 2013.  I have had to constantly fight with these  people since that time.  I had to beg them to put sod on her grave; after several months they managed to cover the grave with sod.  After that a large hole appeared at the foot of her grave - it took them several weeks to fill in the hole.  I took my 14 year old granddaughter to the gravesite today (Mother's Day) to visit her mother's grave and we were horrified to see the shape it is in.  There was a pile of old discarded flowers in the back of the headstone, a huge ant bed covered the back of the headstone, weeds and dirt covered every inch of the grave and there are large ruts, which were apparently left by a vehicle of some kind, that circled the grave.  I have constantly called and complained about the condition of my daughter's gravesite and I have been given one excuse after another.  These people have a very flowery presentation and the graves that are close to the entry of the cemetery look good but they have no care or concern for the graves, such as my daughter's, that are out of view.  I would not recommend Southern Heritage to anyone.  I am very hurt by the lack of care and respect we have received from Southern Heritage.

October 10, 2018
The above posting generated positive changes.  I am not one to compliment basic expectations.  However, with the assistance of Doug Glasscock, General Manager, there have been consistent improvements.  The area of my daughter burial has been well maintained, groomed and cared for.  The area displays the respect and care which should be afforded a loved one. I appreciate Leonetta.  Her position at Southern Heritage is her "calling".  She is always patient, encouraging and comforting whatever the need.

name: Barbara Hudson
text: Wonderful place with a great staff.

name: Donna Cavanaugh
text: The staff couldn't have been more helpful & caring at such a difficult time.

name: Pat Little
text: Great guy, great family man!

name: Truong Nguyen
text: Friendly staff and well maintained

text: Amazing staff and very caring

name: Brooke Morrison
text: Amazing!

text: Wonderful staff!!!

text: Very informative, professional, friendly and knowledgeable. I would recommend this organization.

name: Angela Bagley
text:
(Translated by Google) Machelle is awesome, I love her.

(Original)
Machelle is awesome, I love her.

name: Brittany Parham
text: Unfortunetly I've been to many funerals here. Despite the circumstances this funeral home is exceptionally nice and clean. The outside is very well kept and maintained. The inside is roomy, clean, and nice. The staff that I have met were very friendly and helpful. The website contact email is never replied to. That is the only downfall. Would recommend to anyone looking for funeral services and headstones.

name: Lance Whestine
text: It's beautiful and great stuff and has a chapel in it and it has bathroom in the back side

name: Britton Thomas
text: These people are a bunch of bums. They lost my friend's mother's ring the day of her viewing and were extremely unapologetic about it and not interested in making up for it.

name: Tony Ponto
text: Beautiful funeral home , great staff !!!

name: Bennett Atkins
text: Great experience at Pinecrest considering the circumstance of my father passing. Kelly texted and emailed even on her time off to ensure the eulogy, obituary pamphlets, songs etc. we’re just as I wanted them to be! Very happy with the way it all turned out. The day of the service they helped us hang a picture blanket for display right before the visitation started and folded it and placed in casket to be buried with my father following that. Extra time was taken to help personalize my fathers headstone the next day as well. Everything was very clean and beautiful.

resp.text: Bennett, nothing means more to us than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate and dedicated service. Being here for those we serve is something we take great pride in and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Kelly.  Thank you for trusting us to arrange the picture blanket and personalized headstone for your beloved father.  If there is anything more that you and your family need, please do not hesitate to reach out.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Robbie Brewer
text:
We have dealt with Pine Crest with the death of both my grandparents, and things went smoothly. However, when it came to my mother, it took almost 3 weeks to get a cremation done. To their defense, it did take about a week to receive a permit to do it, but this was after an entire week was wasted due to poor communication from April. Ken came in and got things moving and things went well until the end. The permit was finally done on a Thursday and we were told things could move along and we were left with the impression things would be done by the end of the weekend. Friday we got 0 updates, so I called to see what was going on and Ken was gone for the day at this point. After multiple calls on Saturday, I find out the cremation had not be done and would not be done until Monday.

I am not pleased with the miscommunications and unprofessional tone I received. I felt we were not at all guided through this difficult process and mostly left to figure it out.

Edit: Since Ken wants to use a response he just copied off a template, I very much didn't appreciate that he told me If I wasn't pleased with their service he'd be happy to give us a refund and we can go elsewhere. Because that is how you want someone to speak to you about the remains of your mother. Class act.

name: Lacy Taylor
text: My experience with Pine Crest Funeral Home was okay at best.  There seems to be a serious lack of communication between the employees.  I tentatively scheduled the services for my mother for a morning service and I was told that it would be no problem.  My husband told them the time we planned to have the services when he dropped off the deposit.  However when my father met with them 2 days later , he was told that the time we planned would not be possible and that a time had never been discussed.  They did finally give us the scheduled time we needed.  Also when my husband made the deposit for the services he paid them with  a large sum of cash, which they gladly accepted.  Two days later my father wanted to pay the remainder of the bill using some cash and he was told that they do not accept cash.  I do not know what the difference two days makes in using cash.  Never mind the fact that cash is legal American tender and I am fairly certain they are bound to accept legal American tender.  Needless to say they made an extremely difficult situation even more upsetting.  This company way want to learn to operate in a more ethical manner.  I do have to say though that the funeral director we had for the services was superb.

resp.text: Lacy, thank you for making us aware of your experience, as we care deeply about ensuring your expectations are exceeded.  I hope you will consider allowing me to discuss this with you, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com so that I may reach out. I appreciate your time, and I look forward to addressing these issues. –Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Judy Tillman
text: I was so impressed with Suzanne Summerlin that wrote my policy along with her manager they where  both fantastic. The best thing was the no pressure to over purchase. And the extra blessing was the beautiful building that they just remodeled with fireplace in the large viewing room and sitting arrangements in the smaller viewing room. I could not be more pleased and my family is so happy if they want  have no worry when their mom and dad goes to be with the Lord.

resp.text: Judy, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Suzanne. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Markie
text: I visited two men that I look up too, Dr.Eugene “Sledgehammer” Sledge” & Sidney Phillips. It was a peaceful resting place for the both of them and their grave stone’s were amazing. May they Rest In Peace.

name: Mereau Tacon
text: Pinecrest personnel did their very best to fulfill all our wishes for the funeral and they exceeded our expectations!!

resp.text: Mereau, it was our treasured responsibility to honor your wishes. Thank you for giving us the chance to exceed your expectations, please know that your family is in our thoughts and that you are welcome to reach out for anything.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Sean McLaughlin
text: We were very disappointed in the state of the cemetery.  It was awful.  If my mother had not already owned the plot we would not have used the facility.

resp.text: Sean, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Maintaining the grounds and keeping everything beautiful for our visitors is of paramount importance to us so we will be sure to address this issue as soon as possible.  If you have any other concerns, please contact me at Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com.  Thank you for your time and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Ash M
text: I was not pleased at all with this facility. The staff member assigned to me was startling incompetent to the point where I lost an entire day of planning and had to make rushed decisions. Insisted I come in for an in-person meeting and kept me there well over two hours. Had my family not already have something arranged here, I would have gone elsewhere. Just completely unprofessional.

resp.text: Ash, this is certainly not the impression we want to leave you with, and I am grateful that you took a moment to reach out.  Please allow me to connect with you and ensure your concerns are addressed, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com  at your earliest convenience. I appreciate your communication, and I look forward to speaking with you. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Penny Nichols
text: My husband passed away this past week and the staff was exceptional with his arrangements. We had a non traditional celebration of life service.  They converted the chapel area with tables and chairs, we had a live band, singing and dancing and lots of love and laughter. They honored him and the family by their kindness, attention to detail, compassion and professionalism. I  couldn't have wished for a better group of people to work with. Thank you so much from the Nichols family.

name: Lesia Ferrell
text: The staff of Pine Crest Funeral Home is more than compassionate: they take care of their families. April Condiff was extraordinary with us, as well as Ken Bishop and CT Jones. The funeral home has a small town feel in a big city, which brings comfort. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Lesia, our team was truly honored to be able to care for your family. Your thoughtful recommendation means a great deal to us, and I encourage you to let me know if we may ever be of further assistance. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Nettie Disalvo
text: My husband's passing has been almost unbearable.  Kelly Owens and her team were a God send.  Our family and friends have all said how the service was so unique to Paul, especially the more personal table celebration set up, rather than pews or chairs.  They went over and beyond, even with creating momemtos for all of us to take home to remember this day. Paul would rejoice in this glorious send off. Thank you again Kelly!!

resp.text: Nettie, thank you for sharing such a heartfelt recognition. It was our mission to pay tribute to your husband in a way that reflected his spirit, and it gives us a great deal of comfort to hear you say that Paul would have loved it. You kind message means the world to us, and I will be sure that Kelly receives it. Thank you again. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Evalyn Lovell
text:
Sat March 21..
Where are the recent reviews, all are like 9 months or older??
You don't seen any comments from the manager in response to the dislikes posted!!!
I was in the DIP location on Tues Feb 11, 2020 to discuss all of my pre-paid/pre-arranging that has been made over several years now.
I'm still wanting on a response back from them to get a copy of my my pre-paid/pre-arranging papers. I have been told they are being mailed out that day on 3 different occasions, 1st time was when I was in there in person, that they would have then mail out the next few days. Then March 2nd & March 12th. Nope I have not received.
I do not live in Mobile to go there in person. Yes I agree with others, things there are not like they used to be under the directions of the Luce family. New management! 👎

Saturday March 28.
Still waiting to receive my papers!!!!

Finally as of Sat. April 11, 2020
After numerous times of texting back and forth.
I have got my papers in hand!!!
Why it took so long I will never understand

resp.text: Evalyn, I am disheartened to read of the troubles and lack of communication you describe. I hope you will consider allowing me to discuss this with you, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com so that I may reach out. I appreciate your time, and I look forward to addressing these issues. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: John Nichols
text: The staff was so kind and caring when our loved one passed. Sylvia and Penny went beyond our expectations. They made sure we had what we needed and was there till everything was over to offer support. They made this difficult time a little easier.

name: J Melton
text: My neighbor passed away somewhat unexpectedly and no prior arrangements had been made.  He was a Grandparent to my children and VERY special.  With heavy hearts his wife and I desperately called and had problems trying to plan his arrangements.  Kelly Owens SAVED THE DAY. She was absolutely wonderful, down to even sharing the same birthday as Paul! His service and arrangements were as unique as his spice for life! A complete, true celebration of his life it was. We couldn't be more thankful for everything Kelly did.  Marcy also helped and their touches to personalize the service were noticed by every single family member and friend attending. I will recommend any person or family dealing with a loss to contact them. Thank you so much Kelly and all who helped you, with our so very special Paul in heaven now 💕

resp.text: It was an honor for us to help you pay tribute to Paul's memory in a way that truly reflected his character and I appreciate your kind words. We care a great deal about meeting the needs of those we serve and I am uplifted to know that this was evident in your experience. Thank you so much for the time you have spent sharing your gracious feedback. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Victoria Dowdy
text: I just want to say thank you to Pine Crest they are very wonderful! John Tucker was able to assist my family through this tragic time. Thanks so much. We definitely recommend them because of him.

name: Sondra Douglass
text:
Our parents are buried at Pinecrest Ceremony. My sister and I drove from out-of-town to place flowers in the vases at each grave site. The vase on our mothers grave had been cut and mangled by the blade of a riding lawnmower when maintenance was cutting grass.
We made a report with Sylvia Ross and found her to be very understanding, thorough, and happy to resolve the matter. She offered to keep our flower arrangement and put them in the new vase when it arrives and place them on the grave since we don’t live in Mobile. Then Sylvia said she would send us a picture to show the flowers on the grave. Thank you Sylvia for outstanding service and personal attention!

name: Katie Everette
text: I just need to say that Pine Crest Funeral Home and staff are great. Especially John Tucker. He was so nice and very helpful during this emotional time for our family. Thank you so much.

name: Deanna Ladnier
text:
Kelly Owens done a great job helping me with rhe arrangements for my Dad. She jumped through hoops to make things happen in a short time period. Thanks and angie Sims was a great help as well she has done a great job for me on both my mom an dad
Thanks
Wendy Smith

resp.text:
Deanna, as we realize that every step of this process holds great importance, we consider it a privilege to go above and beyond for those we serve. Thank you very much for your recognition of Kelly's care, and please know that we are only a phone call away if you should need anything else.
-Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Robin McLain
text: For years there have been signs in the cemetery that there are renovations underway.  Well, it's been years since I asked about replacing sod, because a lot of the area is nothing but a mudhole.  I basically walk in mud when I visit my parents' graves.   It's a shame that this cemetery is allowed to decline.  I recall when it was locally owned by the Luce family in the 60s that the pond was kept up and there were ducks there.  Now the bridge over the little pond is over a dry neglected nothing!  I doubt there is any renovation going on.    There are pretty architectural features like the pond, bridge and little building - how hard is it to just keep up what's already there and re-seed or sod where people can walk without getting in dirt or mud?

name: Stephanie
text: Pine crest is such a great funeral home. John Tucker was especially so helpful and so great to our family. Thank you so much !

name: rymona hayes
text:
The staff at Pine Crest are very compassionate and provide excellent personalized service. Gi Gi and Kirk are especially courteous and professional.  My parents and a sister are laid to rest at Pine Crest and each experience exceeded my expectations.  So much so, that
I plan to entrust my final services to Pine Crest.  My sister's viewing and funeral service was held at Pine Crest and I was very pleased with the facilities.  The grounds are also very beautiful and enhance the community. I highly recommend Pine Crest Funeral Home and Cemetry in opposed to other funeral homes and cemeteries in the Mobile area.

name: Teresa Cartee
text: Theresa and Kirk have done a great job helping me. This a huge improvement from the last people that had the funeral home.

name: Teee Jenk
text: The staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Which makes our process smoother.

resp.text: Tamara, we're honored to know that our friendly and helpful care made this process smoother for you. Should you ever need anything else, we are only a phone call away. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Samantha Hoctor
text: Thank you so much Pine Crest. Especially to John Tucker. You made this horrible tragic a lot easier for our family.  Again, thank you for your kindness.

name: Jody Brown
text: The entire staff at Pine Crest exemplified the upmost dignity and respect during our family time in need. I would highly recommend Pine Crest as a final resting place.

name: Jennifer Brown
text: Pine Crest is exceptional funeral home. My mother was always pleased with Pine Crest because it was where she layed my dad Oliver B Brown to rest in Nov 95. The upkeep & professionalism of it's staff & providers are great to say the least. Having to lay to rest family & loved ones is never an easy task & it does require outside help Pine Crest reputation for making the task bearable & worry free is outstanding. Once again they accepted the task of laying to rest my mother in Feb 2018. We knew she would & is being well taken care of, I occasionally visit the gravesite where my mother & father rest in peace, I'm never disappointed by unkept, uncleaned & uncared for grounds!! I recommend Pine Crest to all, also proud to add my sister Theresa Young has recently joined their team, looking forward to a promising career! Who better could she work for than a place who's reputation, quality & professionalism proceeds it's self! Thank you for a job well done!!

name: Vaughn Brennan
text:
Have had a number of meetings and calls over a period of years. Always have had attentive positive service..
We are pleased that Pinecrest will be our final resting place.

name: Jeremy Hoppe
text: Thank you so much John Tucker for being so caring during our most difficult time. You are truly an amazing person.

name: Maloris Rhodes
text: Thanks Theresa and Kirk for helping my sister and I through this. May God Bless you.

name: Amy Walker
text: Gorgeous cemetery.  I love going here to see the beautiful funerary art and the peaceful surroundings.

name: Cindy Ross
text: I normally do not post anything negative and always try and see the positive in things. This is a different situation, my brother, Chance A Lane, and I have been patiently waiting for a bad situation with Pine Crest Cemeteries Funeral Home and Crematory to rectify itself now for 5 + months only for matters to never get solved. All funeral arrangements were paid in full a week prior to our father's burial and to this day, there still isn't a monument at his gravesite. There hasn't been any resolution here locally, just a bunch of empty promises and a lot of "I'm sorry's" from the very beginning. I would strongly advise if you plan to have your loved ones buried here, think twice before doing so. Would be happy to provide more details...

name: my opinion only
text:
AAA +++  Service.   I learned on Wednesday afternoon that I had to bury a person.  The family wanted the services done on Saturday.  I own plots in Pinecrest on DIP.  In a moments notice they coordinated services from Memorial Funeral Home and their cemetery.  Pinecrest staff took me to the location where the person was to be buried for my approval.  I was told that the vault would be delivered on Thursday.  On Saturday morning the Funeral started at 11 am at Memorial Funeral Chapel.  At 12:15 we were gathered at Pinecrest with everything in place under a tent.  At 12:35 everyone was ready to leave the cemetery.  Everything at both funeral homes had excellent service.
.

name: Tharessa Francois
text: Our family used their services at the beginning of the year and Kirk Family Services Manager took good care of everything during this time of grieving.

name: Jo Committee
text: Poor service. Had a pre-paid cremation pkg for father, so little care for someone already 'paid for'. No follow through to email papers to me as I was out of town. Once in town much delay for actual cremation getting done. Up charges added after paper work was initialed, and sent for remittance 6 months later!  Much advantage taken of those in grief and little help. Presentation of cremated remains was by a custodian

name: Daj Bee
text: The worst experience you could imagine.  Right from the beginning the staff seemed uncaring, unprofessional ,and inept at their job.  After setting up initial meeting we were given little information and left alone in the room for long period of time. When questions were asked, the answer was not known because it was someone else's job. however we would go over that later. Later did not come.I felt hurried and that the staff did not want to know anything about how I wanted to honor my family member. I felt I was taking up their time instead of receiving a "caring guidance to a final goodbye".   I had to physically visit Pinecrest daily to check on arrangements for my family member as phone calls were not returned.  NO communication was sent my way. I was not asked to preview anything, check on preparations, if I wanted flowers, if I wanted engraving. No one wanted to take responsibility.  The day of the funeral was further "salt in the wound" as communication among the staff was non-existent resulting in an embarrassing situation and dishonor and disrespect for my loved one. If I could rate Pinecrest less than -1, I would.  Years ago Pinecrest had a great reputation. Everyone could count on them , not now. We still have lots in Pinecrest, but lots or no lots, we won't subject our family to this treatment again. This is a hard time, no one needs to have added stress from someone who is supposed to guide you in a time of need and should show compassion.

name: Wayne Gautney
text: The staff was excellent, organized and accommodating to our family!

name: Sandy Catchot Rosson
text: My sisters grave is sinking n I asked them 5 times 2 fix her grave n nothing

name: Jason Haas
text: Lots of people talking

text: Tim was very patient and kind with me and my  family during a very difficult time. Their staff took really good care of my dad and helped whenever necessary. I would not hesitate to use White-Chapel/Leak in the future. We very much appreciate the service you provided. Truly grateful.

resp.text: Nathaniel, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate and loving service. text: There are not enough adjectives and accolades to express our sincere gratitude to the staff at White Chapel funeral home. resp.text: Chastity,  from start to finish, we strive to exceed expectations and provide support that is caring and professional. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Larry powell
text: Mr Davis dropped the ball. He just went through the motions. Could only hear 1 song of 3 chosen and got the wrong picture for the portrait. Never got 1 apology from him.  Was told the general Mgr would call and it never happened. Very little service after the big sale. Was told the funeral home would call after the death and that never happened. How could 1 person screw up so bad and still have a job? Was told he was the funeral director on top of all this. Please do not let this happen to you

resp.text: Larry, getting the special details of a loved one's service correct is very important to us, so I am sorry to read of your disappointment. Please send me an email at Paul.Booker@dignitymemorial.com, as I would like to speak with you further about these concerns regarding your experience. Thank you. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Corine Anderson
text: Mr. McGuire was very professional, knowledgable and patient with our family. Thank you.

resp.text: Corine, thank you for allowing Mr. McGuire to be of service to you.  Should you ever need additional support or assistance, please know that we are readily available.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

text: Overall our experience with White Clapel-Greenwood was good. Friendly staff, caring, and very helpful. Our flower arrangement was very late but thats no fault of the funeral home. Next time I would ask to proofread the online obituary due to some mispellings of family members and wrong date of death, but again, my fault for not asking to proofread it. Everyone was very respectful and made a very difficult time more bearable.

resp.text: Jane, it's absolutely fantastic to hear that you were pleased with our services, as we take pride in being compassionate and professional. Thank you for trusting us to help lead you through this process, and please let us know if you're ever in need of anything else. -Sergio Cavazos, General Manager

name: ralph clemens
text: Heather is one of the most professional and thoughtful persons I have met. She went out of her way to provide answers to concerns regarding very sensitive issues as well as being a warm friend. Were I still in business I would hire her away...well done, Heather!!

resp.text: Ralph, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Heather is such a blessing to hear, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be here for you.  -Sergio Cavazos, General Manager

text: White Chapel was such a peaceful place to lay my Mother to rest at. Michael Cox was outstanding. He was very considerate of my families needs and compassionate. The grounds are well kept, Chapel and family areas clean. But without question Michael Cox was by far the nicest director we have had to deal with. Very accommodating to the needs of myself and my Mothers last request.

resp.text: Ginger, I'm thankful to hear that Michael was extremely attentive and that he arranged everything perfectly for you and your family. I will bring this good news to his attention. Your kind comments mean so much to us and I hope that you will let us know whenever we can be of any further help to you. -Sergio Cavazos, General Manager

name: RODERICK SULLEN
text: i had never given much thought to burial plans or funeral arrangements because to me that was something you did when you were looking to die. That was until I met a representative from White Chapel-Greenwood named Carlos McGuire who explained to me that it wasn't about death but instead making sure those loved ones you leave behind are burdened with less and are able to properly grieve their loss. I remembered how lost and unprepared I was when I lost my mother and would have loved to have met Mr. McGuire well before her passing. In talking with him I realized I never want to leave my loved ones as unprepared as I was. His explanation of the pre-planning process was easily understood and not the solemn event I had in my mind. I even laughed a few times because he made it a natural conversation, that I plan on finishing sooner than later. Thank you for the valuable information, Carlos!

name: Bryan Strickland
text: Heather Covington assisted my wife and me in selecting our prepaid funeral plans.  We both wanted to save our survivors the agony and expense of planning and paying for our funerals.  If one of us predeceases the other, it saves the other from having to do this planning in a time of sadness and grief.  We also realized that it is much easier to make these decisions when we are still healthy rather than when hovering at death's door.  We also wanted to limit the drain on our finances from the cost of being laid to rest.  Heather initially provided a briefing for veterans on behalf of Dignity Memorial, focusing on benefits the VA provides at time of death.  She followed up with two individual sessions with my wife and me, one at Alabama Heritage Funeral Home and the other in our home.  In the hours she spent with us, we examined everything that Dignity Memorial offers and selected identical plans--cremation with interment of ashes at Alabama National Cemetery at Montevallo.  We are quite satisfied with our plans and give all the credit to Heather for her selfless assistance.  Thanks again, Heather!

resp.text: Thank you for describing what Heather was able to do for you and your wife, Bryan. She will be made aware of her helpful contributions. If there is anything you'd like to ask us, you are more than welcome to reach out. -Sergio Cavazos, General Manager

name: Mike and Suzanne Outten
text: Our mother, Nell Smith, went to be with the Lord a week ago today; she was living in North Carolina with us at the time of her passing; however, since Alabama was her home, raised in Montgomery, we wanted this to be her final resting place among her family members who had gone on before many years ago.  Planning a funeral for a loved one, no matter the age (93 years) is never an easy thing to do; it takes a lot of assistance, concern, care, encouragement and compassion to get through it and we cannot begin to express our gratitude and thankfulness for the staff at Greenwood who helped to get us through this painful time.  We want to thank Michael Cox, Sandra Ragsdale, and Greg Hollis for all the help and comfort they gave us before and during this time, and we want to extend a very special thank you to Greg Hollis for offering and his willingness to officiate her service.  We knew the type of service we wanted for her, and even though he did not know her personally, we could not have imagined how perfect it could have been.  It was so much more than we even imagined.  It was a true testament to our mother - her life, her love for her children and grandchildren, our love for her, but more so, her love for her Lord Jesus.  Working with Greenwood was such a blessing; we pray the Lord's blessings on each one of them as they continue to minister and assist families in these times of sorrow, and we would highly recommend them to anyone who will be facing this situation in the future.
