name: Bill Mccoy
text: White Chapel performed an amazing job for our family.They were both kind and professional. I would recommend them for your final needs.

name: Michael Cox
text: Everything was handled in a very professional and sensitive manner and by Michael and Ron. We were very pleased!  Thank you, from Edward and Donna Day.

name: Demi Kleitches
text:
angela kamburis kleitches — Planning a loved one's funeral service is certainly the hardest thing I have ever done... especially for my mom, my best friend. Michael, Sergio, Mack, Sandra and Jeremy all played a very important part in making the traditional Greek Orthodox funeral service beautiful for our Mother. Their warmth, compassion and desire to make everything to our satisfaction certainly helped ease the pain at this very sad and difficult time.
Having lived out of state for over 26 years, handling details can be a challenge. Many thanks to Sergio and Jeremy for going above and beyond to make our plans happen. There are many traditions involved with a Greek orthodox funeral and I am so thankful for aunts and relatives who assisted with those steps. My parents are both part of old, long-time Montgomery families that make up much of the local Greek community. I was comforted by Sandra in the office who was so sweet, understanding and knew my aunt.
Michael Cox was an excellent funeral director and remained calm and constant throughout the process. He was outstanding at the church and ensured our requests. He lead an informative meeting at the family table to finalize  funeral dollars and expectations. Mack in "PCP" was such an easy person to work with, as three of us made sure mom's make-up and dress was just as she would have expected!
At 10:30PM after Mom's funeral, I realized that while there were lots of people in attendance, there were many friends about her age that were missing. Having the obituary put on the website was made very clear and that it was at no cost. That's great, but in order to reach more of her target age group the good old newspaper is definitely the best approach!! So many friends reached out when I printed the obituary the day after her funeral. They simply did not know mom had passed away. This leads to my strong recommendation for white-chapel to assist with actually contacting the Montgomery Advertiser and  with submitting the obituary. Of course we are responsible for the cost. I would encourage at least a small informative notice to persons in this age category. I feel there was definite confusion on that situation... at least for ME. Apparently I misunderstood exactly how the newspaper obituary operated.  If I could only re-do that part!!!
Everything else was absolutely perfect, mom looked beautiful and the flowers were gorgeous (thank you Michele)!! She would approve.
With the exception of the disappointing newspaper glitch... I would highly recommend White Chapel-Greenwood Funeral Home services along with their dear and assuring staff.

Many thanks to all!
Sincerely,
Angela

name: Robert Rowlen
text: Awsome they set Antie dolls she collected and the love novels so everyone can get a idea bout her everything just beautiful couldn't not been better Antie would have loved it

name: Donald Davis
text: My sister's death was a tragedy and hit the family hard and fast.from the time of death and past the burial white chapel has been there to ease the pain. Mr Greg Hollis has been there and  nobody could have been more comforting thank you and all the staff at white chapel.

Kevin Veal

text: Worst most disrespectul funerL director ive ever met in my life. He was rushing the family through the service and at the gravesight interupted and cut the speaker's off whike saying tgeir memorium. And rushed us away to hurry up and Burry our loved one. Dont recommend this place yo anyone!

name: Mark Ornelas

Donna Bowman

name: Diane Harper
text: I like evergreen, my family always used them.I don't live there.always nice to all all my family, ,,!

name: Correy Norred

name: Jessica Kellett
text: My family has used Miller’s Funeral Home for years. They are amazing! Loving,caring, professional and they make the process of planning a funeral as easy as possible.

name: Debra Dean
text: This funeral home is beautiful, and all of the people we were in contact with when my Daddy, Bill Beck, died were so compassiont, caring, and understanding.  I would highly recommend this funeral home to everyone.

name: Sonyia P
text: The staff was caring and helped me with arrangements and paperwork.

name: papa wolfman (papawolfman)
text: The most caring and compassionate funeral home I have ever dealt with. All the staff at Miller Funeral Home and Miller Monument Co. go above and beyond to assist you. I highly recommend Miller Funeral Home and Miller Monument Co.

name: Crystal Davis
text: They help me in so many ways when i was going through the hardest time of my life

name: APRIL
text: My parents had prearranged funeral. It made everything easier during the passing of My Daddy. I highly recommend prearranged funeral and Miller's Funeral home.

name: Maddie G
text: My father-in-law had passed and his service was held here. They were very accommodating, especially with it being a service for a veteran. Despite it being a difficult time for the family, they allowed us to spend time with our loved one, without rushing us out the door.  And they continued to provide a service when we returned to request if they could transfer his ashes to a box urn. After our arrival, they took his ashes, transfered him to urn and we were done. Thank you so much!

name: Cathy Farr
text: We utilized Miller Funeral Home for my father's funeral last year and found them to be difficult and not very accommodating.  We didn't realize until we had another funeral to plan that the process doesn't have to be so painful.  They also charge about twice as much as other local funeral homes.  We would definitely not utilize Miller in the future.

name: Jenny R Smith
text: Thanks for your love and kindness from your family to ours over the years and for always being there for us! GOD BLESS!

name: Jonilynn Zimmerman
text: Due to the passing of my mom I choose Miller funeral home best choice I ever made ,,,the loving care given to my mom ,,,was truly amazing she passed with her dignity and Alabama creamation ,and funeral home ,kept her dignity I highly recommend using these services,,,

name: Nate Blumenschein
text: they were very helping in our time of need for the passing of our love one

name: Sarah Femrite
text: They made a very rough time stress free. Answered every question text and phone call I have never had to go through this process and they made everything very easy at such a hard time. Thank you!

name: Tanya Gilley
text: Great service!

name: Jane Pattersonmjpatter
text: Very good

name: Vicki Mangina
text: I have been very disappointed with the service I have received. My Mother was buried in September, 2019 my parents graves have sunk in, washed and the ground surrounding the headstone has eroded. I have been there personally to report this and have called almost daily with no return call. I expressed my concern with the condition of the cemetery and was told it sold in December and hopefully changes will be made. I went by the graves today and no improvement’s have been made and in some areas the grass is almost knee high. This is not acceptable and I do hope this is taken care of before further action needs to be taken.EDIT:I have talked to the manager of the funeral home. He explained to me due to COVID and lack of workforce things have fallen behind. The headstone has been leveled and sand, new dirt, grass seed and new hay has been been put down on the grave sites. He was very nice and helpful even gave me his personal cell phone number if additional problems arise. He again assured me they are working hard to bring the cemetery back to the standards of the past. Very appreciative of his prompt actions and response. Thank you Eric.

name: Susan Jones
text:
Everyone there is very sweet and professional.
Recently we had our third family funeral at Jefferson Memorial. The people are very nice. The grounds are beautifully kept and our experiences at Jefferson Memorial have been remarkable. I would highly recommend them to friends and family.

name: Frances Abrams
text: Today my husband I went to the cemetery to place Mother's Day flowers on my mother's marker. After finding that the vase was missing, we also discovered that there was no vase on my father's marker either. After we called the office, they sent Eric to help us. He contacted maintenance and soon Cory and A. D. showed up. Not only did they bring vases, but shovels, dirt and other tools. They uncovered the markers entirely, then filled in with dirt to raise the markers higher, revealing the granite base to each marker that had been completely covered. These two men worked about 30 minutes and were so nice! Kudos to Cory and A.D.! The markers look great now!

name: Melanie George
text: My family has always used Jefferson Memorial for funeral services, and now I know why. I was very intimidated by the whole process when my mom passed, but they kept it simple and thoroughly explained everything, so that my brother and I could make decisions without feeling pressured or "sold". We were able to honor my mother's wishes. Thank you to Bob and Richard and the rest of the staff for making our lives a little easier during this difficult time.

name: Deborah tolbert
text: I have left numerous messages to move forward with ordering a marker, having a burial. I've yet to receive a return phone call to get this going.  The burial was paid in full several weeks ago.  Extremely unprofessional.  Update - The manager contacted me and is trying to make everything right.  We have had the burial.  Currently waiting on them to contact me when the marker comes in and is placed.   I will then go to see the marker, see if they placed the sod over the grave as promised and if they fixed the other markers that are covered with grass, dirt and overgrowth  and sunken.

name: Pat Hamilton McMurrey
text:
I have never been to a more poorly planned and executed funeral!!! There was NO direction provided by the funeral home staff. No one knew where to go or what to do. It was complete chaos. The family were scattered all over the chapel, not seated together as they should have been. The sound system was a complete joke as was the projection screen! You could barely see the pictures and they were very blurry.  There were/are NO PICTURES on the online obituary page after the family went to a tremendous effort to collect, scan and upload to the funeral home's planning webpage!  Those should have automatically transferred. Several attempts to upload pictures directly through the online site through the Share Memories section resulted in a locked up phone!!! The facilities are dated and drab, very depressing; in need of some serious renovations and updating. They had a last viewing for the family but before my husband could even get to the front they had already closed the coffin so he did not get a final chance to say goodbye to his Dad!!!!!! The whole thing felt rushed, as if they needed us to be gone so they could close the doors and go home. They did not even completely close the curtain. It was a disaster from start to finish. A very PRICEY disaster!! In summary; cheap quality, tacky and shoddy. I'm sure they are very busy, but then busy means more income, some of which needs to be applied to adding professional, trained staff and upgrading the facilities.  I do NOT recommend this funeral home!

Mr. Roper, there is no need for us to speak unless you plan to offer some kind of refund. I have clearly listed our complaints. If you work on those issues perhaps you can improve the services you offer.

resp.text: Ms. McMurrey, we take your concerns seriously. We want to extend our sincerest apologies for the experience you had with us. Our staff strives to meet the needs of each and every family we serve. We would like to discuss further details pertaining to your experience. Please contact Matt Roper at 205-322-0543.

name: Melanie Brake
text: Today while visiting the cemetery, we were greatly appreciative of AD, one of the cemetery maintenance staff! He was kind, courteous and extremely helpful! He gladly assisted us with our cemetery vases. He did a great job helping us and stopped what his was doing to assist my 86 year old Dad and myself as we were carrying several floral arrangements. Thank you again to AD

name: Tanya Tidwell
text: This review is in relation to the Funeral Home Staff and specifically our funeral director, Ms. Sandra May.  When families are at their most vulnerable, it is at these time that a gentle, kind, and caring person becomes so important.  When my father passed away, Ms. May and the rest of the staff treated our family with respect and they worked very hard to help guide us through the most difficult time of my mother's life.  They did not try to push us to purchase things nor try to play on our grief, but instead they listened to what mattered the most to us and then helped us to achieve those goals.  Even though the funeral home was extremely busy and Ms. May probably had about 100 other things on her "to-do" list, she never rushed us or made us feel like we were bothering her.  The services provided by the funeral home and by the staff were above and beyond and I would highly recommend Jefferson Memorial Funeral Home and Gardens as your choice for funeral services.

name: Jerry Franklin
text:
My family’s experience with this funeral home has been mixed.  The services are top notch but the cemetery grounds are not.  My grandparents, my father, and now my mother have been buried there.
My father in 1981, my grand father a year or so later and my grandmother a few years after that.
We had a time trying to get grass planted and then the vases broke and when grass was finally put there my mother and my wife had to purchase and plant it.
Well after all that time my mother was buried there in January and here we go again.  The marker has not been updated, the grave is still a chirt pit and it has been five months.
My sister and I have called to complain and they told us a work order has been filed.
Well we will see how long it takes.

name: Craig Winn
text: This review is strictly for the cemetery and grounds. It is a large relatively peaceful location even though it is next to the hustle and bustle of Hwy 11. It is generally clean but It could be maintained so much better. The roads need paving but at least the potholes filled in. Constantly asking for the grass to be cut and put out a little fire ant killer. The ant beds always seem to take over my mother-in-laws grave. I own a couple gravesites here. Anyone want a good deal on one?

resp.text: Hi Craig, thank you for the review.  We are always working to improve the conditions of the cemetery and are currently down a few employees on the cemetery maintenance team.  We are actively trying to hire for the spring so that we can get caught back up on as much maintenance and upkeep as we can.  Thank you!

name: Teresa Waine
text:
This review is only about the cemetery. My father as well as my father in law are buried there. I have put in work orders several times about my FIL’s grave. They do a half way fix spending as small amount as possible to appease me. The graves are washing and rutted with no grass, only weeds and headstones break because the cheap clay they haul in washes from under them.
The roads to where my dad is, in the mausoleum, are covered with red clay and rutted with holes. Way too much money was spent to buy those spaces that are supposed to be kept up and are not being. I feel this will be the next cemetery in horrible repair that makes the news. Do not buy a plot here without looking hard at the shape the cemetery is in.

name: Wanda Bordone
text: Our family greatly appreciated the kindness that Ms. Cheri Roberts and the staff at Jefferson Memorial Gardens East showed to us. She immediately responded to our out-of-state assistance which we needed and went above and beyond in helping us. What peace of mind we have because of the respect and courtesy she extended to us, as well as to our loved ones resting there. Thank you so much.

resp.text:
Wanda,
Thank you so much for the kind words and taking the time to leave this comment. We’ll let Cheri and team know, it’ll make their Saturday!  If you ever need help in the future or if there’s anything else we can do to help please be sure to reach out! Thank you and have a wonderful weekend!

name: P A Pennington
text: Having dealt with more funeral homes than I care remember the past 5 years, I must say this one was the best experience by far. Victoria was very helpful, went above and beyond to accommodate the family. I didn’t feel the compassion was fake or forced. The cemetery is lovely. Prices are not competitive but funerals are not cheap anymore.

resp.text: Thank you Happy Trails!  We'll let Victoria know!  We appreciate your comments and review!  We work hard everyday to provide great service and go above and beyond to make things easier on the families we serve.  We're happy to hear we did a nice job for you.  Thank you for placing your trust in us.

name: Celi MC
text: I called to get some information about a marker but I was left on hold for more than 15 minutes. I hung up because I couldn't wait anymore.

name: Linda Jones
text: We had my mom's funeral and burial at Jefferson.  It was unexpected and she and we (my sister and I) were not prepared for it.   We picked Jefferson because we live in the area, drive past and wanted mom to be close so we could visit. After calling some of the other funeral homes, we felt like the folks at jefferson treat you like family and the price was affordable and easier than going to one place for a funeral and another for the cemetery. They turned a difficult time into a nice event honoring our mom.  Thank so much for helping our family at a difficult time.  We appreciate it more than you all know.

resp.text: Thank you Linda!  We appreciate the kind words, it was our pleasure to help your family.

name: Roger Hill
text: Attended a service here last week for a church friend. I was very displeased with the way things went. When we arrived early that morning the flowers were not in the chapel, not even the flowers for the casket these were finally brought in while family and friends were already gathering. When going out to the cemetery the casket was left out from under the canopy and there was mud all over the canopy inside and out and all over the carpet. I understand it has been raining a lot however, to me you would have a way to clean this for each service. For the price that services cost I would think you could do a better job. I would also say that in your profession I don't think tattoos showing is a good thing on your employees.

resp.text: Roger, We are sorry to hear that the funeral service did not meet your expectations and we would like to learn more about the service you attended and how we could do a better job going forward.  Would you please let us know your contact information by calling the funeral home at 205-655-2536 and ask for Adam Seal or leave a message with Kennetha Massey who will have Adam reach out to you directly.  We take all of your points very seriously and would like to use the feedback to improve.  We look forward to discussing this matter with you and we thank you for your comment.

name: Lindsey Seal
text: Beautiful, updated facility in Trussville. Warm and welcoming atmosphere and staff. Professional and courteous.

resp.text: Thank you Lindsey!

name: Stephanie Evans
text: Currently my family and I are devastated by the lack of dignity and respect my grandparents graves have been given. It has been almost a month since my grandfather passed away and the flowers from his funeral are STILL on the grave. The grave is such that one dig and you could EASILY touch the vault, and the head stone is still several feet from the graves upside down. I cannot explain how upset we are by this lack of respect. When my grandmother passed away in 2014 the funeral home did an amazing job. They were on top of everything, and very respectful. With my grandfathers funeral (June 2017)  we were not pleased at all. (* I will not post pictures of the grave out of respect for my family*)

resp.text:
Stephanie,

Thank you for acknowledging your satisfaction with our funeral home back in 2014 for your grandmother's service.  We are very sorry to hear that we have not fulfilled the same expectation for your grandfather.  We do not want to make excuses but with the consistency of the rain that we have had in the area recently we are extremely behind on backfilling and the marker will not go back down until the grave is prepped.  We would like to state that we treat every grave now as we did back in 2014 but want to look into your grandfather's for you.  If you could kindly call us directly at 205-322-0543 so we can get your grandfather's name that would be greatly appreciated.  Again, our sincere apologies, we hope that we can resolve this for you in a timely manner.

Sincerely,
Jefferson Memorial Funeral Home & Gardens

name: Gina Huie
text: It's very peaceful, and nice. The staff are warm and friendly, especially Shirley Carr. My daughter is laid to rest there.

resp.text: Thank you Gina, We appreciate the kind words!

name: Dagney Doodle
text: Sandra was absolutely wonderful. I wish I could say that for the rest of the staff. Rude, unprofessional, lazy and the list goes on.

resp.text:
Hello Dagney,
Sandra is appreciative of the compliment, Thank you!

We'd like to speak with you regarding your experience as it's difficult to understand the issue without additional insight into your situation.  If you could provide us with your real name, who you visited with, and what the issue was, we will be sure to use the information to improve our services.  We appreciate you reaching out to us and hope that you will contact us either via phone 205-655-2536 or email information@jmgardens.com so that we can try to better help you.  Thank you and have a great day!

name: Delbert Madison
text: Extremely satisfied with the professional services offered on behalf of my son.

name: Linda Rosschild
text:
Peace Mortuary handled the arrangements for our Sweet Girl, Alcyone "Cici" Gunn, aka, #_thesixfigurechick_.  We could not have asked for anything,  considering what we were dealing with, to have been any better. They were kind, patient, courteous and very understanding to all of our needs. And everything they helped us with was just beautiful and orderly. We were more than pleased with their services and would highly recommend them. Thank you Braynard Collins and Marius Chasen (I remember their names) and Peace Mortuary staff for a job well done.
⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐Linda Rosschild (Mother of Cici)

name: Santonio Goins
text: Wonderful,professional, and compassionate people. They made me and my family extremely happy with how everything was handled.

name: Amber Scott
text: Mr. Chasen and Mr. Collins were extremely professional, and offered a broad variety of services for our families burial needs. We were so impressed with their dedication to the needs of our loved one, that my husband and I used them for our pre-need so that we would not be a burden to our children. These men have more than 20 years combined experience in this business. I trust them with my life and afterlife.

name: Bootsie Lewis
text: My husband's father was buried there recently, his mother is buried there also. It is a really pretty place! They could not have been any nicer to the family!!

name: de winner
text: Great staff, they were friendly and caring. The funeral home was clean and nice. I would definitely recommend  Colbert Memorial.

name: Sam Turner
text: Plot paid for 30 years ago.  Mom passed away two weeks ago and man said that we should get the Death Certificate within 10-14 days.  Call to follow after 14 days and get told we opted out!  WOW.... For $7,630 dont see how...  Special place in Hell for these folks.....

name: Sweet Home Alamanda
text: It's never nice to have to visit a funeral home, however the staff here were friendly and accommodating. The atmosphere was very nice and I like the way that they kept the crowd moving through the line so as to not hold it up for others behind. However, when it was getting close to the start of the funeral, the way they "shooed" us from talking to the family members of the deceased was a bit abrupt and rude. Overall, a good funeral home with friendly staff.

name: Sherry Owen
text: Wouldn't send death certificate

name: Lawrence Marvin
text: I appreciated them taking their time explaining all the options to my wife and I, and making adjustments to their package deal to fit our circumstances.  I am confident that when the time comes they will take the burden off of us at a very stressful time.  We are glad that everything is arranged for in advance.  Since we plan to live a long time, we will be saving a ton of money by locking in today's funeral costs.  They have a good payment plan with zero interest over 3 years making the costs affordable.

resp.text: Your feedback is deeply appreciated, Lawrence. As we realize that this decision holds great importance, we are honored that you chose us. Please do not hesitate to reach out any time you have a question or request. -Mitchell Bartee, General Manager

name: Sonya Bowman
text: Andy, Brandon, Paul and the entire staff went above and beyond for our family when Dad passed. They were so compassionate, patient and understanding. They never rushed us in any way from the planning all the way through the service and beyond. This was some of the most difficult days of my life, but it was made much more bearable because of these wonderful people.

resp.text: Sonya,  we are beyond grateful that you allowed us to assist you during this time and I deeply appreciate your lovely words. I will be sure to bring your thoughtful message to the rest of our staff  and should you need anything else I hope you will feel free to reach out to us.  -Mitchell Bartee, General Manager

name: Ann Wilson
text: They are wonderful. There is nothing but good vibes and they treated us well. People have been calling with great comments. And this was our 2nd round - I am planning to prearrange mine soon.

name: Eleshia Robinson
text: Making final arrangements for your loved one is difficult.  Kilgroe Funeral Home provided a very hospitable environment for me to plan my father's funeral.  Canaan Elkins was our funeral director.  It was raining the day I went to plan the funeral service.  He helped me get daddy's suit and other things out of my car with an umbrella, offered me refreshments, and made me feel at home.  He interpreted the details from my father's burial insurance policy, explained the details to me, and informed me of all options that we could include in the service and burial.  My father was retired military.  I had no idea that he was eligible for a full military burial including flag folding and presentation, playing of taps, and a 21-gun salute.  Canaan and his supporting staff coordinated everything for the military service.  In addition, his staff ordered a military foot stone.  The day of the service, Canaan organized the pall bearers and instructed them.  And when invited to stay after the service with our family to have lunch at the church, he graciously accepted the invitation.  During the lunch, he was warm and friendly with family and listed to stories they told about my father.  The experience was much less stressful because of the kindness of the people that work there and the fact that they are so organized.

name: Sherry Simmons
text: I was very disappointed with it my mom prepaid for her funeral and then when it came time we couldn't get the music played that we asked they wouldn't even turn it up where nobody can hear it at the gravesite they literally asked people to get up out of the chairs because they had another funeral to go to and let people stand in there I was very disappointed with it and the obituary pamphlet that everyone received they left people's names out of it that she had pre-made and have the names already wrote up they left names out I was just very disappointed that she paid that kind of money and it turned out as it did but it is what it is

resp.text: Sherry, we care deeply about ensuring your expectations during what I know is an incredibly difficult time and I would be grateful for a chance to connect with you and discuss this further. If you would, please send your preferred method of contact and availability to Mitchell.Bartee@dignitymemorial.com, so that I may get in touch with you at your convenience. Thank you for reaching out. –Mitchell Bartee, General Manager

text: This place I went down for a tour and it’s very quite around there , but it’s sad at the same time what a history she leaves behind her , hope someone buys it and restores the Mausoleum and brings back good service to families who need it . People say it’s a horrible place ,no the owner died and no one took over and probably no one even thought of bodies being there , I mean it is a mausoleum and that’s what it’s for but everyone takes it out of context ,when people die maybe we should condemn them cause they left stuff behind point is you can’t do nothing once you’re dead

name: Carmen Brown
text:
I want to thank Kilgroe Funeral Home in Leeds, AL for the beautiful Memorial for my sister, Karen, who passed away recently. She resided in Georgia & I was not sure where to handle her final affairs. My family and I have been to many services over the years @ Kilgroe Funeral Home in Leeds, Alabama and I knew this was where her service should be. This is such a difficult time, but getting the information you need, makes all the difference in making such final decisions for the one you love. I called multiple times with many questions and Dennis Russell & his staff always gave me prompt, professional guidance and advice. I was provided tables, easels, and everything I needed, to assist in setting up her personal photos & other memorabilia. The music was so pretty & the music directors helped me set the volume for CD's and also played the organ & piano. All of our family & friends were greeted with such kindness. My sister's "Tribute Movie" was absolutely breath-taking to everyone. It consisted of around 100 photos that I had selected of Karen's life and it really showed her happy times and how much she was loved. This meant so much!.
Thank you again, Dennis Russell and staff.
I can lay my head down at night knowing that her final good-bye was so heart-felt.

Blessings,
Carmen, Liesel and family.

resp.text: Carmen, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and professional care that is absolutely essential throughout this process and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight our service for your beloved sister in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need.  -Dennis Russell, General Manager

text: I can't express enough of how wonderful Scott and the staff held my hand and walked me through this difficult experience. They are absolutely great!

resp.text: Stephanie, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Your praise of Scott and our team is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this time.  -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: Laura Beth Mills
text: I cannot say enough good things about Kilgroe Funeral Home in Leeds. I recently attended a funeral for my friend's dad. While there I noticed many positive things. The staff was very welcoming and professional. You can tell they truly care about what they do. I noticed the funeral home was very clean and well taken care of. The flowers were arranged beautifully and the service was well organized.

name: misty tipton
text: Great people to work with. The staff are so understanding, friendly and helpful. They do everything they can to make a not pleasant time go as smoothly as possible for families.

resp.text: Misty, thank you for expressing your thoughts, as we take comfort in providing the helpful and compassionate care that is absolutely essential in one's time of need. Please know that we are here for you if you need anything else at all.  -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: Justin Burns
text: The folks at the funeral are very hospitable and show great care for the family’s during their time of pain. They are very helpful in making plans and setting the arrangements. Dennis Russell the manager is a wonderful person and cares about each person independently. We are very appreciative of our experience and would highly recommend them to anyone in need of burial services.

resp.text: Being here for you in your most sensitive time of need is a responsibility we take very seriously, Justin, and I truly appreciate your recognition. It was an honor to serve you and if there is anything else that we may do for you, please know that we will gladly assist. -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: Kimberly Bivins
text:
I was not satisfied with the service we received from Kilgroe - Leeds.  After my father passed away on April 25th, we asked for him to be taken to Kilgroe- Leeds because this is the funeral home that our family has always used, and it is the closest to my mother’s home, although in a different county.
While we were waiting on him to be removed from the residence, by a third party, Kilgroe was calling my mother asking her to come in and make arrangements. When we did go in to make arrangements on the 27th, they told us the cremains should be ready for pick up on Monday, April 30th. Then, my mother had to go back another day because the one of the papers was not updated and had to re-sign and was told that the cremains should be ready Friday, the 27th. After calling on Saturday, I was told they could be picked up Sunday, only for them to call back and tell her it would be Monday.. A different date should have never been mentioned.
When we did pick up the cremains, I asked about the death certificates that we purchased through the funeral home. They were not ready and no one knew when they would be, although paperwork from our county coroner said 7-10 days. Upon calling the coroner on May 11th, I discovered that the funeral home had never sent the death certificate to have a signature. On May 12th, I called the funeral home to question when they would be ready and was told they were waiting on the coroner. I informed them I had spoken to her and that she had confirmed she was waiting on them and only then was I told there had been a “glitch” and they had never been sent over. We received them on May 14th.

resp.text: Kimberly, I am disheartened to read of the troubles you describe. I hope you will consider allowing me to discuss this with you, please contact me at Dennis.Russell2@dignitymemorial.com so we can sit down and discuss this together.  I appreciate your time, and I look forward to addressing these issues. -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: Brittany Gibson
text: My step-grandmother recently passed away and we had her service at Kilgroe Funeral Home in Leeds.  The staff was excellent and answered all of our questions.  Dennis and Drew were very accommodating.  They were able to schedule the funeral on the day that our family needed, which was only a day later.

name: D Brown
text: They went above and beyond in helping us lay my dear Grandmother to rest. They even made special arrangements for those of us from out of town to be able to see her one last time to say goodbye.

resp.text: Thank you for allowing us to meet your family's needs during this difficult time. It was our treasured responsibility to help you pay tribute to your Grandmother, and I am grateful for your heartfelt description of your experience. -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: Cindy Burgess-Russotti
text: The staff a Kilgroe funeral Home, especially Dennis Russell were wonderful.  We are from out of town and we didn’t have very much time to make arrangements  for our brother.  His death was very unexpected and the staff and  Dennis  were very accommodating.  They were a great help at a very difficult time.

name: cvyblazer
text: Great staff.  They are caring and professional.

resp.text: Thank you for sharing such a thoughtful review. We consider it a privilege to offer the professional and detailed care you describe, and we would be honored to attend to anything else that you may need.  -Dennis Russell, General Manager

name: T Whitfield
text: Thanks to Leeds Kilgore for making the arrangements for my Mom’s funeral an easy process. Such a professional and caring staff.  Thank you guys for all you did for our family.

name: Bonnie Moon
text: My brother recently passed away unexpectedly. The staff at Kilgroe funeral home was very professional and accommodating. Dennis was great and helped us get through making the arrangements at this very difficult time.

name: Taylor Self
text: Dennis is very nice and is very experienced in comforting families when they lose loved ones. Drake is very professional and handles manners in a thorough, timely way.

name: Susan Williams
text: Dennis, Scott and the entire staff were most helpful during a very hard time for me and my family. We will use them again, but hopefully no time soon.

name: Taylor Self
text: Drake (the office manager) is very professional.

name: Danny Miles Isbell jr
text: Friendly staff

name: Shawn Hamby
text: Professional..

name: SHARON PHILLIPS
text: I know I HAVE SAID THIS BEFORE BUT THANK YALL FOR BEING SO NICE AND CARING DURING THE PASSING OF DAVID AND AFTERWARDS. THEY PUT HIS FOOT MARKER UP THURSDAY EVENING AND I LOVE IT. THANK YALL FOR THE WONDERFUL JOB. I ALSO STOPPED BY THE OTHER DAY AND THANKED THE GUYS ON THE GROUNDS AND TOLD THEM OF THE WONDERFUL JOB THEY DO EVERYDAY, I KNOW THIS IS HARD WORK BUT IT ALWAYS LOOKS SO NICE AND I'M OUT THERE AT LEASE TWICE A WEEK AND THEY REALLY KEEP IT UP

name: Jamie Marie
text: Outdoors and nature..great family park for time well spent.

name: John Brown
text: Tuscaloosa Memorial Chapel and Park are located in the edge of Tuscaloosa city limits. The staff of the funeral home and cemetery are friendly and professional serving the families of Tuscaloosa with all there cemetery and funeral needs since 1929.

name: John Rogers Jr
text: A very nice facility,  with plenty of room.

name: Lita Shive
text: The gentlemen and lady at this facility were very kind.

name: Tammy Sanford
text: Outstanding service

name: Ashley Hallman
text: Pretty.

name: Ari Miller
text: They perform their bait and switch pricing, at the most vulnerable times in their clients' lives, quite nicely. Still doesn't account for their huge discrepancy in pricing. To all those considering their services: make sure to ask about the mandatory add-ons to their advertised pricing, which include, but are not limited to, "cremation pouches" (for the "dignity of this who have passed"). Also notable, they outsource cremation services to Patterson. My advice...skip the middleman. Go straight to Patterson. Northport's pricing is fraudulent.

name: Chris Smith
text: Our son died unexpectedly in Columbus, MS on June 20th, 2020. We drove up from the border in South Texas to take care of his death. We called around multiple Funeral Homes in both Columbus, MS and parts of West Alabama near his home while we drove up. We were given the fairest cost for services with the most giving and sincere concern for our son as well as our needs in this time of grief. In a situation where we had limited time to make decisions we never felt rushed nor pressured to make any of the decisions that we needed to make. Everyone that we met here were so caring and helpful. I would rate them a 10 if that was possible. Thank you for all you did for our son and us. ❤️

name: James Gulledge
text: Northport Funeral and Cremation was referred to our family by hospice. My mother was terminally ill and wanted to be cremated. Northport Funeral and Cremation handled everything in the most caring and professional way I could have asked for.  You should not hesitate to call them if you or a loved one needs their services.

name: Jay McPhillips
text: The entire staff is incredibly caring and also displays professionalism with every interaction.  You'll have a great first impression as soon as you walk in the door.

name: Dr. Samuel Riase, Jr
text: Very professional and polite.

name: Brenda Jenkins
text: There is an ant hill between the grave markers of my parents.  It’s been there so long that dandelions are deep rooted in it.  It’s almost as high as the vases.  Not pretty.  So sad.

name: Rick Jenkins
text: My Grandparents and my sister are here. Owners do not take care of the grounds. Every Memorial Day weekend you can go and see family after family who have to bring rakes, brooms, weed eaters and cleaners to care for the final resting place of their loved ones. My mother was told “decoration day” is a community led event and they are not responsible. That’s true. They are not “responsible“ at all and no family member should be left in the destructive and incapable hands of this cemetery. Families should only have to visit on Decoration day to dress the graves with flowers. We should not be having to do your job!!! If you KNOW that families visit this time of year, you should have mowed the grass a day or two before. Aside from that you should care for your grounds regularly...Today families were gathered around upset of the state this place was in. It was a tragedy to see 70 year old widows on their knees trimming weeds. You should be ashamed of yourselves Memorial Gardens!!

name: David Lecroy
text:
This place is where my family's laid to rest,  after I came back to visit my family,s grave  I was aploed at the way Marshall Membre
gardens  looked it was in the worst shape I've ever seen in 50 years. Of my life and I  mean my whole family .  And I was so ashame of what I seen . I don't know who's in charge of  taking the money to take care of the place that my family paid to be laid to rest here. After my father who died at the age of 38 yrs. old and this was not a last minute decision because he  knew sense he was 34 yrs. old and my mother and him had five years to pick a place to be laid to rest that he would be proud to have his family to come and visit him. And now my mother has been laid to rest beside him. And her father and mother all of here 7 brothers ana the rest of their family's also. I  know a whole lot of my family  too. I  think back when I was 10 years old and the family was looking for a nice place to be laid to rest. But it is a disgrace of the way the people in charge are taking the funds that they charged to take care of the place. I know my family are turning over in their grave.

name: nicole mcclendon
text: The only time these people are nice and accommodating is when money is involved before the check clears so to say

name: Lisa Bailey
text:
My name is Mickey Bailey
My grandfather Jack Bailey was a retired police officer and is buried here, along side my maw maw.

This place is a disgrace of a cemetery. The owners n groundskeepers DO NOT  take care in watching what they are doing when mowing.. ..
The head stone on my grandparents grave the vase is broken and can not be repaired.
So very upset!!!

name: Michael Gipson
text: Awful they way they take care of it wait from looks they don't

name: Jason Chamblee
text: Went to visit my dads grave in Feb 2019 because it was his birthday. There was several equipmemt tracks across several graves in the area.  I called the office to ask they to look at fixing it and as of 3/17/19 it still has not been fixed.  Also a office employee "Savannah" i believe is her name came to my dads grave and asked me to leave the property because i took a picture of my dads grave.  She said it was private property and the owner wanted me removed.  Another lady i believe "Courtney" in the funeral home called the police and had me pulled over when i left the cemetery.  After stating the facts to the police about my visit to the cemetery they did say it was NOT PRIVATE PROPERTY. Memory lane is a county road that goes down beside the cemetery.  Its time we stop being bullied and taken advantage of because families care!!!  Something is done with the employees, stock holders and owners.  WILL NEVER USE THIS PLACE AGAIN!!

name: Diane Baldwin
text: They need major updates. They treat people that have family in the Garden there like no one. And removed flowers. I can see remove them a couple of weeks from Decorations. I do floral arrangements and they aren’t cheap and when you put on for some one and they go and they are gone it’s like you never put them on. Thank Goodness I take pictures of them.

name: Stacey Adams
text: My father passed away this past week and we had preplannwd 3 years ago with Marahall Memorial. Dawn and her staff we so amazing during our difficult time. It was such a relief for us to go in and everything dad had planned was honored. It was exactly like Dawn has explained 3 years prior. Thanks again for everything, especially the caring comfort you all provided. We highly recommend using them.

name: Vickie Elizardo
text: This place is a travesty.  I am so sorry that I have family buried there, including my beloved grandparents.  The staff is beyond rude.

name: Suzanne Ray
text:
The home works in conjunction with Hampton Cove Funeral Home and I gave them the same review.
Unprofessional!! If I could give 0 stars I would. The woman [Janet, I believe was her name] in charge of arrangements was an hour late to our scheduled meeting (the meeting to pay for the funeral) which in turn made us late to the actual service AND she was extremely disorganized in handling the paperwork. This is ridiculous-when a family is grieving, planning a funeral should NOT be this stressful. She didn't even call to let us know she would be late, WE had to call the funeral home to see where she was; then we had to wait in the car because no one else was at the home to unlock the doors!

name: Mended Inc
text: You can tell that this company really cares about families they work with.  I appreciated the communication and transparency from the staff.

name: Michelle Strickland
text: DO NOT USE THIS CEMETERY! When one of our family members was buried here, it took multiple phone calls from us begging them to mow the grass before the funeral service. Then, it took over SIX MONTHS for the foot stone to be put down. When his spouse passed, she was buried here as well. It has been SIX WEEKS since the funeral service, and the dead flowers are still on the grave and the dirt has not been filled in. After multiple phone calls and visits, we have only gotten excuses, including weather issues, short-handed staff, and the cemetery’s financial struggles. Their motto is “When Caring Counts,” but trust me, your loved one will NOT be cared for here.

name: Robert Isbell
text: My dad was there on November 1, 2013.  Even after a long and debilitating illness, they prepared him in a way that made him look natural and as if he were only asleep.  Their staff is very kind, and I would definitely recommend Marshall Memorial Funeral Home to anyone needing their services.

name: Oscar Morgan
text: My father passed away on May 8th, 2016 in California.  I worked with a local funeral home to prepare him for transport back to Alabama, and selected Marshall Memorial Funeral Home, as his mother and father are buried in Marshall Memory Gardens Cemetery.  Stan and Dawn at Marshall Memorial Funeral Home did an outstanding job of managing all of the complexities of working with the California funeral home to arrange for his transportation and finalizing the arrangements.  Stan was instrumental in securing the services of the Albertville Masonic Lodge and the United States Air Force Honor Guard from Maxwell Air Force Base to honor my father.  The viewing, chapel service, and graveside services were very well done, and we could not have been happier with the service.

name: Tammy Pursley
text: My husband David and my Daddy are both laid to rest there..Everyone there has always been very sweet and very helpful!!!

name: Lenie Mahan
text: The attendant was truly remarkable.

name: Dustin Wenninger
text:
USE THIS BUISNESS
By far the best funeral home around, the price was a fraction of the cost from the other funeral homes around.  The staff was very understanding and were very easy to work with.  The Chaplin they provided for my Dad's funeral did an amazing job and was included in the price.  At such a bad time for me, they put me and my family first.

name: Laura Briggs
text: I recently had an unfortunate death in my family. It's one that no parent ever wants to experience. My youngest son passed away. I had family calling to see prices etc and after doing so I called Mobile Funeral Home and Crematory. I spoke with Mr. Jim (the owner) from the beginning. Let me say this I am probably a little difficult at times and at this point I know I was scatter brained so keep that in mind. I couldn't make up my mind for nothing, Jim and Robin were so compassionate, and nice that my decisions came quickly once I was face to face with them. They went above and beyond anything they really had to ever do for myself and my family. For it to be the most difficult time in my life, they sure made it a pleasure if that makes sense. I thank y'all for everything and y'all will always be forever my first to recommend or God forbid use of I ever need be. Mobile Funeral Home and Crematory is awesome.

name: Sherry Woodard
text: I highly recommend Mobile Funeral Home and Crematory.  Jim and his staff went beyond my expectations after the passing of my husband in March.  Not only did Mobile Funeral Home beat all area prices within 100 miles of me.  But it was their kindness, Sincerity and down-home hospitality that made a big difference during my loss.  And no matter how many times I called Robin with questions or needed help filling out papers, she was always kind and helpful.  Jim will always be my first choice if the situation arises again.  Jim is a professional and shows respect to the family and to their loved one.  Thank You Jim and Robin for seeing us through this difficult time.

name: Valerie Mobile
text: Mobile Funeral Home and Cremation comes highly recommended by my family. They are very accommodating and were able to provide visitation, services in their chapel and burial within a week when our daughter passed.  Cremation services are performed at their location as well. Special thank you to Robin and Jim for a job well done.

name: Jennifer Slawson Brown Collier
text: I would highly recommend to everyone.  The staff went above and beyond to help our family get through such a difficult time.  My nephew Matthew Bailey Busch was only 24 and we lost him unexpectedly.  Jim and Robin did everything they could to make all of us comfortable and helped us so much when trying to completely our final arrangements. Thank y'all so much for all you did.

name: Travis Northcutt
text: My father passed away last month and Jim, Robin, and Mandy were the best! They were very professional, graceful in a difficult time and you literally cannot be the price. From start to finish, they were professional and helped us through a very difficult time. We feel like our loved on was handled with respect and dignity and they were upfront about everything. Thank you for everything.

name: Makenzie Rojeski
text: I just want to take the time to say thank you Mr. Jim and staff for going above and beyond during a very hard time of losing someone very near to my heart.(Bailey) You helped his mom (Laura) every step of the way and I can’t thank you enough! From the first time I called to get prices for Mrs. Laura I knew this was the right place. Thank y’all again for everything!

name: mary shepherd
text: Jim and Robin are wonderful, I have utilized their services twice now and service was so good start to finish! I would definitely recommend them to anyone!

name: Cindy Coker
text: I wish I could give more than 5 stars. This place went above and beyond taking care of our sweet fur baby's unexpected passing. They are first class, very professional and caring. Thank you for your wonderful service - it was a true blessing during an incredibly sad time. Highly recommend PAWS of Athens.

name: Marianne Uptigrove
text:
My beloved boxer of a little over 13 years died at home on December 2, 2018. Since I live  1 1/2 hours away I had to wait until the next day to get her to "PAWS" , Lisa greeted me  as I arrived and was so professional in all she did, and since I drove that distance she made sure that I could bring my beloved Lexi back home that same day.
I would highly recommend using their service. The drive there for me was well worth it and the prices were great.
Thank you so much for caring.
Sincerely
Marianne
Arley, Alabama

name: Jennifer Deckleman
text:
I can not express enough thankfulness for the way they handled my baby Zeus. I had my urn and three necklace urns that I sent with Zeus. They were all returned promptly.

To everyone involved with the cremation of Zeus, I can not tell you enough, thank you!

In speaking with the staff on the phone, they were very professional and comforting. I would most definitely recommend Paws Memorial Service to everyone that desires cremation for their fur babies.

Again, thank you for your services.

name: Derek Dornellas
text: What an amazing place with great people. Truly care about what they do and comfort you during your hard time. Would highly recommend them to anyone who wants to bring their furry friend back home in a nice urn(great selection for all price ranges). Thanks alot Erica and Greg for the comfort you provided us during our hard times.

name: Anna Harvey
text: I cannot say enough good things about this place. They went above and beyond all of our expectations and made an extremely difficult time much easier. Our beloved dog had to be put down unexpectedly and we wanted to have him privately cremated. We were referred to Paws Memorial by our vet. Erika was so kind and caring to speak to on the phone. The whole process was very simple and well explained. The wooden urn we chose was perfect and it arrived back at our vet earlier than expected. There was a beautiful poem along with a thoughtful card from their staff. They really went above and beyond and we are so grateful they handled our dogs cremation.

name: Malette Felker
text: These wonderful people went above and beyond what is expected from a crematorium.  They conducted their business swiftly so that my darling was back home soon, they presented her remains in a respectful and gentle way (in a quality box wrapped in a velvet pouch) and they went  far as as creating a custom ceramic with her paw print and name, a keepsake I will cherish always.  Absolutely the kind of compassion we need in times like this.

name: Sonia Powaser
text: We lost our wonderful GS mix last week and chose a private cremation through our vet who utilized the services of Paws Memorial.  I have never done a private cremation and wasn't sure what to expect.  Their service is truly top of the line - we received our boys ashes in a beautiful wooden box with his name engraved on a metal plaque - along with the box, we received a sympathy card, an explanation of the services, a beautiful poem and a few extras.  It is so comforting to know that our boy was treated with respect and was cremated with the dignity he deserved.  We are so happy and while I didn't interact with the company directly, I want to express my sincere gratitude for the sympathetic and respectful way they do business for what truly are our beloved family members.

name: Jennifer Hall
text: We lost our 15 year old shitzu 2 weeks ago and my vet office recommended these sweet people. I have never had to have a pet cremated and I couldn’t have been sent to a more wonderful group of people to handle it.  It was quick and the attention to all the details is honestly amazing you can tell they care about what they do and for people in need of their service this makes a world of difference! Thank you all for making one of the hardest things I have ever had to do somewhat bearable

name: Amber Bendele
text: I had a coworker tell me about paws when we lost our freddie suddenly. They got back to use so quickly,they where so understanding and patience and kind.They treated Freddie like one of their own,let us say good bye and be with him for however long we needed.walked us through picking out his urn(box) and the whole process. Its truely beautiful and such wonderful people.thank you!

name: Ashelyn Nichols
text: I highly recommend this amazing company they went above and beyond for me and my sweet cj I cannot thank them enough for everything they have done for me through this difficult time!

name: Paula Steele
text: I lost my baby girl Miss Doodoo on 8/15/2020. I wanted her to be cremated so that I could have her near me still. PAWS picked her up,  they called me to verify exactly what I wanted and just so helpful during this sad time. I highly recommend them if you're considering having your pet cremated. They had my baby back to me in 3 days. The package they give you is wonderful. THANK YOU SO MUCH!

name: mckenzie mack
text: I cannot recommend this business enough- professional, fast, and you can tell they truly care. I hate we had to use them, but am so very thankful we found such a wonderful company to take such good care of our little Ladybug.

name: Brandy Ellingworth
text: I just had to say goodbye to my best friend of 14 years. PAWS was quick to get him back to me and the presentation and way I received him back was beyond beautiful. The way they put so much love into his cremation meant the world to me. They did an incredible job and I couldn’t be more grateful! Thank you!

name: Laurie Callahan
text: I don't leave a lot of reviews, but when I do, it's usually because the business I'm reviewing has gone above and beyond my expectations.  Paws Memorial Services is just such a business, and I'm so grateful for their kindness and compassion during this very difficult time.  Our sweet bulldog, Lucy, passed away on Wednesday and by Friday morning, they had delivered her ashes back to us in a beautiful urn. They did so many things to acknowledge and respect our precious girl, and as other reviewers have conveyed, there aren't enough words to express my gratitude.  I am so thankful that there are people out there who are willing to step into our shoes as pet lovers and walk with us through the heartbreak.  Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

name: Debi Moses
text: Erica and her staff are very compassionate, kind, and professional. Words cannot explain how wonderful they ALL are! I highly recommend them to anyone who wants piece of mind knowing they will treat your beloved pet with much love and respect they deserve.....

name: keyna pendleton
text: Its been 2 weeks since Jayda my Maltese of 12 years passed away unexpectedly I am so glad I decided to creamate her the urn is beautiful I  will always recommend you all to anyone I feel her presence every day and it helps my broken  heart heal better

name: Elise Schrenk
text: Thank you so much for your beautiful presentation. My mind was finally put at peace after the passing of our sweet Leia. Paws gave us a folder with sweet sentiments to go along with a beautiful box with her remains. You definitely made the experience easier and less painful. God bless everyone over there, you are definitely his angels on Earth.

name: Robert L & Teresa Massey Martin
text: We recently required the services of PAWS for the second time in 3 years. The Sicklers are just the best. They have a spotlessly clean facility, full of light and pleasantly decorated which is a huge help when you are so heart broken, upset and emotional over the loss of your pet. They are true professionals and are trustworthy in everything they present to you about their services. Best of all they truly understand what a pet means to their owner and do everything possible to honor you wishes and ease your concerns. Before our first poodle passed away I called Erica a couple of times with what would be a premature "day of need'. She understood how a pet's condition can improve, even if for only a few hours if not days, and patiently offered support until that day did finally arrive. You will not be disappointed in having your pet's final needs met by Erica & Billy Sickler and they fine staff.

name: Susan Fricks
text: My sweet Yorkshire Buster died suddenly. Paws made the heartbreak easier with their excellent presentation and compassion.

name: Erica Rogers
text: Erica & everyone there have always been so nice and helpful. I'm thankful to know someone as kind as they are will be there in a time of need. My sweet boy's remains were returned to me in a beautiful presentation. Thank you Paws.

name: B Banister
text: We have had to use Paws twice in the past 4 years when our dogs have passed away. I cannot say in words how much we appreciated everything they did for us from the moment we called to make arrangements to when they delivered our dog remains back to us. Both times we were treated with the utmost professionalism and compassion that made the entire process as painless as possible.  I would recommend this company to anyone.

name: Barry
text: Our feline “baby”, Tula, died unexpectedly Jan. 29, 2020, and Paws Memorials in Athens handled her cremation. Words cannot express how pleased we were with the exceptional, caring service provided during a difficult time. Amanda greeted us with compassion at the door upon our arrival and she and Jill were patient and helpful while we decided on the perfect urn. We chose a mahogany Pibwhurst photo urn and then were allowed ample time to say goodbye to Tula, who was 9 years, 6 months old. We returned the following morning to bring Tula home and were again greeted with compassion. Along with Tula’s cremains, we were given a folder that included a certificate of cremation, a sympathy card signed by the staff, and a Rainbow Bridge poem bookmark with a removable adornment that, when planted, blossoms into wildflowers.The facility itself is beautiful and spotlessly clean and prices for services are reasonably priced and affordable. Although we are heartbroken  to lose Tula, we are forever grateful to Paws for helping make our loss less painful. And to Amanda and Jill, you were our angels. Thank you so much.

name: Marcelyn “Marcy” English
text: My sweet 10 year old English bulldog died suddenly while I was traveling through Huntsville, AL.    I contacted Paws Memorial after leaving my pup with the emergency vet and they were amazing.  Paws (Erica) patiently walked me through the process (giving me time to gather my thoughts from crying so much), sweetly addressed my concerns of making sure I received only my pets ashes, picked her up from the vet (called to personally confirm she  was a brindle and white bulldog) then delivered her ashes to me the following day.     I’m distraught at losing my sweet Zoe but these wonderful people made an extremely hard situation better.  Thank you so very much.

name: Dorcas Harris
text: We recently lost our beloved Boston Terrier and knew that we wanted her remains to be cremated so we could scatter her ashes in our garden.  The people at PAWS Memorial were absolutely wonderful to deal with.  They were informative, courteous, respectful and very sympathetic to our feelings of loss and sadness.  Their facility is immaculate and the services they offer are first-class yet affordable.  I would recommend PAWS to anyone experiencing the loss of a cherished family pet.

name: Nicole Yost
text: We are so happy with our experience with Paws Memorial, and we are so thankful for the services they provide. It brought us so much peace and closure to be able to bring our baby home. It's a tragic experience to lose a pet, but Paws made it a more peaceful transition for us. They have a wide variety of urns, and ours turned out beautiful!

name: Margot Dawson
text: We lost our beloved dog recently and had her privately cremated at Paws Memorial. The whole experience was professional and healing from start to finish. Very caring and compassionate service. I recommend Paws Memorial to anyone who has lost a cherished pet. We received the urn today and I'm really surprised by the feeling of closure it has brought to know our dog's remains are safe with us and were treated with dignity and respect throughout this process.

name: Jordan K
text: They were very easy to work with and accommodating to our needs. I highly recommend them, they have a nice setup out in the country and will allow you to view the whole process if you want. I have read lots of horror stories of pet cremations going awry and people getting mixed ashes, sometimes not even their own pets ashes. They were very understanding with my concerns and made sure that this didn't happen. They are good people and will take good care of your beloved pet.

name: Pam Whalen and Friends Band
text: They took such excellent care with my baby Zep

name: adam Simbeck
text: Our Great Dane recently passed away... I'm so thankful to these people for the service they provide... My wife and I are  having a hard time getting over this but we couldn't imagine doing this without them... They've been extremely accommodating to us... I'm thanking them again for helping us...

name: Pam Whalen and Friends Band
text: They took such excellent care with my baby Zep

name: Richard McBay
text: Awesome group of ladies. I can’t say enough good things about this place.

name: Justin Woodard
text: Our baby, Koda, had cancer and it got to be very aggressive. We had to make some decisions and it was the hardest decision to have to make. We had to have her put to sleep. The agony of having to do this was beyond any I’ve ever felt. I spoke with Erica with PAWS. She was extremely compassionate, caring, and understanding. I don’t know how to express how pleased we are with her and all of PAWS. We will definitely recommend them. When we picked up the urn it also came with a few other things that we did not expect and they were very comforting. I hope Erica and PAWS knows just what a blessing they are. Thank you all so much!

name: Village Veterinary Clinic
text: I work at Village Veterinary Clinic and we use PAWS as our cremation service. They are the most respectful group of people to work with. They always go above and beyond for our clients! Thank you for your excellent service!

name: Alexa Ward
text: Such a caring and sensitive company. I would recommend them to anyone who has lost a pet. Very professional.

name: Lindsey Hardt
text: Amazing!

name: Kelley Douglas
text:
Everything was above expectations. Very professional. They made everything easy. My mother's appearance was just amazing. Janice was instrumental in getting the tribute pics loaded.

Thanks to everyone.

resp.text: Kelley, thank you for allowing us to go above and beyond your expectations during this time, as Janice and our staff always want to provide the professional and easy service needed throughout this process.  It was an honor to be there for you during your beloved mother's arrangements and tribute and I hope you will reach out if there is anything more that we can do for you.  -Leslie Hanke, General Manager

name: Josh Davis
text:
If you want to bury your loved ones with dignity, I’d suggest you to use any other service. I was berated by 3 different employees/directors. They gave us a run around, put my grandmother in the wrong casket and 3 months later, still refuse to admit any wrongdoing. I was late to my grandmothers funeral because i was being threatened with additional costs/fees. They did not communicate  with the company at the gravesite. They communicated very poorly with us and made decisions against our wishes. Worst of all, they didn’t tell us about any of the shady business until i came to view the body 2 hours before the funeral, when she was in the wrong casket. These people don’t care about your hardships and suffering. They’re only in this for money it seems and they are very careful to avoid admitting any fault in any of it. Extremely unprofessional, especially on one of the hardest times my family has ever dealt with.

Please reconsider another funeral home if you want your deceased loved ones wishes to be carried out. I can’t express how disrespectful and ugly they were to my grieving family.

0/10 do NOT recommend. Don’t deal with Rick or Lisa because they are either incompetent or just plain hateful.

resp.text: Josh, as we care deeply for those who come to us it is never our intention to add stress of hardship during such a difficult time.  Please contact me at Leslie.Hanke@dignitymemorial.com so that I may personally address your concerns regarding your experience with Rick, Lisa and the issues with your beloved grandmother's incorrect casket and communication.  Thank you for your feedback and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Leslie Hanke, General Manager

name: Fran Middleton
text: Treated my husband with utmost consideration for our family and respect for him.  I recommend them totally.

resp.text: Fran, receiving feedback like yours truly reaffirms our commitment to offering exceptional and respectful care. From everyone here, thank you very much for sharing.  -Leslie Hanke, General Manager

Up to date. Our experience was definitely a 5 star.

We take comfort in being able to make this process less difficult for those we serve, and we are only a phone call away any time you need assistance. -Stephen Ulmer, General Manager

name: Kim Kliner
text: These people are awful!!!! My parents bought their plots and didn’t tell them that nobody can dig their graves but them!!!! $2,000 to dig a grave!! Y’all are a joke!!! Prey on the elderly!!!

resp.text: Kim, this is certainly not the impression we want to leave you with, and I am grateful that you took a moment to reach out. Please allow me to connect with you and ensure your concerns are addressed, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Stephen.Ulmer@dignitymemorial.com at your earliest convenience. I appreciate your communication, and I look forward to speaking with you. -Stephen Ulmer, General Manager

name: Debbie Hathcock
text:
We all have talents and a calling in life if you will....
The three of you were called to do a job that not all of us can do. Molly Ward, Melanie Dollar and
Don Walker, my family and I would like to thank each of you so very much for your kindness and compassion during a time that was so unexpected in our lives. The three of you know the details, and we will forever be grateful for your help.
Deborah Hathcock, Kristen Bardill and Family

resp.text: Your kind message is appreciated by everyone here, Debbie, as we know how hard this was for you and your family. I am so touched that you allowed us to provide support and guidance throughout this journey. Please know that we are at your service, should you need anything at all and I will bring your kind words to Molly, Melanie, and Don. -Stephen Ulmer, General Manager

name: Jon Stewart
text: They are very professional and do their jobs like no others. Nice to have Mr. Stephen Ulmer, back in Tuscaloosa as the new General Manager. Thanks for all you do Memory Chapel. We appreciate you.

-Stephen Ulmer, General Manager

text: I wish I knew how they treated people and treats the grounds. EVERY-TIME WE PUT THEM OUT,  SOMEONE STEALS THEM. YOU BETTER THINK TWICE ABOUT PUTTING ANYTHING NICE OR ANYTHING OF MEMORY IT WILL GET STOLEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you are looking at laying YOUR loved one or a friend to rest here you better think twice.  There was also some other things that happened during the time we were working with them during my dads funeral arrangements.  RUDE and RUDE until I called them out on it.  THINK TWICE!!
